sentence: West and southwestern Alaska are home to the Yup'ik, while their cousins the Alutiiq ~ Sugpiaq lived in what is now south-central Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: Some researchers believe that the first Russian colony in Alaska was established in the seventeenth century.

name: alaska
sentence: According to this hypothesis, in 1648 several koches of the Semyon Dejnyov expedition came to land in Alaska by storm and founded this colony.

name: alaska
sentence: This hypothesis is based on the testimony of the geographer of Chukchi Nikolai Daurkin, who had visited Alaska in 1764–65 and who had reported on a village on the Kheuveren River, populated by "bearded men" who "pray to icons".

name: alaska
sentence: Some modern researchers associate Kheuveren with the Koyuk River.

name: alaska
sentence: The first European ship to reach Alaska was generally considered the Saint Gabriel under the authority of the surveyor M. S. Gvozdev and the assistant navigator I. Fyodorov on August 21, 1732, during an expedition of the Siberian Cossack A. F. Shestakov and the Russian explorer Dmitry Pavlutsky (1729–135).

name: alaska
sentence: Another European contact with Alaska took place in 1741, when Vitus Bering led an expedition for the Russian navy aboard the St. Peter's.

name: alaska
sentence: After the return of his crew to Russia with sea otter skins deemed to be the most beautiful furs in the world, small associations of fur traders began sailing from the coast of Siberia to the Aleutian Islands.

name: alaska
sentence: The first permanent European colony was established in 1784.

name: alaska
sentence: Between 1774 and 1800 Spain sent several expeditions to Alaska to assert its claim to the Northwest Pacific.

name: alaska
sentence: In 1789 a Spanish colony and a fort were built at Nootka Sound.

name: alaska
sentence: These expeditions gave names to places such as Valdez, Bucareli Sound and Cordova.

name: alaska
sentence: Later, the Russian-American Company conducted an expanded settlement program from the beginning to the mid-19th century.

name: alaska
sentence: Sitka, renamed New Archangel from 1804 to 1867, on Baranof Island in the Alexander Archipelago, in what is now southeastern Alaska, became the capital of Russian America.

name: alaska
sentence: It remained the capital after the transfer of the colony to the United States.

name: alaska
sentence: The Russians never completely colonized Alaska, and the colony was never very profitable.

name: alaska
sentence: Evidence of Russian settlement in names and churches survive throughout southeastern Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: William H. Seward, Secretary of State of the United States, negotiated the purchase of Alaska (also known as Seward's Folly) with the Russians in 1867 for $7.2 million.

name: alaska
sentence: The contemporary leader of Russia, Tsar Alexander II, Emperor of the Russian Empire, King of Poland and Grand Duke of Finland, also planned the sale; the purchase was made on 30 March 1867.

name: alaska
sentence: Six months later, the commissioners arrived in Sitka and the official transfer was organized; the official collection of the flag took place in Fort Sitka on 18 October 1867.

name: alaska
sentence: During the ceremony, 250 American soldiers in uniform walked to the governor's house in "Castle Hill", where Russian troops lowered the Russian flag and the American flag was lifted.

name: alaska
sentence: This event is celebrated as Alaska Day, a holiday on October 18.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska was initially little governed by the army, and was administered as a district from 1884, with a governor appointed by the President of the United States.

name: alaska
sentence: A federal district court had its headquarters in Sitka.

name: alaska
sentence: For most of the first decade of Alaska under the flag of the United States, Sitka was the only community inhabited by American settlers.

name: alaska

sentence: Legislation allowing Alaskan communities to legally integrate as cities only came into force in 1900, and the city residence rule was extremely limited or unavailable until the state came into force in 1959.

name: alaska
sentence: From the 1890s to the early 1910s gold rushes in Alaska and adjacent Yukon territory brought thousands of miners and settlers to Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska was officially incorporated into a territory organized in 1912.

sentence: The capital of Alaska, which was in Sitka until 1906, was moved north as far as Juneau.

sentence: During the Second World War, the Aleutian Islands campaign concentrated on Attu, Agattu and Kiska, all occupied by the Japanese Empire.

name: alaska
sentence: The Alaska Heritage Resources Survey (AHRS) is a restricted inventory of all historical and prehistoric sites reported in the state of Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: The survey's inventory of cultural resources includes objects, structures, buildings, sites, districts and means of travel, with a general provision that they are over 50 years of age.

name: alaska
sentence: As of 31 January 2012, more than 35,000 sites had been reported.

name: alaska
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that Alaska's population was 731,545 on July 1, 2019, an increase of 3.00 per cent over the 2010 U.S. census.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska is the least densely populated state, and one of the most sparsely populated regions in the world, with 1.2 inhabitants per square kilometre (0.46/km2), and the next state, Wyoming, with 5.8 inhabitants per square kilometre (2.2/km2).

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska is by far the largest American state by region, and the tenth richest country (income per capita).

sentence: In November 2014, the state's unemployment rate was 6.6 per cent.In 2018, it was one of the 14 U.S. states that still had only one regional indicator.

sentence: In terms of race and ethnicity, the state was 66.7% White (64.1% non-Hispanic whites), 14.8% Alaska Native Americans, 5.4% Asians, 3.3% Blacks or Afro-Americans, 1.0% Hawaii Native Americans and other Pacific Islanders, 1.6% other races and 7.3% two or more races.

sentence: According to statistics collected by the Association of Religion Data Archives in 2010, approximately 34% of Alaskans were members of religious congregations.

sentence: About 4 per cent are Mormons, 0.5 per cent Jews, 1 per cent Muslims, 0.5 per cent Buddhists, 0.2 per cent Baha'is and 0.5 per cent Hindus.

name: alaska
sentence: The largest religious denominations in Alaska in 2010 were the Catholic Church with 50,866 adherents, the non-denominational evangelical Protestants with 38,070 adherents, the Church of Jesus Christ of the Last Days Saints with 32,170 adherents, and the Southern Baptist Convention with 19,891 adherents.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska has been identified, as well as the Pacific Northwest States Washington and Oregon, as the least religious states in the United States, in terms of church membership,

sentence: Marriage with Alaskan natives helped Russian immigrants integrate into society.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska also has the largest population of Quaker (percentage) in all states.

sentence: In 2009, there were 6,000 Jews in Alaska (for which compliance with the halakha could pose particular problems).

name: alaska
sentence: Hindus in Alaska often share places and celebrations with members of other Asian religious communities, including Sikhs and Jains.

name: alaska
sentence: In 2010, the Hindus of Alaska established the Sri Gansha Temple of Alaska, making it the first Hindu temple in Alaska and the most northerly Hindu temple in the world.

name: alaska
sentence: It is estimated there are between 2,000 and 3,000 Hindus in Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: The great majority of Hindus live in Anchorage or Fairbanks.

name: alaska
sentence: Estimates of the number of Muslims in Alaska range from 2,000 to 5,000.

sentence: According to a 2013 study conducted by Phoenix Marketing International, Alaska had the fifth largest number of millionaires per capita in the United States, with a ratio of 6.75%.

name: alaska
sentence: The oil and gas industry dominates the Alaskan economy, with over 80% of the government's revenues from oil extraction.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska's main export product (excluding oil and natural gas) is sea fish, mainly salmon, cod, Pollock and crab.

name: alaska
sentence: Agriculture accounts for a very small fraction of Alaska's economy.

name: alaska
sentence: Agricultural production is mainly intended for consumption within the state and includes nurseries, dairy products, vegetables and livestock.

name: alaska
sentence: Manufacturing is limited, with most food and general goods imported elsewhere.

name: alaska
sentence: Employment primarily affects government and industries such as natural resource extraction, marine transportation and transportation.

name: alaska
sentence: Military bases are an important component of the economy of Fairbanks North Star, Anchorage and Kodiak Island, as well as Kodiak.

name: alaska
sentence: Federal subsidies are also an important part of the economy, allowing the state to keep taxes low.

name: alaska
sentence: Its industrial products include crude oil, natural gas, coal, gold, precious metals, zinc and other extractive industries, seafood processing, wood and wood products.

name: alaska
sentence: There is also a growing services and tourism sector.

name: alaska
sentence: Tourists contributed to the economy by supporting local housing.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska has extensive energy resources, although its oil reserves have been largely depleted.

name: alaska
sentence: Significant oil and gas reserves were found in the Alaska North Slope (ANS) and Cook Inlet basins, but according to the Energy Information Administration, in February 2014, Alaska had fallen to fourth place in crude oil production after Texas, North Dakota and California.

name: alaska
sentence: Prudhoe Bay on the northern slope of Alaska is still the second-high-yielding oil field in the United States, usually producing about 400,000 barrels per day (64,000 m3/d), although at the beginning of 2014, the Bakken North Dakota Formation produced more than 900,000 barrels per day (140,000 m3/d).

name: alaska
sentence: Prudhoe Bay is the largest conventional oil deposit ever found in North America, but it is much smaller than the huge Athabasca oil sands deposit in Canada, which produces approximately 1,500 000 barrels per day in 2014 (240,000 m3/d) of unconventional oil, and has hundreds of years of productive reserves at this rate.

name: alaska
sentence: The Trans-Alaska pipeline can transport and pump up to 2.1 million barrels (330,000 m3) of crude oil per day, more than any other crude oil pipeline in the United States.

name: alaska
sentence: In addition, significant coal deposits are found in Alaska's bituminous, subbituminous, and lignite basins.

name: alaska
sentence: The United States Geological Survey estimates that there are 85.4 trillion cubic feet (2,420 km3) of undiscovered and technically recoverable gas from natural gas hydrates on the northern slope of Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska also has some of the country's highest hydroelectric potential from its many rivers.

name: alaska
sentence: Large areas of the Alaskan coast also offer wind and geothermal energy potential.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska's economy relies heavily on increasingly expensive diesel fuel for heating, transportation, electricity and light.

name: alaska
sentence: Although wind and hydroelectric power is abundant and underdeveloped, proposals for state-wide energy systems (e.g.:

name: alaska
sentence: It was found not to be cost-effective (at the time of reporting, 2001) due to low fuel prices (less than 50¢/gal), long distances, and low population.

name: alaska
sentence: The cost of one gallon of gas in urban Alaska is generally thirty to sixty cents higher than the national average; prices in rural areas are generally much higher, but vary greatly depending on transportation costs, seasonal peaks of use, nearby oil development infrastructure and many other factors.

name: alaska
sentence: The Alaska Permanent Fund is an allocation authorized by the Constitution of Oil Revenues, established by voters in 1976 to manage a surplus of the state's oil revenues, largely in anticipation of the recently constructed trans-alaska pipeline network.

name: alaska
sentence: The fund was originally proposed by Governor Keith Miller on the eve of the sale of the Prudhoe Bay lease in 1969, for fear that the legislature would spend all the proceeds of the sale (i.e. $900 million) at the same time.

name: alaska
sentence: He was then defended by Governor Jay Hammond and State representative Kenai Hugh Malone.

name: alaska
sentence: It has always served as an attractive political perspective, diverting revenues that would normally be deposited into the general fund.

name: alaska
sentence: The Alaskan Constitution was drafted to discourage the allocation of public funds for a particular purpose.

name: alaska
sentence: The Permanent Fund has become the rare exception to this, mainly because of the political climate of distrust that existed at the time of its creation.

name: alaska
sentence: From its initial capital of $734,000, the fund has increased to $50 billion due to oil royalties and capital investment programs.

name: alaska
sentence: Most, if not all, of the capital is invested cautiously outside Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: This has led Alaskan politicians to ask the Fund to invest in Alaska, although such a position has never gained momentum.

name: alaska
sentence: Beginning in 1982, dividends from the annual growth of the fund were paid each year to eligible Alaskans, ranging from an initial amount of $1,000 in 1982 (equal to three years of payment, since the distribution of payments was suspended in a distribution plan prosecution) to $3,269 in 2008 (which included a one-time amount of $1,200 "Resource Rebate").

name: alaska
sentence: Each year, the state legislature withdraws 8% of the earnings, gives 3% to the capital for proof of inflation, and the remaining 5% is distributed to all eligible Alaskans.

name: alaska
sentence: To be eligible for the dividend of the Permanent Fund, one must have lived in the State for at least 12 months, maintain permanent residence subject to authorized absences and not be subject to judicial judgements or criminal convictions that fall within various categories of exclusion or may subject the amount of the payment to civil arrest.

name: alaska
sentence: The Permanent Fund is often seen as one of the main examples of a "core income" policy in the world.

name: alaska
sentence: The cost of goods in Alaska has long been higher than in the 48 adjacent states.

name: alaska
sentence: Federal government employees, particularly U.S. Postal Service (USPS) employees and active members, receive a subsistence allowance normally set at 25% of basic pay because, although the cost of living has decreased, it remains one of the highest in the country.

name: alaska
sentence: Rural Alaska has extremely high prices for food and consumer goods compared to the rest of the country, due to relatively limited transportation infrastructure.

name: alaska
sentence: Due to the northern climate and the short growing season, there is relatively little agriculture in Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: Most of the farms are located either in the Matanuska Valley, about 64 km northeast of Anchorage, or on the Kenai Peninsula, about 97 km southwest of Anchorage.

name: alaska
sentence: The short 100-day growing season limits crops that can be grown, but the long summer sunny days make for productive growing seasons.

name: alaska
sentence: The main crops are potatoes, carrots, lettuce, and cabbage.

name: alaska
sentence: The Tanana Valley is another notable agricultural site, particularly the Delta Junction area, about 160 km southeast of Fairbanks, with a large concentration of farms growing agronomic crops, which are mainly to the north and east of Fort Greely.

name: alaska
sentence: This region was largely set aside and developed as part of a state programme led by Hammond during his second term as governor.

name: alaska
sentence: Crops in the delta area consist mainly of barley and hay.

name: alaska
sentence: To the west of Fairbanks is another concentration of small farms that deal with restaurants, the hotel and tourism industry and community-supported agriculture.

name: alaska
sentence: In recent years, Alaskan agriculture has seen strong growth in market gardeners, small farms and agricultural markets, with the largest percentage increase (46%) in agricultural market growth in the country in 2011, compared to 17% nationally.

name: alaska
sentence: The peony industry has also taken off, as the growing season allows farmers to harvest during a supply gap elsewhere in the world, filling a niche on the flower market.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska, with no county, lacks county fairs.

name: alaska
sentence: However, a small assortment of state and local fairs (with Alaska's largest state fair in Palmer) take place mainly in late summer.

name: alaska
sentence: Fairs are primarily located in communities with historical or current farming activities, and feature local farmers exhibiting products in addition to more publicized commercial activities such as carnival walks, concerts and food.

name: alaska
sentence: "Alaska Grown" is used as an agricultural slogan.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska has an abundance of seafood, with major fisheries in the Bering Sea and the North Pacific.

name: alaska
sentence: Seafood is one of the few foods that are often cheaper within the state than outside.

name: alaska
sentence: Many Alaskans take advantage of salmon seasons to harvest portions of their domestic food while fishing for subsistence, as well as for sport.

name: alaska
sentence: This includes fish caught by hook, net, or wheel.

name: alaska
sentence: Subsistence hunting, mainly caribou, moose and Dall sheep, is still common in the state, particularly in the remote communities of Bush.

name: alaska
sentence: An example of a traditional indigenous diet is Akutaq, the Eskimo Ice Cream, which can consist of reindeer fat, seal oil, dried fish meat and local berries.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska reindeer farming focuses on the Seward Peninsula, where wild caribou can be prevented from mingling and migrating with domesticated reindeer.

name: alaska
sentence: Most foods in Alaska are transported to the state from outside, and shipping costs make food relatively expensive in cities.

name: alaska
sentence: In rural areas, hunting and subsistence gathering is an essential activity because imported food is prohibitive.

name: alaska
sentence: Although most of the small towns and villages in Alaska are along the coast, the cost of importing food into remote villages can be high, due to terrain and difficult road conditions, which change significantly due to changes in climate and precipitation.

name: alaska
sentence: The cost of transportation can reach up to 50¢ per pound ($1.10/kg) or more in some remote areas, during the most difficult periods, if these locations can be reached at all during these adverse weather conditions and terrain conditions.

name: alaska
sentence: The cost of delivering an American gallon (3.8 L) of milk is approximately $3.50 in many villages where per capita income can be $20,000 or less.

name: alaska
sentence: The cost of fuel per gallon is consistently twenty to thirty cents higher than the contiguous average of the United States, with only Hawaii having higher prices.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska has few road links compared to the rest of the United States.

name: alaska
sentence: The state's road network covers a relatively small area of the state, connecting the central population centres and the Alaska Highway, the main exit route to the state across Canada.

name: alaska
sentence: The state capital, Juneau, is not accessible by road, only a motor ferry; for decades this has sparked a debate about moving from the capital to a city on the road network, or the construction of a road link from Haines.

name: alaska
sentence: The western part of Alaska does not have a highway system linking communities to the rest of Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: The Interstate Highway in Alaska consists of a total of 1,082 miles.

name: alaska
sentence: One of the unique features of the Alaska Highway system is the Anton Anderson Memorial Tunnel, an Alaskan railway tunnel in operation recently renovated to provide an asphalt road link with the isolated community of Whittier, on Prince William Strait, to Seward Road, approximately 80 km southeast of Anchorage, Portage.

name: alaska
sentence: At 4.0 km, the tunnel was North America's longest road tunnel until 2007.

name: alaska
sentence: The tunnel is North America's longest road and rail tunnel.

name: alaska
sentence: Built around 1915, the Alaskan Railway (ARR) played a key role in the development of Alaska during the 20th century.

name: alaska
sentence: It connects North Pacific ships by providing critical infrastructure with routes from Seward to the interior of Alaska through south-central Alaska, through Anchorage, Eklutna, Wasilla, Talkeetna, Denali and Fairbanks, with spurs to Whittier, Palmer and the North Pole.

name: alaska
sentence: Cities, villages and the area served by the ARR are known throughout the State as the "railway belt".

name: alaska
sentence: In recent years, the steady improvement of the asphalt road network has begun to overshadow the importance of the railway to the Alaskan economy.

name: alaska
sentence: The railway played a vital role in Alaska's development, moving freight to Alaska while transporting natural resources south, such as coal from the Usibelli coal mine near Healy at Seward and gravel from the Matanuska Valley to Anchorage.

name: alaska
sentence: It is well known for its summer tourism service.

name: alaska
sentence: The Alaska Railway was one of the last railways in North America to use caboters in regular service and still use them on some gravel trains.

name: alaska
sentence: It continues to offer one of the last flag-stop roads in the country.

name: alaska
sentence: A section of approximately 100 km of track along an area north of Talkeetna remains inaccessible by road

name: alaska
sentence: Until the park road was built in the 1970s, the railway provided the only land access to most of the area along its route.

name: alaska
sentence: In northeastern Alaska, the White Pass and Yukon Highway also partly crosses the state from Skagway northward to Canada (British Columbia and Yukon), crossing the border at the White Pass Summit.

name: alaska
sentence: This line is now mainly used by tourists, often arriving by cruise ship in Skagway.

name: alaska
sentence: It was featured in the BBC television series 1983 Great Little Railways.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska's rail network is not connected to the outside.

name: alaska
sentence: (The closest link to the North American rail network is the northwestern terminus of Canada's National Railway at Prince Rupert, British Columbia, several hundred miles southeast.)

name: alaska
sentence: In 2000, the U.S. Congress authorized $6 million to study the feasibility of a rail link between Alaska, Canada, and under the age of 48.

name: alaska
sentence: Some private companies operate float service between Whittier and Seattle.

name: alaska
sentence: Many towns and villages in the State do not have access to the road or highway; the only modes of access are air, river or sea transport.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska's well-developed ferry network (known as Alaska Marine Highway) serves the cities of the southeast, the Gulf Coast and the Alaska Peninsula.

name: alaska
sentence: Ferries carry vehicles as well as passengers.

name: alaska
sentence: The network also operates a ferry service from Bellingham, Washington and Prince Rupert, British Columbia, in Canada, through the inland crossing to Skagway.

name: alaska
sentence: The Inter-Island Ferry Authority also serves as an important maritime link for many communities in the Southeast Prince of Wales area and works in collaboration with Alaska Marine Highway.

name: alaska
sentence: In recent years, cruise lines have created a summer tourism market, primarily linking northwestern Pacific to southeastern Alaska and, to a lesser extent, cities along the coast of the Gulf of Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: The population of Ketchikan, for example, fluctuates considerably over many days – up to four large cruise ships can moor there at the same time.

name: alaska
sentence: Cities not served by road, sea or river can only be reached by air, foot, dog sled or snow machine, which represents Alaska's highly developed bush air services, a novelty of Alaska.

name: alaska
sentence: L'Anchorage and, to a lesser extent, Fairbanks are served by many major airlines.

name: alaska
sentence: Due to limited access to roads, air transportation remains the most efficient form of transport within and outside the State.

name: alaska
sentence: Anchorage recently completed extensive renovation and construction work at Ted Stevens Anchorage International Airport to accommodate the upsurge of tourism (in 2012–2013, Alaska welcomed nearly two million visitors).

name: alaska
sentence: Regular flights to most commercially viable villages and towns in the state are difficult to provide, so they are heavily subsidized by the federal government as part of the essential air services program.

name: alaska
sentence: Alaska Airlines is the only major airline offering jet flights in the state (sometimes in combination with cargo and passengers Boeing 737-400) from Anchorage and Fairbanks to regional centres such as Bethel, Nome, Kotzebue, Dillingham, Kodiak and other large communities, as well as to large communities in the southeast and the Alaska Peninsula.

name: alaska
sentence: The majority of the remaining commercial flights come from small regional transportation companies such as Ravn Alaska, PenAir and Frontier Flying Service.

name: alaska

sentence: Due to its large area and variations in altitude, the state has a wide variety of localized climatic conditions.

name: arizona
sentence: At low altitudes, the climate is mainly desert, with mild winters and extremely warm summers.

name: arizona
sentence: Typically, from late fall to early spring, the weather is mild, on average a minimum of 60°F (16°C).

name: arizona
sentence: November to February are the coldest months, with temperatures generally ranging from 40 to 75 °F (4 to 24 °C), with occasional frosts.

name: arizona
sentence: By mid-February, temperatures began to rise, with warm days, and cool, chaotic nights.

name: arizona
sentence: The summer months of June to September bring dry heat from 90 to 120 °F (32 to 49 °C), with sometimes high temperatures above 125 °F (52 °C) observed in the desert area.

name: arizona
sentence: The historical record for Arizona is 128°F (53°C) recorded at Havasu City Lake on 29 June 1994 and 5 July 2007; the historical record of -40°F (−40°C) was recorded at Hawley Lake on 7 January 1971.

name: arizona
sentence: Due to the mainly dry climate, large variations in daytime temperatures occur in less developed areas of the desert above 2,500 feet (760 m).

name: arizona
sentence: Swings may reach 83°F (46°C) during the summer months.

name: arizona
sentence: In urban centres of the State, the effects of local warming result in much higher nightfalls than in the recent past.

name: arizona
sentence: Arizona has an average annual rainfall of 12.7 in (323 mm), which comes during two rainy seasons, with cold fronts coming from the Pacific Ocean during the winter and a monsoon in the summer.

name: arizona
sentence: The monsoon season is around the end of the summer.

name: arizona
sentence: In July or August, the dew point increases significantly for a short period of time.

name: arizona
sentence: Meanwhile, the air contains large quantities of water vapour.

name: arizona
sentence: Dew points to 81°F (27°C) were recorded during the Phoenix monsoon season.

name: arizona
sentence: This warm humidity brings lightning, thunderstorms, wind and torrential rain, if they are usually brief.

name: arizona
sentence: The capital of Arizona is Phoenix.

sentence: The Arizona Legislature is bicameral (like the Legislature of all other states except Nebraska) and consists of a thirty-member senator and a 60-member House of Representatives.

name: arizona
sentence: Each legislature covers a two-year period.

name: arizona
sentence: The first session following the general election is known as the first regular session, and the second year session is known as the second regular session.

name: arizona
sentence: Each ordinary session shall begin on the second Monday of January and shall adjourn sine die (duration for the year) no later than the Saturday of the week during which the hundredth day of the beginning of the ordinary session falls.

name: arizona

name: arkansas

sentence: Arkansas can generally be divided into two halves, the northwestern highlands and the southeast lowlands.

sentence: Arkansas has seven distinct natural regions: Ozark Mountains, Ouachita Mountains, Arkansas Valley, Gulf Coast Plain, Crowley Ridge and Arkansas Delta.

sentence: The southeastern part of Arkansas along the Mississippi Alluvial Plain is sometimes referred to as the Arkansas Delta.

name: arkansas

name: california
sentence: The Californian legal system is explicitly based on English common law (as is the case for all other states except Louisiana) but has some features of Spanish civil law, such as community property.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado (other variants) is a state in the western United States that encompasses most of the southern Rocky Mountains as well as the northeastern part of the Colorado Plateau and the western limit of the Great Plains.

name: colorado
sentence: It is the 8th largest and 21st most populous state in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's population is estimated at 5,758,736 in 2019, an increase of 14.5 per cent since the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The area has been inhabited by Amerindians for more than 13,000 years, the Lindenmeier site containing artifacts dating from approximately 9200 B.C. to 1000 B.C.; the eastern edge of the Rocky Mountains has been an important migration route for the first peoples that have spread throughout the Americas.

name: colorado
sentence: The state was named for the Colorado River, which the first Spanish explorers named the Río Colorado ("Red River") for the red silt that the river carried mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: The territory of Colorado was organized on February 28, 1861, and on August 1, 1876, US President Ulysses S. Grant signed Proclamation 230 admitting Colorado to the Union as the 38th State.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is nicknamed the "State of the Centennial" because it became a State a century after the signing of the United States Declaration of Independence.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is bordered by Wyoming to the north, Nebraska to the northeast, Kansas to the east, Oklahoma to the southeast, New Mexico to the south, Utah to the west, and reaches Arizona to the southwest at Four Corners.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is known for its living landscape of mountains, forests, high plains, mesas, canyons, plateaus, rivers and desert lands.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is one of the mountain states and is part of the western and southwestern parts of the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver is Colorado's most populous city and capital.

name: colorado
sentence: State residents are known as Coloradans, although the former term "Coloradoan" is used occasionally.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is a relatively rich state, ranking 8th at the household income level in 2016 and 11th at the per capita income level in 2010.

name: colorado
sentence: Major parts of the economy include government and defence, mining, agriculture, tourism, and more and more other types of manufacturing.

name: colorado
sentence: With rising temperatures and reduced water availability, Colorado's agricultural, forestry and tourism economies are expected to be severely affected by climate change.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is notable for its diverse geography, which includes alpine mountains, high plains, deserts with huge sand dunes and deep canyons.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1861, the United States Congress defined the boundaries of the new territory of Colorado exclusively by latitude and longitude lines, ranging from 37°N to 41°N latitude, and from 102°02′48′′W to 109°02′48′′W longitude (25°W to 32°W of the Washington Meridian).

name: colorado
sentence: After 159 years of government surveys, Colorado's borders are now officially defined by 697 pillars and 697 straight lines of demarcation.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado, Wyoming and Utah are the only states that have their borders defined only by straight boundaries without natural characteristics.

name: colorado
sentence: The southwest corner of Colorado is the Four Corners Monument at 36°59′56′′N, 109°2′43′′W.

name: colorado
sentence: The Four Corners Monument, located at the place where Colorado, New Mexico, Arizona and Utah meet, is the only place in the United States where four states meet.

name: colorado
sentence: To the west of the Great Plains of Colorado, the eastern slope of the Rocky Mountains.

sentence: The outstanding peaks of the Rocky Mountains include Longs Peak, Mount Evans, Pikes Peak and Spanish peaks near Walsenburg, in southern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This region flows east and south-east, either through the Mississippi River or through the Rio Grande, in the Gulf of Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: The Rocky Mountains in Colorado contain 53 actual peaks with a total of 58 that are 14,000 feet (4,267 m) or higher above sea level, known as 14ers.

name: colorado
sentence: These mountains are largely covered with trees such as conifers and spends to the tree line, at an altitude of approximately 12,000 feet (3,658 m) in southern Colorado at approximately 10,500 feet (3,200 m) in northern Colorado.

sentence: Above this line of trees, only alpine vegetation grows.

name: colorado
sentence: Only small parts of Colorado Rockies are covered with snow all year round.

sentence: Much of the alpine snow melts in mid-August, except for a few snowy peaks and a few small glaciers.

sentence: The Colorado Mineral Belt, which stretches from the San Juan Mountains in the southwest to Boulder and Central City in the front, contains most of Colorado's historic gold and silver mining districts.

name: colorado
sentence: Mount Elbert is the highest peak of the Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: The 30 highest peaks of the North American Rocky Mountains are all within the state.

name: colorado
sentence: The summit of Mount Elbert at an altitude of 14,440 feet (4,401.2 m) in Lake County is the highest point in Colorado and the North American Rockies.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is the only U.S. state entirely above 1000 metres of altitude.

name: colorado
sentence: The point where the Arikaree River flows from Yuma County, Colorado, and Cheyenne County, Kansas, is the lowest point in Colorado at an altitude of 3,317 feet (1,011 m).

name: colorado
sentence: This point, which is the highest low-altitude point in any state, is higher than the high-altitude points of 18 states and the District of Columbia.

name: colorado
sentence: A little less than half of Colorado is a flat and hilly terrain.

sentence: To the east of the Rocky Mountains are the plains of eastern Colorado of the High Plains, the section of the Great Plains in the Nebraska at altitudes ranging from about 3,350 to 7,500 feet (1,020 to 2,290 m).

sentence: The Colorado Plains are primarily prairies, but also include deciduous forests, mounds and canyons.

name: colorado
sentence: Precipitation averages 15 to 25 inches (380 to 640 mm) per year.

sentence: Currently, eastern Colorado consists mainly of agricultural land and rangelands, as well as small villages and agricultural towns.

sentence: Corn, wheat, hay, soy and oats are typical crops.

sentence: Most villages and towns in this area have both a water tower and a grain elevator.

name: colorado

sentence: Eastern Colorado is also home to a considerable amount and range of livestock, such as livestock ranches and pig farms.

sentence: About 70% of Colorado's population lives along the eastern limit of the Rocky Mountains in the Front Range urban corridor between Cheyenne, Wyoming and Pueblo, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This region is partially protected from the dominant storms that blow from the Pacific Ocean region by the upper Rocky Mountains in the middle of Colorado.

sentence: The "Front Chain" includes Denver, Boulder, Fort Collins, Loveland, Castle Rock, Colorado Springs, Pueblo, Greeley and other townships and municipalities in between.

name: colorado

name: colorado
sentence: The continental divide of the Americas extends along the crest of the Rocky Mountains.

sentence: Colorado's desert lands are located in and around areas such as Pueblo, Canon City, Florence, Grand Sand Dunes National Park and Reserve, San Luis Valley, Cortez, Canyon of the Ancients National Monument, Hovenweep National Monument, Ute Mountain, Delta, Grand Junction, Colorado National Monument, and other areas surrounding the Uncompahgre Plateau and the Uncompahgre National Forest.

sentence: The west side of Colorado is drained by the Colorado River and its tributaries (mainly the Gunnison River, the Green River and the San Juan River), or by evaporation into its arid areas.

name: colorado
sentence: Grand Junction, Colorado is the largest city on the west side.

sentence: Graduate studies are available at Colorado Mesa University in Grand Junction, Western Colorado University in Gunnison, Fort Lewis College in Durango, and Colorado Mountain College in Glenwood Springs and Steamboat Springs.

name: colorado
sentence: In contrast to most other states, southern Colorado is not always warmer than northern Colorado.

sentence: Most of Colorado consists of mountains, foothills, high plains and desert lands.

name: colorado

name: colorado
sentence: As a rule, with an increase in altitude comes a decrease in temperature and an increase in precipitation.

name: colorado
sentence: Northeastern, eastern and southeastern Colorado are mostly the high plains, while northern Colorado is a mix of high plains, foothills and mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: The northwest and west of Colorado are mostly mountainous, with a few mixed desert lands.

name: colorado
sentence: Southwestern and southern Colorado are a complex mixture of desert and mountainous regions.

name: colorado
sentence: The climate of the eastern plains is semi-arid (Köppen Climate Classification: BSk) with low humidity and moderate precipitation, usually 15 to 25 inches (380 to 640 millimetres) per year.

name: colorado
sentence: The area is known for its abundant sun and cool and light nights, giving this area a large range of average daytime temperature.

sentence: In summer, this area can have many days above 95°F (35°C) and often 100°F (38°C).
