sentence: The cities of Front Range closer to the mountains tend to be warmer in winter due to Chinook winds that warm the area, sometimes bringing temperatures of 70°F (21°C) or higher in winter.

name: colorado
sentence: The average July temperature is 55°F (13°C) in the morning and 90°F (32°C) in the afternoon.

name: colorado
sentence: The mean January temperature is 18 °F (−8 °C) in the morning and 48 °F (9 °C) in the afternoon, although the variation between consecutive days may be 40 °F (20 °C).

name: colorado
sentence: Just west of the plains and in the foothills, there are a wide variety of climatic types.

name: colorado
sentence: Locations a few kilometres apart can experience a completely different time depending on the topography.

name: colorado
sentence: Most valleys have a semi-arid climate, which is not the case with the eastern plains, which move to an alpine climate at the highest altitudes.

name: colorado
sentence: Microclimates also exist in local areas that cover almost the full spectrum of climates, including subtropical highlands (Cfb/Cwb), wet subtropicals (Cfa), wet continentals (Dfa/Dfb), Mediterraneans (Csa/Csb) and subarctics (Dfc).

name: colorado
sentence: Extreme climate change is common in Colorado, although a significant portion of extreme climate change occurs in the less populated areas of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Storms are common east of the continental ditch in spring and summer, but are usually short.

name: colorado
sentence: The hail is a common view in the mountains east of the Divide and across the eastern plains, especially the northeastern part of the State.

name: colorado
sentence: Hail is the most frequently reported serious weather hazard for the warm season and occasionally causes human injury, as well as significant damage to property.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern plains are prone to some of the largest hailstorms in North America.

name: colorado
sentence: An example is the violent hailstorms that struck Denver on July 11, 1990 and May 8, 2017, the latter being the most costly in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern plains are part of the extreme west of the Tornado gangway; some harmful tornadoes on the eastern plains include the 1990 Limon F3 tornado and the Windsor EF3 tornado, which devastated the small town in 2008.

name: colorado
sentence: Portions of the eastern plains see particularly frequent tornadoes, whether from mesocyclones in thunderstorms of supercells or less intense cutlets, such as in the Denver convergence vorticity zone (DCVZ).

name: colorado
sentence: The plains are also exposed to occasional flooding and particularly severe flash floods, which are caused by both thunderstorms and the rapid melting of snow in the mountains during warm weather.

name: colorado
sentence: Notable examples include the Denver flood in 1965, the Big Thompson flood in 1976, and the Colorado floods in 2013.

name: colorado
sentence: Hot weather is common in the summers in Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The city's 1901 record for consecutive days above 90°F (32°C) was broken in the summer of 2008.

name: colorado
sentence: The new record of 24 consecutive days surpassed the previous record of nearly a week.

name: colorado
sentence: Much of Colorado is very dry, with an average of only 17 inches (430 millimetres) of precipitation per year on a state-wide basis.

name: colorado
sentence: The state rarely experiences a period when part of it is not in a certain degree of drought.

name: colorado
sentence: Lack of precipitation contributes to the severity of forest fires in the state, such as the 2002 Hayman Fire.

name: colorado
sentence: Other notable fires include the 2010 Fourmile Canyon Fire, the Waldo Canyon Fire, and the June 2012 High Park Fire, and the June 2013 Black Forest Fire.

name: colorado
sentence: Even these fires were overtaken by the pine mulch fire, the Cameron Peak fire, and the Eastern Troublefire in 2020, all of which are the three largest fires in Colorado history (see Colorado forest fires in 2020).

name: colorado
sentence: However, some of Colorado's mountainous regions receive a large amount of moisture from winter snowfall.

name: colorado
sentence: The spring melting of these snows often causes large flows of water in the Yampa River, Colorado River, Rio Grande, Arkansas River, North Platte River and South Platte River.

name: colorado
sentence: Water flowing from the Colorado Rocky Mountains is a very important source of water for farms, towns and cities in the southwestern states of New Mexico, Arizona, Utah and Nevada, as well as for the Midwest, such as Nebraska and Kansas, and the southern states of Oklahoma and Texas.

name: colorado
sentence: A significant amount of water is also diverted to be used in California; occasionally (formerly naturally and regularly) water flows reach northern Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: The highest official ambient air temperature ever recorded in Colorado was 115°F (46.1°C) on July 20, 2019, at the John Martin Dam.

name: colorado
sentence: The lowest official air temperature was −61°F (−51.7°C) on 1 February 1985 in Maybell.

name: colorado
sentence: Despite its mountainous relief, Colorado is relatively calm from the seismic point of view.

name: colorado
sentence: The National Earthquake Information Centre of the United States is located in Golden.

name: colorado
sentence: On 22 August 2011, an earthquake of magnitude 5.3 occurred 14 km west-southwest of the city of Trinidad.

name: colorado
sentence: There were no casualties and only a small number of damage was reported.

name: colorado
sentence: It was the second earthquake in Colorado history.

name: colorado
sentence: An earthquake of magnitude 5.7 was registered in 1973.

name: colorado
sentence: In the early morning of August 24, 2018, four minor earthquakes caught up with the state of Colorado in magnitudes of 2.9 to 4.3.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has recorded 525 earthquakes since 1973, with a majority of 2 to 3.5 earthquakes on the Richter scale.

name: colorado
sentence: The area that is now the state of Colorado has been inhabited by Native Americans for over 13,000 years.

name: colorado
sentence: The Lindenmeier site of Larimer County contains artifacts dating from approximately 11200 B.C. to 3000 B.C.

name: colorado
sentence: The eastern tip of the Rockies was an important migratory route that was important for the spread of the first peoples throughout the Americas.

name: colorado
sentence: The former Pueblo people lived in the valleys and mesas of the Colorado plateau.

name: colorado
sentence: The Ute Nation has inhabited the valleys of the southern Rocky Mountains and the western Rocky Mountains, even to the east of the Front Range these days.

name: colorado
sentence: The Apaches and the Comanches also lived in the eastern and southeastern parts of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Sometimes the Arapaho Nation and the Cheyenne Nation moved west to hunt through the High Plains.

name: colorado
sentence: The Spanish Empire claimed Colorado as part of its province of New Mexico prior to the involvement of the United States in the region.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States acquired a land claim east of the Rockies with the purchase of Louisiana from France in 1803.

name: colorado
sentence: This American claim is in conflict with Spain's claim to the upper basin of Arkansas as the exclusive commercial zone of its colony of Santa Fé de Nuevo México.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1806, Zebulon Pike led a US Army reconnaissance expedition to the disputed area.

name: colorado
sentence: Colonel Pike and his men were arrested by Spanish riders in the San Luis Valley the following February, taken to Chihuahua and expelled from Mexico the following July.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States abandoned its lands to the south and west of Arkansas and south of the 42nd parallel to the north and west of the 100th meridian to the west as part of the purchase of Florida from Spain under the Adams-Onís Treaty of 1819.

name: colorado
sentence: The Treaty entered into force on February 22, 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: Having established its border with Spain, the United States admitted the south-eastern part of the territory of Missouri to the Union as the State of Missouri on 10 August 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: The rest of Missouri territory, including what was to become northeastern Colorado, became unorganized territory and remained so for 33 years on the issue of slavery.

name: colorado
sentence: After 11 years of war, Spain finally recognized Mexico's independence with the treaty of Cordoba signed on 24 August 1821.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexico finally ratified the Adams-Onís Treaty in 1831.

name: colorado
sentence: The Texas revolt of 1835–36 fomented a dispute between the United States and Mexico that finally broke out in the war between Mexico and America in 1846.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexico ceded its northern territory to the United States with the Guadalupe Hidalgo Treaty at the end of the war in 1848.

name: colorado
sentence: Most American settlers traveling west to Oregon, the new California gold fields, or the new Mormon colonies of Deseret State in the Salt Lake Valley, avoided the rugged southern rocky mountains, and instead followed the North Platte River and the Sweetwater River to South Pass (Wyoming), the lowest passage of the continental divide between the Southern Rocky Mountains and the Central Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1849, the Mormons of the Salt Lake Valley organized the extra-legal state of Deseret, claiming the entire Great Basin and all the lands drained by the Green, Grand and Colorado rivers.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. federal government totally refused to recognize the new Mormon government because it was theocratic and sanctioned plural marriage.

name: colorado
sentence: Instead, the 1850 compromise divided the Mexican Cessation and the claims of northwestern Texas into a new state and two new territories, the State of California, the territory of New Mexico and the territory of Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: On 9 April 1851, American Mexican settlers from the Taos region settled the village of San Luis and then in the New Mexico Territory, later becoming the first permanent Euro-American colony in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1854, Senator Stephen A. Douglas persuaded the American Congress to divide the unorganized territory east of the Continental Divide into two new organized territories, Kansas Territory and Nebraska Territory, and an unorganized southern region known as Indian Territory.

name: colorado
sentence: Each new territory had to decide the fate of slavery within its borders, but this compromise only fueled animosity between the free soil and the pro-slavery factions.

name: colorado
sentence: The gold researchers organized the provisional government of Jefferson's territory on August 24, 1859, but the new territory did not obtain the approval of the United States Congress in the debate on slavery.

name: colorado
sentence: The election of Abraham Lincoln as President of the United States on 6 November 1860 led to the secession of nine southern slave states and the threat of civil war between states.

name: colorado
sentence: In an effort to increase the political power of the states of the Union, Congress, dominated by the Republican Party, quickly admitted the eastern part of Kansas territory to the Union as a free state of Kansas on 29 January 1861, leaving the western part of Kansas territory and its gold mining areas as unorganized territory.

name: colorado
sentence: Thirty days later, on February 28, 1861, outgoing U.S. President James Buchanan signed a convention act organizing the free territory of Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The initial limits of Colorado remain unchanged, with the exception of changes to government surveys.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado name was chosen because it was generally believed that the Colorado River was native to the territory.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1776, the Spanish priest Silvestre Vélez de Escalante reported that the Amerindians of the region knew the river as Rio Colorado for the red-brown silt that the river carried mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1859, a topographical expedition of the U.S. Army led by Captain John Maccomb established the confluence of the Green River with the Grand River in what is now Canyonlands National Park in Utah.

name: colorado
sentence: The Macomb party has designated the confluence as the source of the Colorado River.

name: colorado
sentence: On April 12, 1861, South Carolina artillery opened fire on Fort Sumter to launch the American Civil War.

name: colorado
sentence: While many gold seekers appreciated Confederation, the vast majority remained fiercely loyal to the cause of the Union.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1862, a Texas cavalry force invaded the territory of New Mexico and captured Santa Fe on 10 March.

name: colorado
sentence: The purpose of this western campaign was to seize or disrupt the gold fields of Colorado and California and seize the ports of the Pacific Ocean for Confederation.

name: colorado
sentence: A force hastily organized by Colorado volunteers moved from Denver City, Colorado Territory, to Glorieta Pass, New Mexico Territory, to try to block the Texans.

name: colorado
sentence: On 28 March, the Coloradans and local volunteers of New Mexico stopped the Texans at the battle of Col Glorieta, destroyed their cannons and fuel wagons, and dispersed 500 of their horses and mules.

name: colorado
sentence: The Texans were forced to withdraw from Santa Fe.

name: colorado
sentence: Having lost the supplies for their campaign and found little support for New Mexico, the Texans abandoned Santa Fe and returned to San Antonio in defeat.

name: colorado
sentence: The Confederation made no other attempt to seize the southwestern United States.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1864, the Governor of the Territory John Evans appointed the Reverend John Chivington Colonel of Colorado Volunteers with orders to protect the white settlers of the Cheyenne and Arapaho warriors accused of theft of cattle.

name: colorado
sentence: Colonel Chivington ordered his men to attack a band of Cheyenne and Arapaho camped along Sand Creek.

name: colorado
sentence: Chivington reported that his troops had killed over 500 warriors.

name: colorado
sentence: The militia returned to Denver City in triumph, but several officers reported that the so-called battle was a flagrant massacre of Indians at peace, that most of the deaths were women and children, and that the bodies of the dead had been hideously mutilated and desecrated.

name: colorado
sentence: Three U.S. Army investigations have condemned the action, and new President Andrew Johnson has asked Governor Evans to resign, but none of the perpetrators has ever been punished.

name: colorado
sentence: This event is now known as the Sand Creek massacre.

name: colorado
sentence: In the middle of and after the civil war, many discouraged prospectors returned home, but some stayed and developed mines, mills, farms, ranches, roads and towns in Colorado territory.

name: colorado
sentence: On September 14, 1864, James Huff discovered silver near the Col d'Argentine, the first of a multitude of silver strikes.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1867, the Union Pacific railway laid its tracks west to Weir, now Julesburg, in the northeast corner of the territory.

name: colorado
sentence: The Pacific Union established a link with the Central Pacific Railway at the summit of Promontory, Utah, on 10 May 1869, to form the first transcontinental railway.

name: colorado
sentence: The Denver Pacific railway reached Denver in June of the following year, and the Kansas Pacific arrived two months later to forge the second line across the continent.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1872 rich veins of silver were discovered in the San Juan Mountains on the Ute Indian Reserve in southwestern Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The following year, the Ute people were withdrawn from the San Juans.

name: colorado
sentence: On March 3, 1875, the United States Congress passed enabling legislation specifying the conditions for the territory of Colorado to become a state.

name: colorado
sentence: On August 1, 1876 (four weeks after the United States Centennial), US President Ulysses S. Grant signed a proclamation in which he admitted Colorado to the Union as 38th state and earned it the name of "the State of the Centennial".

name: colorado
sentence: The discovery of a major silver lode near Leadville in 1878 sparked the Colorado silver boom.

name: colorado
sentence: The Sherman Silver Purchase Act of 1890 reinvigorated silver mining, and Colorado's latest gold strike, but the most important one, at Cripple Creek a few months later, attracted a new generation of gold researchers.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado women were granted the right to vote on November 7, 1893, making Colorado the second state to grant universal suffrage and the first by popular vote (men from Colorado).

name: colorado
sentence: The repeal of the Sherman Silver Purchase Act in 1893 resulted in a horrific collapse of Colorado's mining and agricultural economy, but the state recovered slowly and steadily.

name: colorado
sentence: Between the 1880s and 1930s, Denver's floriculture industry became a major industry in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This period was known locally as the Gold Rush of the Carnations.

name: colorado
sentence: The poor working conditions and discontent of the miners led to several major clashes between the strikers and the Colorado National Guard, including the Western Federation of Minors (1903-1904) and the Colorado Coal War, including the Ludlow massacre, which killed a dozen women and children.

name: colorado
sentence: The coal war of 1913-1914 and the streetcar strike in Denver in 1920 led to the intervention of federal troops to put an end to the violence.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1927, the Columbine mine massacre resulted in the deaths of six strikers following a confrontation with the Colorado Rangers.

name: colorado
sentence: It is estimated that more than 5,000 miners from Colorado, many immigrants, have died in accidents since the records began to be formally collected following an accident in Crested Butte, which killed 59 in 1884.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado became the first Western state to host a large political assembly when the Democratic Party met in Denver in 1908.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 1930 U.S. census, Colorado's population for the first time exceeded one million residents.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado suffered greatly from the Great Depression and Dust Bowl of the 1930s, but a great wave of immigration after the Second World War boosted Colorado's fortune.

name: colorado
sentence: Tourism has become a pillar of the state economy, and high technology has become an important economic engine.

name: colorado
sentence: The United States Census Bureau estimated that Colorado's population exceeded five million in 2009.

name: colorado
sentence: Three U.S. Navy warships have been named the USColorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The first USColorado was named for the Colorado River and served in the civil war and later in the Asian squadron, where it was attacked during the Korean expedition of 1871.

name: colorado
sentence: The last two ships were named in honour of the state, including the USColorado combat vessel that served during the Second World War in the Pacific from 1941.

name: colorado
sentence: At the time of the attack on Pearl Harbor, this USColorado was located at the naval base of San Diego, Calif.

name: colorado
sentence: On 11 September 1957, a plutonium fire occurred at the Rocky Flats plant, resulting in significant plutonium contamination in the surrounding populated areas.

name: colorado
sentence: Since its disappearance by trapping and poisoning the Colorado Grey Wolf (Canis lupus) in the 1930s, a pack of wolves has recolonized Moffat County, Colorado in northwestern Colorado in 2019.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that Colorado's population was 5,758,736 in 2019, an increase of 14.51 per cent from the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The most populous city and capital in Colorado is Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The Greater Denver metropolitan area, with an estimated population of 3,515,374 in 2017, is considered the largest metropolitan area in the state and is located in the Front Range urban corridor, which has approximately five million inhabitants.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest increases are expected in the Front Range urban corridor, especially in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
sentence: The fastest-growing counties in the state are Douglas and Weld.

name: colorado
sentence: The centre of Colorado's population is located just north of the village of Crichell in Jefferson County.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2010 United States Census, Colorado had 5,029,196 inhabitants.

name: colorado
sentence: The racial composition of the population of the State was as follows:

name: colorado
sentence: Hispanic and Latin American peoples (of any race) make up 20.7 per cent of the population.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2000 census, Colorado's main ancestry groups are German (22%), including Swiss and Austrian nationalities, Mexican (18%), Irish (12%) and English (12%).

name: colorado
sentence: People of German origin are particularly numerous in the Front Range, the Rocky Mountains (Central West Counts) and the eastern/high plains.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has a large proportion of Hispanic citizens, mainly Mexican and American, in Metropolitan Denver, Colorado Springs, as well as in the small towns of Greeley and Pueblo, and elsewhere.

name: colorado
sentence: The south, south-west and south-east of Colorado have a large number of Hispanos, descendants of the first Spanish colonial settlers.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1940, the Census Bureau reported that the population of Colorado was 8.2% Hispanics and 90.3% Non-Hispanic Whites.

name: colorado
sentence: The Hispanic population of Colorado has continued to grow rapidly in recent decades.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2019, Hispanics accounted for 22% of Colorado's population, and non-Hispanic whites for 70%.

name: colorado
sentence: English spoken in Colorado has a lot of Spanish idioms.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado also has large African-American communities located in Denver, Montbello, Five Points, Whittier and many other parts of East Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The state has a considerable number of Asian-Americans of Mongolian origin, Chinese, Filipino, Korean, South Asian and Japanese.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest population of Asian Americans is on the south and south-east sides of Denver, as well as some on the south-west side of Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The Denver metropolitan area is considered to be more liberal and diverse than most states in terms of political issues and environmental concerns.

name: colorado
sentence: There were a total of 70,331 births in Colorado in 2006.

name: colorado
sentence: (birth rate of 14.6 per thousand.)

name: colorado
sentence: In 2007, non-Hispanic whites were involved in 59.1 per cent of all births.

name: colorado
sentence: Approximately 14.06 per cent of these births involved a non-Hispanic white person and a person of a different race, most often with a couple including a Hispanic.

name: colorado
sentence: One birth where at least one Hispanic person was involved accounted for 43% of births in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: At the 2010 census, Colorado was the seventh largest percentage of Hispanics (20.7 per cent) in the United States behind New Mexico (46.3 per cent), California (37.6 per cent), Texas (37.6 per cent), Arizona (29.6 per cent), Nevada (26.5 per cent) and Florida (22.5 per cent).

name: colorado
sentence: According to the 2000 census, the Hispanic population is estimated at 918,899 persons, or approximately 20 per cent of the total population of the State.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has the fifth largest population of Mexican Americans, behind California, Texas, Arizona, and Illinois.

name: colorado
sentence: In percentage, Colorado ranks 6th among Mexican-Americans, behind New Mexico, California, Texas, Arizona and Nevada.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2011, 46% of Colorado's population under one year of age were minorities, meaning that they had at least one non-Hispanic white parent.

name: colorado
sentence: Note: The births in the table do not add up, because Hispanics are counted both by ethnicity and race, giving a higher overall number.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2017, Colorado had the second lowest fertility rate in the United States outside New England, after Oregon, at 1.63 children per woman.

name: colorado
sentence: The Title X Family Planning Program and Warren Buffett's intrauterine device grant contributed significantly to the decline in pregnancy.

name: colorado
sentence: Spanish is the second language spoken in Colorado after English.

name: colorado
sentence: There is a coloradan Indian language still spoken in Colorado, Colorado River Numic (Ute).

name: colorado
sentence: The main religious affiliations of the population of Colorado are 64% Christians, including 44% Protestants, 16% Roman Catholics, 3% Mormons and 1% Eastern Orthodox.

name: colorado
sentence: Other religious breaks are: 1% Jewish, 1% Muslim, 1% Buddhist and 4% other.

name: colorado
sentence: Non-affiliated individuals account for 29 per cent of the population.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest denominations by number of adherents in 2010 were the Catholic Church with 811,630; non-denominational evangelical Protestants with 229,981; and the Church of Jesus Christ of last-day saints with 151,433.

name: colorado
sentence: According to several studies, Coloradans have the lowest rates of obesity in any state in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, 24 per cent of the population was considered obese from a medical point of view and, if it was the lowest in the country, it had dropped from 17 per cent in 2004.

name: colorado
sentence: According to a report published in the Journal of the American Medical Association, Colorado residents had a life expectancy of 80.21 years in 2014, the longest of all American states.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of film productions have been shot on site in Colorado, particularly in prominent westerns such as True Grit, The Searchers, Butch Cassidy and Sundance Kid.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of historic military forts, railways with trains still in operation, phantom mining cities have been used and transformed for historical accuracy in well-known films.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also a number of panoramic highways and mountain passes that have helped to highlight the free route in films such as Vanishing Point, Bingo and Starman.

name: colorado
sentence: Some Colorado monuments have been featured in films such as The Stanley Hotel in Dumb and Dumber and The Shining and the Sculptured House in Sleeper.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2015, Furious 7 was scheduled to film driving sequences on Pikes Peak Highway in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Good Luck Charlie television series was filmed in Denver, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado Office of Film and Television noted that more than 400 films were shot in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also several movie festivals in Colorado, including Aspen Shortsfest, Boulder International Film Festival, Castle Rock Film Festival, Denver Film Festival, Festivus Film Festival (finished 2013), Mile High Horror Film Festival, Moondance International Film Festival, Mountainfilm in Telluride, Rocky Mountain Women's Film Festival and Telluride Film Festival.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is known for its cuisine from the southwest and the Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: Mexican restaurants are prominent throughout the State.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, Colorado, was named America's Foodest Town 2010 by Bon Appétit.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, and Colorado in general, are home to a number of national food and beverage companies, leading restaurants, and agricultural markets.

name: colorado
sentence: Boulder, Colorado also has more sommelier masters per capita than any other city, including San Francisco and New York.

name: colorado
sentence: The Food & Wine Classic is held every June in Aspen, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Aspen also has a reputation as the culinary capital of the Rocky Mountains region.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver is known for steak, but now has a diversified culinary scene with many restaurants.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado wines include award-winning varieties that have attracted positive attention from outside the state.

name: colorado
sentence: With traditional Vitis vinifera grape-based wines as well as cherries, peaches, plums and honey, Colorado wines have won the best national and international prizes for their quality.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's wine regions are home to the highest vineyards in the United States, with most of the state's viticulture being between 4,000 and 7,000 feet (1,219 and 2,134 m) above sea level.

name: colorado
sentence: The mountain climate ensures hot summer days and cool nights.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to two U.S. wine-growing areas in the Grand Valley AVA and West Elks AVA, where most of the state's vineyards are located.

name: colorado
sentence: However, a growing number of wineries are located along the Front chain.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, Wine Enthusiast Magazine named Colorado's Grand Valley AVA in Mesa County, Colorado, as one of ten wine travel destinations in the world.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to many nationally recognized microbreweries, including the New Belgium Brewing Company, Odell Brewing Company, Great Divide Brewing Company, and Bristol Brewing Company.

name: colorado
sentence: The northern Colorado region, close to and between the cities of Denver, Boulder and Fort Collins, is known as the "Napa Valley of Beer" due to its high density of artisanal breweries.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is open for cannabis tourism (marijuana).

name: colorado
sentence: With the adoption of their 64th State Amendment in 2013, Colorado became the first state in the Union to legalize the medicinal (2000), industrial (2013) and recreational (2014) use of marijuana.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado marijuana industry sold $1.31 billion of marijuana in 2016 and $1.26 billion in the first three quarters of 2017.

name: colorado
sentence: The government generated tax revenues, fees and licences of $194 million in 2016 on legal marijuana sales.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado regulates hemp like any part of the plant with less than 0.3% THC.

name: colorado
sentence: Amendment 64, adopted by voters at the 2012 general election, requires the Colorado State Parliament to enact laws governing the cultivation, processing and sale of recreational marijuana and industrial hemp.

name: colorado
sentence: On April 4, 2014, Senator Bill 14–184 dealing with monitoring the Colorado industrial hemp program was introduced for the first time and was finally signed by Governor John Hickenlooper on May 31, 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: On November 7, 2000, 54% of Colorado voters adopted Amendment 20, which amends the Constitution of the State of Colorado to allow the medical use of marijuana.

name: colorado
sentence: The medical use of marijuana by a patient, within the following limits, is legal:

name: colorado
sentence: Currently, Colorado has listed "eight medical conditions for which patients can use marijuana – cancer, glaucoma, HIV/AIDS, muscle spasms, seizures, severe pain, nausea and severe cachexia, or dramatic weight loss and muscle atrophy".

name: colorado
sentence: While Governor, John Hickenlooper has allocated approximately half of the $13 million from the Medical Marijuana Program Cash Fund to medical research in Budget 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, the Medical Marijuana Program Cash Fund was the "greatest pot money pool in the state" and was used to fund programs including research on paediatric applications to control the symptoms of autism.

name: colorado
sentence: On November 6, 2012, voters amended the state constitution to protect "personal use" of marijuana for adults, establishing a framework to regulate marijuana in a manner similar to that of alcohol.

name: colorado
sentence: The first recreational marijuana stores in Colorado, by extension in the United States, opened on January 1, 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has five large professional sports leagues, all based in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is the least populous state with a franchise in each of the major professional sports leagues.

name: colorado
sentence: The Pikes Peak International Hill Climb is a climbing motor race held on the Pikes Peak Highway.

name: colorado
sentence: The Cherry Hills Country Club hosted several professional golf tournaments, including the US Open, the US Senator Open, the US Women's Open, the PGA Championship and the BMW Championship.

name: colorado
sentence: The following universities and colleges participate in Division I of the National Collegiate Athletic Association.

name: colorado
sentence: The most popular college sports program is the University of Colorado Buffaloes, which used to play in the Big-12 but now play in the Pac-12.

name: colorado
sentence: They won the 1957 and 1991 Orange Bowl, the 1995 Fiesta Bowl and the 1996 Cotton Bowl Classic.

name: colorado
sentence: The list of the CNBC's Top States for Business for 2010 recognized Colorado as the third best state of the nation, reaching only Texas and Virginia.

name: colorado
sentence: The total revenue of the State in 2015 was $318.6 billion.

name: colorado
sentence: The median annual household income in 2016 was $70,666, 8th in the country.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2010, per capita personal income was $51,940, ranking 11th in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The state economy expanded from its mid-19th century roots in mining when irrigated agriculture developed, and by the end of the 19th century, breeding had become important.

name: colorado
sentence: The first industries were based on extraction and processing of minerals and agricultural products.

name: colorado
sentence: Current agricultural products are livestock, wheat, dairy products, corn and hay.

name: colorado
sentence: The federal government is also a major economic force in the state with many major federal facilities, including NORAD (North American Aerospace Defense Command), the United States Air Force Academy, the Schriever Air Force Base approximately 16 kilometres east of the Peterson Air Force Base, and Fort Carson, both located in Colorado Springs, El Paso County; NOAA, the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) in Golden, and the National Institute of Standards and Technology in Boulder; the US Geological Survey and other government agencies at the Denver Federal Center near Lakewood; Denver Mint, Buckley Air Force Base, the Tenth Circuit Appeal Court, and Byron G. Rogers Federal Building and the United States Courthouse in Denver; and a federal Supermax prison and other federal prisons near Cañon City.

name: colorado
sentence: In addition to these federal agencies and others, Colorado has abundant national forest lands and four national parks that contribute to the federal ownership of 24,615,788 acres (99,617 km2) of land in Colorado, or 37% of the total area of the state.In the second half of the 20th century, the industrial and service sectors expanded considerably.

name: colorado
sentence: The state economy is diverse and remarkable by the concentration of scientific research and high-tech industries.

name: colorado
sentence: Other industries include food processing, transportation equipment, machinery, chemicals, metal mining such as gold (see Colorado gold mining), silver and molybdenum.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado now has the highest annual beer production in any state.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver is an important financial center.

name: colorado
sentence: Geographical diversity and the state's majestic mountains attract millions of tourists each year, 85.2 million of whom in 2018.

name: colorado
sentence: Tourism is a major contributor to Colorado's economy, with tourists generating $22.3 billion in 2018.

name: colorado
sentence: A number of nationally known brands originate from Colorado factories and laboratories.

name: colorado
sentence: De Denver was the forerunner of the telecommunications giant Qwest in 1879, Samsonite luggage in 1910, Gates belts and pipes in 1911 and Russell Stover Candies in 1923.

name: colorado
sentence: Kuner's canned vegetables started in Brighton in 1864.

name: colorado
sentence: De Golden came Coors beer in 1873, CoorsTek ceramic industrial in 1920, and Jolly Rancher candy in 1949.

name: colorado
sentence: The CF&I's rails, wires, nails and pipes began in Pueblo in 1892.

name: colorado
sentence: Holly Sugar was first milled from beet in Holly in 1905, then moved its head office to Colorado Springs.

name: colorado
sentence: Today Greeley's Swift packaged meat evolved from Monfort of Colorado, Inc., established in 1930.

name: colorado
sentence: Estes rockets were launched at Penrose in 1958.

name: colorado
sentence: Fort Collins has been the headquarters of the Woodward Governor Company (Governors) controllers since 1870, and Waterpik dental water jets and shower heads since 1962.

name: colorado
sentence: Celestial Seasonings herbal teas have been manufactured in Boulder since 1969.

name: colorado
sentence: Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory made its first candies in Durango in 1981.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has a flat-rate tax of 4.63%, regardless of the level of income.

name: colorado
sentence: On November 3, 2020, electors approved an initiative to reduce this rate to 4.55%.

name: colorado
sentence: Unlike most states, which calculate taxes based on federal adjusted gross income, Colorado taxes are based on taxable income — income after federal exemptions and detailed (or standard) federal deductions.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's retail sales tax is 2.9%.

name: colorado
sentence: When government revenues exceed the constitutional limits of the state, according to the Colorado Taxpayer's Bill of Rights, Colorado residents of the entire year may claim a sales tax refund on their state income tax return.

name: colorado
sentence: Many counties and cities impose their own rates, in addition to the basic state rate.

name: colorado
sentence: There are also certain special county and district taxes that may apply.

name: colorado
sentence: Real and personal business property is taxable in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The main exemption from state property tax was temporarily suspended by the Colorado Legislative Assembly in 2003.

name: colorado
sentence: The tax relief was to be reported for the 2006 taxation year, payable in 2007.

name: colorado
sentence: In December 2018, the state's unemployment rate was 4.2%.

name: colorado
sentence: The 2018 West Virginia Teachers' Strike prompted teachers in other states, including Colorado, to take similar measures.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has important hydrocarbon resources.

name: colorado
sentence: According to the Energy Information Administration, Colorado houses seven of the nation's one hundred largest natural gas deposits and two of its one hundred largest oil deposits.

name: colorado
sentence: Conventional and non-conventional natural gas production in several Colorado basins generally accounts for more than 5% of the annual production of natural gas in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado oil shale deposits contain about 1 trillion barrels (160 km3) of oil, almost as much oil as the world's proven oil reserves; however, the economic viability of the oil shale has not been demonstrated.

name: colorado
sentence: Significant deposits of bituminous, subbituminous and lignite coal are present in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Uranium mining in Colorado dates back to 1872, when pitchblende ore was mined from gold mines near Central City, Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado uranium industry has experienced booms and failures, but continues to this day.

name: colorado
sentence: Apart from phosphate-derived uranium, Colorado is considered to have the third largest uranium reserve in any U.S. state, behind Wyoming and New Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: Uranium prices increased between 2001 and 2007 and prompted a number of companies to restart uranium mining in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The lower prices and financing problems at the end of 2008 forced these companies to cancel or reduce the uranium mining project.

name: colorado
sentence: Currently, there are no uranium mines in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The high peaks of the Colorado Rockies and the eastern plains offer wind energy potential, and geological activity in mountainous areas offers potential for geothermal energy development.

name: colorado
sentence: A large part of the state is sunny, and could produce solar energy.

name: colorado
sentence: The major rivers flowing from the Rocky Mountains offer hydroelectric resources.

name: colorado
sentence: Corn grown in the eastern flats of the state offers potential resources for ethanol production.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's main mode of transport (in terms of passengers) is its road network.

name: colorado
sentence: Interstate 25 (I-25) is the state's main north-south highway linking Pueblo, Colorado Springs, Denver and Fort Collins, extending north to Wyoming and south to New Mexico.

name: colorado
sentence: The I-70 is the main east-west corridor.

name: colorado
sentence: It connects Grand Junction with the mountain communities in Denver, and enters Utah and Kansas.

name: colorado
sentence: The state is home to a network of U.S. and Colorado highways that provide access to all major parts of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Many small communities are connected to the network only by county roads.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver International Airport (DIA) is the fifth busiest airport in the United States and the 20th busiest airport in the world by passenger traffic.

name: colorado
sentence: DIA manages by far the largest volume of commercial air traffic in Colorado, and is the busiest American hub airport between Chicago and the Pacific coast, making Denver the most important airport to connect passenger traffic in the western United States.

name: colorado
sentence: Extensive public transport bus services are available both within the city and within the city, including the numerous RTD services in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
sentence: The Regional Transport District (RTD) operates the popular bus and rail system in the Denver metropolitan area.

name: colorado
sentence: As of January 2013, there were 170 light rail vehicles in the RTD system, serving 47 miles (76 km) of rail.

name: colorado
sentence: Amtrak operates two passenger train lines in Colorado, California Zephyr and Southwest Chief.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado's contribution to the history of the world railway was forged mainly by the Denver and Rio Grande Western Railroad, which began in 1870 and wrote the book on the mountain railway.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1988, the "Rio Grande" was acquired, but was merged in, the Southern Pacific Railroad by their co-owner Philip Anschutz.

name: colorado
sentence: On September 11, 1996, Anschutz sold the combined company to the Union Pacific Railroad, creating the largest railway network in the United States.

name: colorado
sentence: The sale of Anschutz was in part a result of the earlier merger of Burlington Northern and Santa Fe, which formed the great Burlington Northern and Santa Fe Railway (BNSF), the main competitor of the Union Pacific in the western U.S. railway sector.

name: colorado
sentence: Both the Union Pacific and BNSF have major freight operations in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado freight rail network consists of 2,688 miles of Class I tracks.

name: colorado
sentence: It is an integral part of the American economy, being a critical artery for the movement of energy, agriculture, mining and industrial products, as well as general freight and manufactured goods between the East and the Midwest and Pacific coastal states.

name: colorado
sentence: In August 2014, Colorado began issuing driver's licences to foreigners who were not legally resident in the United States and who lived in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: In September 2014, KCNC reported that 524 non-citizens were issued Colorado driver's licences that are normally issued to U.S. citizens living in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: Like the federal government and all other American states, the constitution of the State of Colorado provides for three branches of government: legislative, executive and judicial.

name: colorado
sentence: The Governor of Colorado directs the executive power of the State.

name: colorado
sentence: The current governor is Jared Polis, a democrat.

name: colorado
sentence: The other leaders elected throughout the State of Colorado are the Lieutenant Governor of Colorado (elected on a note with the Governor), the Secretary of State of Colorado, the Treasurer of State of Colorado and the Attorney General of Colorado, all holding a four-year term.

name: colorado
sentence: The seven-member Colorado Supreme Court is the highest court in the state with seven judges.

name: colorado
sentence: The Colorado Court of Appeal, with 22 judges, sits on the divisions of three judges each.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is divided into 22 judicial districts, each having a district court and a county court with limited jurisdiction.

name: colorado
sentence: The State also has a water court, which sits in seven separate divisions around the State and decides on matters relating to water rights and the use and administration of water.

name: colorado
sentence: The legislative body of the State is the Colorado General Assembly, which consists of two chambers - the House of Representatives and the Senate.

name: colorado
sentence: The House has 65 members, and Senator 35 members.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2018, the Democratic Party held a majority of 19-16 in the Senate and a majority of 41-24 in the House.

name: colorado
sentence: Most of the Coloradans came from other states (nearly 60% according to the 2000 census), which is illustrated by the fact that the state did not have a 1975 native governor (when John David Vanderhoof left his post) until 2007, when Bill Ritter took office; his election the previous year marked the first election victory of a native Coloradan in a gubernatory race since 1958 (Vanderhoof had taken up the post of lieutenant governor when John Arthur Love obtained a position in Richard Nixon's administration in 1973).

name: colorado
sentence: In the 2016 election, the Democratic Party won the votes of Colorado's electoral colleges.

name: colorado
sentence: Tax is collected by the Colorado Ministry of Revenue.

name: colorado
sentence: The State of Colorado is divided into 64 counties.

name: colorado
sentence: Counties are important government units in Colorado as the state does not have secondary civil subdivisions such as the townships.

name: colorado
sentence: Two of these counties, the City and County of Denver and the City and County of Broomfield, have consolidated city and county governments.

name: colorado
sentence: Nine Colorado counties have a population of over 250,000 each, while eight Colorado counties have a population of less than 2,500 each.

name: colorado
sentence: The ten most populated counties in Colorado are all located in the Front Range urban corridor.

name: colorado
sentence: The U.S. Office of Management and Budget (OMB) has defined a Combined Statistical Area (CSA), seven Metropolitan Statistical Zones (MSA) and seven Micropolitan Statistical Zones (μSA) in Colorado State.

name: colorado
sentence: The statistical area of Denver-Aurora-Broomfield, CO Metropolitan Statistical Area, is the most populated of the 14 basic statistical areas in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This region had an estimated population of 2,888,227 on July 1, 2017, an increase of +13.55 per cent since the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The largest Denver-Aurora-Boulder, a combined statistical area of CO, had an estimated population of 3,515,374 on July 1, 2017, an increase of +13.73% since the 2010 United States Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The most populated metropolitan area in the Rocky Mountains region is the Front Range urban corridor along the northeast side of the Southern Rocky Mountains.

name: colorado
sentence: This region with Denver in its centre had an estimated population of 4,495,181 as of July 1, 2012, an increase of +3.73% since the 2010 United States Census.

name: colorado
sentence: The State of Colorado currently has 271 incorporated municipalities, including 196 cities, 73 cities, and two consolidated city and county governments.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado municipalities are governed by one of five types of municipal authorities.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has a city with a territorial charter, 160 statutory cities, 12 statutory cities, 96 home municipalities (61 cities and 35 cities) and two consolidated city and county governments.

name: colorado
sentence: In addition to its 271 municipalities, Colorado has 187 census sites and many other small communities.

name: colorado
sentence: The State of Colorado has more than 3,000 districts with a tax authority.

name: colorado
sentence: These districts may provide schools, law enforcement services, fire protection, water, wastewater, drainage, irrigation, transportation, recreation, infrastructure, cultural facilities, business support, rehabilitation or other services.

name: colorado
sentence: Some of these districts have the authority to collect sales tax as well as property tax and user fees.

name: colorado
sentence: This has led to a hodgepodge of sales tax and property tax rates in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: There are street intersections in Colorado with a different sales tax rate at every corner, sometimes significantly different.

name: colorado
sentence: Some of the most important districts in Colorado include:

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is considered a swing state or (most recently) a blue state in both national and federal elections.

name: colorado
sentence: In the presidential elections, it had only been won in 2020 by two digits since 1984 and supported the winning candidate in 9 of the last 11 elections.

name: colorado
sentence: The Coloradans elected 17 Democrats and 12 Republicans as governors over the past 100 years.

name: colorado
sentence: In presidential politics, Colorado was seen as a reliable republican state in the post-world war era, voting for the Democratic candidate only in 1948, 1964 and 1992.

name: colorado
sentence: However, it became a state of competitive change in the 1990s.

name: colorado
sentence: Since the mid-2000s he has climbed to the Democrats, voting for Barack Obama in 2008 and 2012, Hillary Clinton in 2016 and Joe Biden in 2020.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado policy contrasts with conservative cities such as Colorado Springs and Grand Junction and liberal cities such as Boulder and Denver.

name: colorado
sentence: The Democrats are the strongest in Denver's metropolis, the collegial cities of Fort Collins and Boulder, southern Colorado (including Pueblo), and a number of counties in the western ski resort.

name: colorado
sentence: Republicans are the strongest in the Eastern Plains, Colorado Springs, Greeley and far Western Colorado near Grand Junction.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is represented by two U.S. senators:

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is represented by seven representatives in the U.S. House of Representatives:

name: colorado
sentence: In 1881, Colorado voters approved a referendum that chose Denver as the capital of the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado was the first state in the Union to pass, by electoral referendum, a law extending the suffrage to women.

name: colorado
sentence: This initiative was approved by state voters on 7 November 1893.

name: colorado
sentence: In the vote of November 8, 1932, Colorado approved the repeal of the alcohol ban more than a year before the ratification of the twenty-first amendment to the United States Constitution.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado has banned, via C.R.S.

name: colorado
sentence: Article 12-6-302, sale of motor vehicles on Sundays since at least 1953.

name: colorado
sentence: In 1972, Colorado voters rejected a referendum proposal to fund the 1976 Olympic Winter Games, which were scheduled to take place in the state.

name: colorado
sentence: Denver had been chosen by the International Olympic Committee as the host city on 12 May 1970.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2006, voters adopted Amendment No. 43, which was intended to prohibit homosexual marriage in Colorado.

name: colorado
sentence: This initiative was set aside by the decision of the Supreme Court of the United States in 2015 in Obergefell v. Hodges.

name: colorado
sentence: In 2012, voters amended the state constitution protecting "personal use" of marijuana for adults, establishing a framework for regulating cannabis in a manner similar to that of alcohol.

name: colorado
sentence: The first recreational marijuana stores in Colorado, by extension in the United States, opened on January 1, 2014.

name: colorado
sentence: On May 29, 2019, Governor Jared Polis signed House Bill 1124 immediately prohibiting Colorado law enforcement officials from detaining undocumented immigrants solely on the basis of an application for immigration and enforcement by U.S. customs.

name: colorado
sentence: Former military installations and outposts include:

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado is home to 4 national parks, 8 national monuments, 2 national recreational areas, 2 national historic sites, 3 national historic trails, 1 national panoramic trail, 11 national forests, 2 national grasslands, 42 national nature reserves, 2 national conservation areas, 8 national wildlife shelters, 44 state parks, 307 state wildlife reserves and many other panoramic, historical and recreational areas.

name: colorado
sentence: Colorado National Parks System Units:

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is a state of New England, located in the northeastern part of the United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: In the 2010 census, it has the highest per capita income, the Human Development Index (0.962) and the median household income in the United States.

name: connecticut
sentence: It is bordered by Rhode Island to the east, Massachusetts to the north, New York to the west, and Long Island Sound to the south.

name: connecticut
sentence: Its capital is Hartford and its most populous city is Bridgeport.

name: connecticut
sentence: Geographically, the state is part of New England, and although its cultural history comes from the region, in the modern era, large sections of it are increasingly linked to the three-state region with New York and New Jersey.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state is named for the Connecticut River which approximately bisects the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The word "Connecticut" is derived from various anglicized spellings of "Quononoquett (Conanicut)," a word Mohegan-Pequot for "long raz-de-marée".

name: connecticut
sentence: The first European settlers in Connecticut were Dutch, who established a small, short-lived settlement called Fort Hoop at Hartford at the confluence of the Park and Connecticut rivers.

name: connecticut
sentence: Half of Connecticut was originally part of the Dutch colony New Netherlands, which included much of the land between Connecticut and Delaware, although the first large colonies were established by the English in the 1630s.

name: connecticut
sentence: Thomas Hooker led a band of followers from the Massachusetts Bay colony and founded the Connecticut colony

name: connecticut
sentence: The colonies of Connecticut and New Haven have established documents of fundamental order, considered the first constitutions in America.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1662 the three colonies merged under a royal charter, making Connecticut a colony of the crown.

name: connecticut
sentence: It was one of the Thirteen Colonies that rejected British rule in the American Revolution.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is the third smallest state by region, the 29th most populated, and the fourth most densely populated of the fifty states.

name: connecticut
sentence: It is known as the "State of the Constitution", the "State of Nutmeg", the "State of the Supply" and the "State of the Steady Habits".

name: connecticut
sentence: It played an important role in the development of the U.S. federal government (see Connecticut Compromise).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut River, the Thames River, and ports along the Long Island Strait have given Connecticut a strong maritime tradition that continues today.

name: connecticut
sentence: The government also has a long history of hosting the financial services industry, including insurance companies in Hartford and hedge funds in Fairfield County.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is bordered south by Long Island Sound, west by New York, north by Massachusetts and east by Rhode Island.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state capital and the fourth largest city are Hartford, and other major cities (by population) are Bridgeport, New Haven, Stamford, Waterbury, Norwalk, Danbury, New Britain, Greenwich and Bristol.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is slightly bigger than Montenegro.

name: connecticut
sentence: There are 169 cities incorporated in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest peak in Connecticut is Bear Mountain in Salisbury, in the northwest corner of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The highest point is just east of Connecticut, Massachusetts, and New York (42°3′ N, 73°29′ W), on the southern slope of Mount Frissell, which peaks near Massachusetts.

name: connecticut
sentence: To the extreme opposite, many coastal cities have areas less than 20 feet (6 m) above sea level.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has a long maritime history and a reputation based on this history, but the state does not have a direct seafront (technically speaking).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut coast is located on the Long Island Strait, which is an estuary.

name: connecticut
sentence: The state's access to the Atlantic Ocean is both west (to the city of New York) and east (to the "race" near Rhode Island).

name: connecticut
sentence: This situation provides many safe harbours from ocean storms, and many transatlantic ships seek anchor within Long Island Strait when tropical cyclones pass off the upper east coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut River crosses the central part of the state and flows through Long Island Strait.

name: connecticut
sentence: The most populated metropolitan area in the centre of the state lies in the Connecticut River Valley.

name: connecticut
sentence: Despite the relatively small size of Connecticut, it has large regional variations in its landscape; for example, in the northwest Litchfield Hills it includes mountains and horse farms, while in areas east of New Haven along the coast, the landscape includes coastal marshes, beaches and large-scale marine activities.

name: connecticut
sentence: The rural areas and small towns of Connecticut in the northeast and northwest corners of the state contrast strongly with its industrial cities such as Stamford, Bridgeport and New Haven, located along the coastal highways of the New York border to New London, then north to the Connecticut River to Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many cities in the northeast and northwest of Connecticut center around a green.

name: connecticut
sentence: Near the green are usually historical visual symbols of New England cities, such as a white church, colonial meeting house, colonial tavern or inn, several colonial houses, etc., establishing a picturesque historical appearance maintained for historical preservation and tourism.

name: connecticut
sentence: Many of the southern and coastal regions of Connecticut have been built and rebuilt over the years, and look less visually like traditional New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: The northern boundary of the state with Massachusetts is marked by the Southwick Jog or Granby Notch, a square detour of approximately 4.0 km to Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The origin of this anomaly is clearly established in a long series of disputes and temporary agreements that were finally concluded in 1804, when the residents of southern Southwick sought to leave Massachusetts, and the city was divided into two.

name: connecticut
sentence: The southwestern border of Connecticut, where it is an exception to the state of New York, is marked by a panhandle in Fairfield County, containing the cities of Greenwich, Stamford, New Canaan, Darien, and parts of Norwalk and Wilton.

name: connecticut
sentence: This irregularity in the border is the result of territorial disputes at the end of the 17th century, culminating with New York abandoning its claim to the region, which residents considered to be part of Connecticut, in exchange for an equivalent area extending north of Ridgefield on the Massachusetts border, as well as the undisputed claim of Rye, New York.

name: connecticut
sentence: Areas maintained by the National Parks Service include the Appalachian National Scenic Trail, the Quinebaug and Shetucket River Valley National Heritage Corridor and Weir Farm National Historic Site.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut is located in the rough transition zone between the southern end of the humid continental climate and the northern part of the humid subtropical climate.

name: connecticut
sentence: Northern Connecticut generally has a climate with cold winters with moderate snowfalls and warm and humid summers.

name: connecticut
sentence: The extreme south and the coast of Connecticut have a climate with cool winters with a mixture of rain and rare snow, and the long warm and humid summers typical of the middle and lower East coast.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut sees a fairly consistent precipitation pattern with precipitation and snowfall that has spread throughout the 12 months.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut accounts for an average of 56% of the possible sunlight (higher than the U.S. national average), an average of 2400 hours of sunshine per year.

name: connecticut
sentence: Early spring (April) can range from slightly cool (40s to 50s F) to hot (65 to 70 F), while mid and late spring (late April/May) are warm.

name: connecticut
sentence: At the end of May, the Bermuda High Building created a southern flow of warm, humid tropical air, bringing warm weather conditions throughout the state, with high means in New London of 81°F (27°C) and 85°F (29°C) in the Windsor Locks at the top of the summer in late July.

name: connecticut
sentence: Occasionally, heat waves of 90 to 100 °F (38 °C) occur across Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Although summers are sunny in Connecticut, fast-moving summer storms can cause short showers with thunder and lightning.

name: connecticut
sentence: Sometimes these thunderstorms can be severe, and the state on average one tornado per year.

name: connecticut
sentence: During the hurricane season, remnants of tropical cyclones sometimes affect the region, although a direct impact is rare.

name: connecticut
sentence: The time usually associated with the fall season usually starts in October and lasts until the first days of December.

name: connecticut
sentence: The daily temperatures in October and November vary between the 1950s and 1960s (Fahrenheit) with nights in the 1940s and 1930s.

name: connecticut
sentence: In early October, coloured foliage began in the northern parts of the state and moved south and east to south-east Connecticut in early November.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, the southern and coastal regions have more oaks and hickory trees (and fewer maples) and are often less colourful than the northern regions.

name: connecticut
sentence: In December, the highs of day are in 40°F for much of the state, and the lows of night are below freezing.

name: connecticut
sentence: Winters (from December to mid-March) are generally cold from south to north in Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: The coldest month (January) has average high temperatures ranging from 38°F (3°C) in coastal lowlands to 33°F (1°C) in the interior and northern parts of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Average annual snowfall ranges from about 60 inches (1,500 mm) at high elevations in the northern part of the state to only 20-25 inches (510-640 mm) along the southeast coast of Connecticut (Branford to Groton).

name: connecticut
sentence: In general, any community north or west of Interstate 84 receives the most snow during a storm and throughout the season.

name: connecticut
sentence: Most Connecticut has less than 60 days of snow cover.

name: connecticut
sentence: Snow usually falls from late November to late March in the northern part of the state and from early December to mid-March in the southern and coastal parts of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: The record temperature of Connecticut is 106°F (41°C) which occurred in Danbury on 15 July 1995; the record low is -32°F (−36°C) which occurred in the Northwest Hills Falls Village on 16 February 1943 and Coventry on 22 January 1961.

name: connecticut
sentence: The forests consist of a mixture of coastal forests in the northeast of Oak in the southern regions of the state, in the high forests of New England and Acadia in the north-western parts of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Mountain Laurel (Kalmia latifolia) is the flower of the state and is native to low ridges in several parts of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Rosebay Rhododendron (maximum Rhododendron) is also native to the eastern Connecticut Highlands and the Pachaug State Forest houses the Rhododendron Sanctuary Trail.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Atlantic white cedar (Chamaecyparis thyoides) is found in wetlands in the south of the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut has a native cactus (Opuntia humifusa), found in sandy coastal areas and low hills.

name: connecticut
sentence: Several types of beach grass and wildflowers are also native to Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut covers hardiness areas of USDA plants 5b to 7a.

name: connecticut
sentence: Coastal Connecticut is the vast transition area where more southern and subtropical plants are grown.

name: connecticut
sentence: In some coastal communities, Magnolia grandiflora (southern magnolia), Crape Myrtle, palm scrub (Sabal minor), Needle Palms (Rhapidophyllum hystrix) and other broad-leaved hardwoods are cultivated in small numbers.

name: connecticut
sentence: The name Connecticut is derived from the word Mohegan-Pequot, which was translated as "long tide river" and "long river", referring to the Connecticut River.

name: connecticut
sentence: The human presence in the Connecticut region dates back to 10,000 years.

name: connecticut
sentence: Stone tools have been used for hunting, fishing and woodworking.

name: connecticut
sentence: Semi-nomads in the way of life, these peoples have moved seasonally to take advantage of various resources in the region.

name: connecticut
sentence: They shared languages based on algonquian.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut region was inhabited by several Amerindian tribes that can be grouped in the Nipmuc, the Sequins or the "River Indians" (which included the Tunxis, Schaghticoke, Podunk, Wangunk, Hammonasset and Quinnipiac), the Mattabesec or the "Wolf Confederation" and the Pequot-Mohegan.

name: connecticut
sentence: Some of these groups continue to remain in Connecticut, including the Mohegans, Pequots and Paugusetts.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first European explorer in Connecticut was the Dutch Adriaen Block, who explored the region in 1614.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Dutch fur traders then sailed on the Connecticut River, which they called Versche Rivier ("Fresh River"), and built a fort at Dutch Point in Hartford that they called "House of Hope" (Dutch: Huis van Hoop).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Connecticut colony was originally a number of small, distinct settlements in Windsor, Wethersfield, Saybrook, Hartford and New Haven.

name: connecticut
sentence: The first English settlers came in 1633 and moved to Windsor and Wethersfield the following year.

name: connecticut
sentence: John Winthrop the youth of Massachusetts received a commission to establish the Saybrook settlement at the mouth of the Connecticut River in 1635.

name: connecticut
sentence: The main body of settlers came into a large group in 1636.

name: connecticut
sentence: They were Puritans of the Massachusetts Bay colony, led by Thomas Hooker, who founded the Connecticut colony at Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Quinnipiack colony was founded by John Davenport, Theophilus Eaton and others at New Haven in March 1638.

name: connecticut
sentence: The colony of New Haven had its own constitution called the "Basic Agreement of the colony of New Haven", signed on 4 June 1639.

name: connecticut
sentence: The regulations were made without official sanction from the English Crown, and each was an independent political entity.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1662 Winthrop travelled to England and obtained a charter from Charles II, which united the colonies of Connecticut.

name: connecticut
sentence: Colonial colonies of historic significance include Windsor (1633), Wethersfield (1634), Saybrook (1635), Hartford (1636), New Haven (1638), Fairfield (1639), Guilford (1639), Milford (1639), Stratford (1639), Farmington (1640), Stamford (1641) and New London (1646).

name: connecticut
sentence: The Pequot War marked the first major confrontation between the settlers and the Amerindians in New England.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Pequots reacted with increasing aggression to the colonial colonies on their territory, while simultaneously taking land from the Narragansett and Mohegan tribes.

name: connecticut
sentence: The settlers responded to a murder in 1636 by raiding a village of Pequot on Block Island; the Pequots besieged the Saybrook Colony garrison this fall and then attacked Wethersfield in the spring of 1637.

name: connecticut
sentence: The settlers declared war on the Pequots, organized a group of militias and allies of the Mohegan and Narragansett tribes, and attacked a village of Pequot on the Mystic River, with estimates of the number of deaths ranging from 300 to 700 Pequots.

name: connecticut
sentence: After another major loss in a battle at Fairfield, the Pequots called for a truce and conditions of peace.

name: connecticut
sentence: The western boundaries of Connecticut have been subject to change over time.

name: connecticut
sentence: The Hartford treaty with the Dutch was signed on 19 Sept. 1650, but it was never ratified by the British.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to her, the western boundary of Connecticut extended north of Greenwich Bay for a distance of 32 kilometres, provided that the line is not less than 10 miles from the Hudson River.

name: connecticut
sentence: With more than 600 miles of coastline, including along its navigable rivers, during the colonial years, Connecticut developed a history of a maritime tradition that would later produce booms in shipbuilding, shipping, naval support, seafood production and boating.

name: connecticut

name: connecticut
sentence: In the two decades preceding 1776 and the American Revolution, the shipyards of Connecticut launched about 100 sloops, schooners and brigs according to a US customs database maintained online by the Mystic Seaport Museum, the most important being the 180-ton Patient Mary launched in New Haven in 1763.

name: connecticut

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut nominated four delegates to the Second Continental Congress who signed the Declaration of Independence: Samuel Huntington, Roger Sherman, William Williams and Oliver Wolcott.

name: connecticut

name: connecticut

name: connecticut

name: connecticut

name: connecticut

name: connecticut

name: connecticut

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut ratified the United States Constitution on 9 January 1788, becoming the fifth state.

name: connecticut

name: connecticut

name: connecticut
sentence: When World War I broke out in 1914, Connecticut became a major supplier of arms to the American army; in 1918, 80% of the state's industries produced goods for the war effort.

sentence: Remington Arms in Bridgeport produced half of the small arms cartridges used by the U.S. Army, along with other important suppliers, including Winchester in New Haven and Colt in Hartford.

name: connecticut
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that the Connecticut population was 3,565,287 as at 1 July 2019, a 0.25 per cent decrease from the 2010 U.S. Census.

sentence: In 2019, the Connecticut population was estimated at 3,565,287, a decrease of 7,378 (0.25%) from the previous year and 8,810 (0.25%) from 2010.

sentence: This includes a natural increase since the last census of 67,427 (22,222 births minus 154,795 deaths) and an increase due to net migration of 41,718 people in the state.

sentence: Immigration from outside the United States resulted in a net increase of 75,991 people, and migration within the country resulted in a net loss of 34,273.

sentence: 6.6 per cent of its population were under the age of 5, 24.7 per cent under the age of 18 and 13.8 per cent over the age of 65.

sentence: Women accounted for about 51.6 per cent of the population, with 48.4 per cent of men.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's economic output in 2019, measured by gross domestic product, was $289 billion, compared to $277.9 billion in 2018.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut's personal income per capita in 2019 was estimated at $79,087, the highest of all states.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, there is a large disparity in income across the state; after New York, Connecticut had the second largest national difference between average incomes of the highest 1 per cent and average incomes of the lowest 99 per cent.

sentence: Hartford is the poorest municipality in Connecticut with a per capita income of $13,428 in 2000.
