name: connecticut
sentence: Tax is collected by the Ministry of Tax Services of Connecticut and by local municipalities.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2012, after New York City, Connecticut residents had the second highest national tax rate, 12.6 per cent of income compared to the national average of 9.9 per cent, as reported by the Tax Foundation.

name: connecticut
sentence: Prior to 1991, Connecticut only had an income tax system.

name: connecticut
sentence: Employment income was not taxed, but investment income was taxed at 13%, the highest rate in the United States, without deducting the cost of producing investment income, such as interest on loans.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 1991, under the authority of Governor Lowell P. Weicker Jr., an independent, the system was changed into a system in which taxes on employment income and investment income were equal to the maximum rate of 4%.

name: connecticut
sentence: The new tax policy attracted investment firms to Connecticut; in 2019, Fairfield County was home to 16 of the world's 200 largest hedge funds.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2019, Connecticut's personal income tax rates were divided into seven tax brackets of 3% (on income up to $10,000); 5% ($10,000 to $50,000); 5.5% ($50,000 to $100,000); 6% ($100,000 to $200,000); 6.5% ($200,000 to $250,000); 6.9% ($250,000 to $500,000) and 6.9% above $500,000, the additional amounts being due by the band.

name: connecticut
sentence: All salaries of Connecticut residents are subject to State income tax, even if they are earned outside the state.

name: connecticut
sentence: However, in such cases, Connecticut's income tax should be withheld only to the extent that Connecticut's tax exceeds the amount withheld by the other administration.

name: connecticut
sentence: Since New York has higher income tax rates than Connecticut, this does mean that Connecticut residents who work in New York do not have any Connecticut income tax withheld.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut allows a credit for taxes paid to other jurisdictions, but since residents working in other states are still subject to Connecticut's income tax, they may be liable for taxes if the jurisdictional credit does not fully offset Connecticut's tax amount.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut collects a sales tax of 6.35% on the retail sale, rental or rental of most of the property.

name: connecticut
sentence: Certain articles and services in general are not subject to sales and use taxes unless they are expressly listed as taxable by law.

name: connecticut
sentence: A provision excluding clothing less than $50 from sales tax was repealed on July 1, 2011.

name: connecticut
sentence: There are no additional sales taxes imposed by the local authorities.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2001, Connecticut introduced what became an annual "holiday" sales tax each August of a week, when retailers do not have to pay sales tax on certain items and quantities of clothing that have varied from year to year.

name: connecticut
sentence: State law allows municipalities to tax property, including real property, vehicles and other personal property, with state law providing for various exemptions, credits and allowances.

name: connecticut
sentence: All contributions are at 70% of fair market value.

name: connecticut
sentence: The maximum property tax credit is $200 per return and any surplus cannot be refunded or carried over.

name: connecticut
sentence: According to the Tax Foundation, during fiscal year 2017, Connecticut residents paid the nation's third highest average property tax after New Hampshire and New Jersey.

name: connecticut
sentence: As of January 1, 2020, gas taxes and duties in Connecticut were 40.13 cents per gallon, 11th highest in the United States, with a national average of 36.13 cents per gallon excluding federal taxes.

name: connecticut
sentence: In January 2020, taxes and charges on diesel fuel in Connecticut were 46.50 cents per gallon, the ninth highest at the national level, with an American average of 37.91 cents.

name: connecticut
sentence: In 2019, single-family home sales in Connecticut totaled 33,146 units, down 2.1% from total transactions in 2018.

name: connecticut
sentence: The median house sold in 2019 recorded a transaction value of $260,000, up 0.4% from 2018.

name: connecticut
sentence: Connecticut recorded the seventh highest rate of foreclosure activity in the country in 2019, accounting for 0.53 per cent of total housing stock.

name: connecticut
sentence: Finance, insurance and real estate were the largest industry in Connecticut in 2018, ranked by gross domestic product, generating $75.7 billion in GDP that year.

name: connecticut
sentence: The main employers in the financial sector are The Hartford, Travelers, Cigna, the Aetna subsidiary of CVS Health, Mass Mutual, People's United Financial, Bank of America, Realogy, Bridgewater Associates, GE Capital, William Raveis Real Estate and Berkshire Hathaway through residential reinsurance and real estate subsidiaries.

name: connecticut
sentence: The combined education, health and social services sector was the largest industry classified by employment, with a combined workforce of 342,600 people at the end of 2019, ranking fourth of the previous year in GDP at $28.3 billion.

sentence: Delaware is a state in the Mid-Atlantic region of the United States that borders Maryland in the south and west, Pennsylvania in the north, and New Jersey and the Atlantic Ocean in the east.

name: hawaii
sentence: The history of the Hawaiian economy can be traced through a succession of dominant industries: sandalwood, whaling, sugar cane, pineapple, military, tourism and education.

sentence: Since the creation of the State in 1959, tourism has been the largest sector, accounting for 24.3 per cent of gross domestic product (GDP) in 1997, despite diversification efforts.

sentence: Gross State output for 2003 was US$ 47 billion; per capita income for Hawaiians in 2014 was US$ 54,516.

sentence: The Hawaiian exports include food and clothing.

name: hawaii
sentence: These industries play a small role in the Hawaiian economy, due to the maritime distance to viable markets, such as the contiguous west coast of the United States.

sentence: Government food exports include coffee, macadamia nuts, pineapple, cattle, sugar cane and honey.

name: hawaii
sentence: By weight, honeybees can be the most valuable export in the state.

sentence: According to the Hawaii Agricultural Statistics Service, agricultural sales amounted to US$370.9 million for diversified agriculture, US$100.6 million for pineapple, and US$64.3 million for sugar cane.

name: hawaii

name: hawaii
sentence: The median value of housing in Hawaii at the 2000 Census was US$272,700, while the median national value of housing was US$119,600.

sentence: Hawaii's residential values were highest in all states, including California, with a median value of US$211,500.

name: hawaii
sentence: Research by the National Association of Realtors places the 2010 median selling price of a single-family home in Honolulu, Hawaii, at US$607,600 and the US median selling price at US$173,200.

name: hawaii
sentence: The selling price of individual homes in Hawaii was the highest of all U.S. cities in 2010, just above that of California's Silicon Valley region ($602,000).

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii's very high cost of living is the result of several interrelated factors in the global economy, in addition to the US government's trade policy.

name: hawaii
sentence: Like other areas where weather conditions are desirable throughout the year, such as California, Arizona and Florida, Hawaii residents may be considered to be subject to a "sun tax".

name: hawaii
sentence: This situation is further compounded by the natural factors of geography and global distribution, which lead to higher freight prices due to higher transport costs, a problem also affecting many island States and territories.

name: hawaii
sentence: The requirements of the Jones Act, which generally requires that goods be transported between locations within the United States, including between the west mainland coast of the United States and Hawaii, using only ships owned, constructed and crewed by the United States.

name: hawaii
sentence: Ships complying with the Jones Act often cost more to build and operate than they do abroad, which can increase shipping costs.

name: hawaii
sentence: Although the Jones Act does not affect the transportation of goods to Hawaii directly from Asia, this type of trade is not common; this is primarily an economic consequence, including the additional costs associated with the stopover in Hawaii (e.g., Hawai).

name: hawaii
sentence: port and pilotage fees), the size of the Hawaii market and the economy of using increasingly large vessels that cannot be handled in Hawaii for transoceanic voyages.

name: hawaii
sentence: As a result, Hawaii relies on the receipt of most incoming goods on Jones Act certified vessels originating on the west coast of the United States, which could contribute to the increase in the cost of certain consumer goods and thus in the overall cost of living.

name: hawaii
sentence: Critics of the Jones Act argue that Hawaiian consumers ultimately bear the freight charges imposed by the Jones Act.

name: hawaii
sentence: Hawaii's native culture is Polynesian.

sentence: Hawaii represents the northernmost extension of the vast Polynesian triangle of the south and central Pacific Ocean.

sentence: While traditional Hawaiian culture remains a vestige of modern Hawaiian society, ceremonies and traditions are renewed in all the islands.

sentence: Some of these cultural influences, including the popularity (in a significantly modified form) of lûau and hula, are strong enough to affect the United States as a whole.

sentence: Hawaii's cuisine is a fusion of many foods brought by immigrants to the Hawaiian Islands, including the early Polynesians and Hawaiian indigenous cuisine, and the American, Chinese, Filipino, Japanese, Korean, Polynesian, Puerto Rican and Portuguese origins.

sentence: Plant and animal feed sources are imported from around the world for agricultural purposes into Hawaii.

sentence: Poi, a starch made by pounding taro, is one of the traditional foods on the islands.

name: hawaii
sentence: Many local restaurants serve the ubiquitous breakfast dish, which includes two rice scoops, a simplified version of American macaroni salad and a variety of garnishes, including hamburger paties, a fried egg, and a loco moco sauce, Japanese-style tonkatsu or traditional lûau dishes, including kālua pork and laula.

sentence: The musubi spam is an example of the fusion of ethnic cuisine on the islands between immigrant groups and military personnel.

sentence: Some key customs and labels in Hawaii are as follows: when visiting a house, it is considered as good ways to bring a small gift to its host (e.g. dessert).

name: hawaii
sentence: Although Hawaii is internationally recognized as a State of the United States while being widely accepted as such in general understanding, the legality of this status has been challenged in the United States District Court, the United Nations and other international forums.

name: hawaii
sentence: Political organizations seeking some form of sovereignty for Hawaii have been active since the late 19th century.

name: hawaii
sentence: In general, the emphasis is on self-determination and autonomy, either for Hawaii as an independent nation (in many proposals, for "Hawai nationals" descended from or declaring themselves to be such by choice from subjects of the Hawaiian Kingdom), or for persons of full or partial Hawaiian ancestry in an indigenous "nation-to-nation" relationship similar to tribal sovereignty with the American federal recognition of Hawaiian indigenous people.

name: hawaii
sentence: The pro-federal recognition of Akaka Bill sparked strong opposition among Hawaiian residents in the 2000s.

sentence: Opponents of the tribal approach claim that this is not a legitimate path to the Hawaiian nation

name: hawaii
sentence: The Hawaiian sovereignty movement considered the overthrow of the Hawaiian Kingdom in 1893 to be illegal, and considered the subsequent annexation of Hawaii by the United States as illegal; the movement sought some form of greater autonomy for Hawaii, such as the free association or independence of the United States.

name: hawaii
sentence: Some groups also argue for some form of reparation from the United States for the overthrow of Queen Liliuokalani in 1893 and for what is described as a prolonged military occupation beginning with the annexation of 1898.

name: hawaii
sentence: The resolution of excuses adopted by the United States Congress in 1993 was cited as a major impetus for the movement for Hawaiian sovereignty.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho is a state in the Pacific Northwest region of the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: It borders the state of Montana in the east and northeast, Wyoming in the east, Nevada and Utah in the south, and Washington and Oregon in the west.

name: idaho
sentence: To the north, it shares a small portion of the Canadian border with the Province of British Columbia.

name: idaho
sentence: With a population of approximately 1.7 million and an area of 33,570 square miles (216,400 km2), Idaho is the 14th largest, the 12th least populated and the 7th least populated of the 50 American states.

name: idaho
sentence: The capital of the State and the largest city is Boise.

name: idaho
sentence: For thousands of years Idaho has been inhabited by Amerindian peoples.

name: idaho
sentence: At the beginning of the 19th century, Idaho was considered to be part of Oregon, a disputed region between the United States and the British Empire.

name: idaho
sentence: It officially became American territory with the signing of the Oregon Treaty of 1846, but a separate Idaho territory was organized only in 1863, instead of being included for periods in the Oregon Territory and the Washington Territory.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho was finally admitted to the Union on July 3, 1890, becoming the 43rd state.

name: idaho
sentence: As part of the Pacific Northwest (and the associated Cascadia bioregion), Idaho is divided into several distinct geographical and climatic regions.

name: idaho
sentence: The northern state, the relatively isolated Idaho Panhandle, is closely linked to the east of Washington with which it shares the Pacific Time Zone – the rest of the state uses the Mountain Time Zone.

name: idaho
sentence: The southern part of the state includes the Snake River Plain (which has most of the population and farmland).

name: idaho
sentence: The south-eastern part of the state includes part of the Great Basin.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho is quite mountainous and contains several expanses of the Rocky Mountains.

name: idaho
sentence: The U.S. Forest Service holds approximately 38 per cent of Idaho land, the highest proportion of all states.

name: idaho
sentence: Industries important to the government economy include manufacturing, agriculture, mining, forestry and tourism.

name: idaho
sentence: A number of scientific and technological enterprises have their headquarters in Idaho or factories there, and the State also contains the National Laboratory of Idaho, which is the largest energy department in the country.

name: idaho
sentence: The agricultural sector of Idaho provides many products, but the state is best known for its potato cultivation, which accounts for about a third of the national yield.

name: idaho
sentence: The official nickname of the state is the "Gem State", which refers to the natural beauty of the Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: The origin of the name is a mystery.

name: idaho
sentence: In the early 1860s, when the U.S. Congress planned to organize a new territory in the Rocky Mountains, the name "Idaho" was suggested by George M. Willing, a politician who presented himself as an unrecognized delegate of the unofficial territory of Jefferson.

name: idaho
sentence: Willing claimed that the name was derived from a Shoshone term meaning "the sun comes from the mountains" or "the name of the mountains", but it was later revealed that there was no such term and Willing claimed that he was inspired to give the name when he met a little girl named "Ida".

name: idaho
sentence: As the name seemed to be made, the U.S. Congress finally decided to appoint the Colorado Territory region instead when it was created in February 1861, but by the time that decision was made, the city of Idaho Springs, Colorado had already been appointed according to Willing's proposal.

name: idaho
sentence: That same year, Congress created Colorado Territory, a county called Idaho County, which was established in eastern Washington.

name: idaho
sentence: The county was named after a steamship called Idaho, which was launched on the Columbia River in 1860.

name: idaho
sentence: It is unclear whether the steamship was named before or after Willing's claim was revealed.

name: idaho
sentence: In any event, part of Washington's territory, including Idaho County, was used to create the Idaho Territory in 1863.

name: idaho
sentence: Finally, the name was given to the Idaho territory, which later became the American state.

name: idaho
sentence: Despite this lack of evidence for the origin of the name, many textbooks well in the 20th century repeated as Willing's narrative the name "Idaho" derived from the term Shoshone "ee-da-how".

name: idaho
sentence: A 1956 Idaho History Manual says:

name: idaho
sentence: An alternative to etymology attributes the name to the Plains Apache word "ídaahęя" IPA: [í.ta=.h="] (enemy) which was used in reference to the Comanche.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho borders six U.S. states and one Canadian province.

name: idaho
sentence: The states of Washington and Oregon are to the west, Nevada and Utah are to the south, and Montana and Wyoming are to the east.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho also shares a short border with the Canadian province of British Columbia in the north.

name: idaho
sentence: The landscape is rugged with some of the largest unspoilt natural areas in the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: For example, at 2.3 million acres (930,000 hectares), the Frank Church-River of No Return Wilderness area is the largest contiguous wilderness protected area in the continental United States.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho is a state of the Rocky Mountains with abundant natural resources and picturesque areas.

name: idaho
sentence: The state has snow-covered mountain ranges, rapids, large lakes and steep canyons.

name: idaho
sentence: The waters of the Snake River pass through the Hells Canyon, the deepest gorge in the United States.

name: idaho
sentence: Shoshone Falls descends from cliffs above Niagara Falls.

name: idaho
sentence: By far the most important river in Idaho is the Snake River, a major tributary of the Columbia River.

name: idaho
sentence: The Snake River flows from Yellowstone in northwestern Wyoming across the Snake River plain in southern Idaho before turning north, leaving the state at Lewiston before joining Columbia at Kennewick.

name: idaho
sentence: Other important rivers are the Clark Fork/Pend Oreille River, the Spokane River and the major tributaries of the Snake River, including the Clearwater River, the Salmon River, the Boise River and the Payette River.

name: idaho
sentence: The Salmon River flows into the Snake River in the Hells Canyon and forms the southern boundary of the County of Nez Perce on its north shore, of which Lewiston is the county seat.

name: idaho
sentence: Lewiston Harbour, at the confluence of Clearwater and Snake Rivers, is the furthest port on the west coast, 465 miles from the Pacific, at Astoria, Oregon.

name: idaho
sentence: The vast majority of the Idaho population lives in the Snake River Plain, a valley that crosses the entire southern Idaho from east to west.

name: idaho
sentence: The valley contains the main towns of Boise, Meridian, Nampa, Caldwell, Twin Falls, Idaho Falls and Pocatello.

name: idaho
sentence: The plain served as an easy passage through the Rocky Mountains for settlers westbound on the Oregon Trail, and many settlers chose to settle in the area rather than risk the perfidious road through the Blue Mountains and the Cascade Range to the west.

name: idaho
sentence: The western region of the plain is known as the Treasure Valley, linked between the Owyhee Mountains in the southwest and the Boise Mountains in the northeast.

name: idaho
sentence: The central region of the Snake River Plain is known as the Magic Valley.

sentence: The highest point of the Idaho is Borah Peak, 3,859 metres in the Lost River chain north of Mackay.

sentence: The Sawtooth Range is often considered to be the most famous mountain range in Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: The regions north of the Salmon River, including Coeur d'Alene, Moscow, Lewiston and Sandpoint, are located in the Pacific Time Zone, which has less than a quarter of the population and area of the state.

name: idaho
sentence: The climate of Idaho varies greatly.

name: idaho
sentence: Although the western border of the state is about 350 miles (560 km) from the Pacific Ocean, maritime influence is still felt in Idaho, especially in winter when cloud cover, humidity and precipitation are at their peak.

name: idaho
sentence: This influence has a moderate effect in winter, where temperatures are not as low as might be expected in a northerly state where altitudes are primarily high.

name: idaho
sentence: Maritime influence is less pronounced in the eastern part of the state where rainfall is often reversed, with wetter summers and drier winters, and seasonal temperature differences are more extreme, showing a more semi-arid continental climate.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho can be warm, although prolonged periods of more than 98°F (37°C) are rare, with the exception of the lowest point of altitude, Lewiston, who sees little snow as a result.

name: idaho
sentence: The warm summer days are tempered by low relative humidity and cooler evenings during the summer months since, for most states, the greatest diurnal temperature difference is often in summer.

name: idaho
sentence: Winters may be cold, although long periods of bitter cold below zero are unusual.

name: idaho
sentence: The highest temperature of Idaho at 118°F (48°C) was recorded at Orofino on 28 July 1934; the lowest temperature of Idaho at -60°F (−51°C) was recorded at Island Park Dam on 18 January 1943.

name: idaho
sentence: Humans may have been present in the Idaho area 14,500 years ago.

name: idaho
sentence: Excavations at the Wilson Butte Cave near Twin Falls in 1959 revealed signs of human activity, including arrowheads, which are among the oldest artifacts dated in North America.

name: idaho
sentence: American Indians who predominated in the area included the Perce Nose in the north and the Shoshone in the north and west in the south.

name: idaho
sentence: A late upper paleolithic site was identified at Cooper's Ferry in western Idaho near the town of Cottonwood by archaeologists in 2019.

name: idaho
sentence: According to the evidence found at the site, the first people lived in this area 15,300 to 16,600 years ago, before the Beringia Land Bridge of about 1,000 years old.

name: idaho
sentence: The discoverers, anthropology professor Loren Davis and his colleagues, pointed out that they have similarities with the tools and artifacts discovered in Japan 16,000 to 13,000 years ago.

name: idaho
sentence: The discovery also showed that the first people might not have come to North America by land, as has already been said.

name: idaho
sentence: On the contrary, they probably crossed the water along a Pacific coastal road.

name: idaho
sentence: An early presence of French Canadian trappers is visible in the names and toponyms: Nose Percé, Coeur d'Alène, Boisé, Payette, some pre-existing expeditions of Lewis and Clark and Astorian who themselves included a large number of French and Métis guides recruited for their familiarity with the field.

name: idaho
sentence: The Idaho, part of Oregon, was claimed by the United States and Britain until the United States acquired an undisputed jurisdiction in 1846.

name: idaho
sentence: From 1843 to 1849, the Idaho was currently under the de facto jurisdiction of the Provisional Government of Oregon.

name: idaho
sentence: When Oregon became a state, what is now Idaho was in what remained of the original Oregon territory not part of the new state, and designated as Washington territory.

name: idaho
sentence: Between that date and the creation of the Idaho Territory on March 4, 1863, at Lewiston, parts of the present state were included in the territories of Oregon, Washington and Dakota.

name: idaho
sentence: The new territory included today's Idaho, Montana, and most of Wyoming.

name: idaho
sentence: The Lewis and Clark expedition crossed the Idaho in 1805 on the Pacific Road and in 1806 on the return, largely following the two directions of the Clearwater River.

name: idaho
sentence: The first non-Aboriginal settlement was Kullyspell House, established on the shore of Pend Oreille Lake for the fur trade in 1809 by David Thompson of the North West Company.

name: idaho
sentence: In 1812 Donald Mackenzie, then working for the Pacific Fur Company, established a post on the lower Clearwater River near Lewiston today.

name: idaho
sentence: This position, called "MacKenzie's Post" or "Clearwater", operated until the Pacific Fur Company was acquired by the North West Company in 1813, after which it was abandoned.

name: idaho
sentence: The first attempts by organized communities within the present borders of Idaho were launched in 1860.

name: idaho
sentence: The first community incorporated as a permanent and important corporation was Lewiston in 1861.

name: idaho
sentence: After a few tribulations as a territory, including the chaotic transfer from the territorial capital of Lewiston to Boise, the abandonment of the right to vote of the Mormonist polygamists supported by the Supreme Court of the United States in 1877, and a federal attempt to divide the territory between the territory of Washington which obtained state status in 1889, a year before Idaho, and the state of Nevada which had been a state since 1864, Idaho obtained state status in 1890.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho was one of the hardest hit by Pacific Northwest States during the Great Depression.

name: idaho
sentence: Prices fell for Idaho's main crops: in 1932, a bushel of potatoes earned only ten cents compared to $1.51 in 1919, while Idaho's farmers saw their annual income fall from $686 in 1929 to $250 in 1932.

name: idaho
sentence: In recent years, Idaho has expanded its business base as a state of tourism and agriculture to include the science and technology industries.

name: idaho
sentence: Science and technology have become the largest economic centre in the state (over 25 per cent of total government revenues) and are more important than agriculture, forestry and mining combined.

name: idaho
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that the population of Idaho was 1,787,065 on July 1, 2018, an increase of 14% since 2010.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho had an estimated population of 1,754,208 in 2018, an increase of 37,265 over the previous year and an increase of 186,626, or 11.91%, since 2010.

name: idaho
sentence: This includes a natural increase since the last census of 58,884 (111,131 births minus 52,247 deaths) and an increase due to the net migration of 75,795 people to the state.

name: idaho
sentence: There are a large number of English and German Americans in Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: Immigration from outside the United States resulted in a net increase of 14,522 people, and internal migration resulted in a net increase of 61,273 people.

name: idaho
sentence: Idaho is the tenth fastest growing state after the District of Columbia (+16.74%), Utah (+14.37%), Texas (+14.14%), Florida (+13.29%), Colorado (+13.25%), North Dakota (+13.01 %), Nevada (+12.36%), Arizona (+12.20%) and Washington.

name: idaho
sentence: From 2017 to 2018, the Idaho is the second fastest, surpassed only by Nevada.

name: idaho
sentence: Nampa, approximately 30 km west of downtown Boise, became the second largest city in the state in the late 1990s, passing through Pocatello and Idaho Falls.

name: idaho
sentence: The population of Nampa was less than 29,000 in 1990 and increased to over 81,000 in 2010.

name: idaho
sentence: Located between Nampa and Boise, Meridian also experienced strong growth, from less than 10,000 inhabitants in 1990 to more than 75,000 in 2010 and is now the third largest city in Idaho.

name: idaho
sentence: Growth of 5% or more was also observed during the same period for Caldwell, Coeur d'Alene, Post Falls and Twin Falls.

sentence: Illinois's gross national product in dollars was estimated at US$909 billion in 2019.

sentence: The government's per capita gross domestic product in 2019 was estimated at approximately $72,000.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's minimum wage will increase to $15 per hour by 2025, making it one of the highest in the nation.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's main agricultural products are maize, soybeans, pigs, cattle, dairy products and wheat.

name: illinois
sentence: In most years, Illinois is the first or second state for the highest soybean production, with a harvest of 427.7 million bushels (11.64 million tonnes) in 2008, following Iowa production of 444.82 million bushels (12.11 million tonnes).

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranks second in US corn production with more than 1.5 billion bushels produced annually.

name: illinois
sentence: With a production capacity of 1.5 billion gallons per year, Illinois is a leading producer of ethanol, ranking third in the United States in 2011.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a leader in food production and meat processing.

name: illinois
sentence: Although Chicago may no longer be "Hog Butcher for the World", the Chicago region remains a global centre for food manufacturing and meat processing, with many factories, processing houses and distribution facilities concentrated in the former Union Stock Yards region.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also produces wine, and the state is home to two U.S. wineries.

name: illinois
sentence: Peaches and apples are grown in the Meeting of the Great Rivers Scenic Byway area.

name: illinois
sentence: The German agricultural immigrants who settled in Illinois in the middle and end of the 19th century were partly responsible for the profusion of fruit orchards in this area of Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's universities are actively studying alternative agricultural products as alternative crops.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is one of the leading manufacturers in the country, with an annual value-added of more than $107 billion in 2006.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2011, Illinois was ranked fourth in the country's most productive manufacturing states, behind California, Texas and Ohio.

name: illinois
sentence: About three-quarters of the state's manufacturers are located in the Northeastern Opportunity Return area, with 38% of the approximately 18,900 Illinois manufacturing plants located in Cook County.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2006, Illinois's major value-added manufacturing industries were chemical manufacturing ($18.3 billion), machine manufacturing ($13.4 billion), food manufacturing ($12.9 billion), manufactured metal products ($11.5 billion), transportation equipment ($7.4 billion), plastics and rubber products ($7.0 billion), and computer and electronic products ($6.1 billion).

name: illinois
sentence: By the early 2000s, Illinois's economy had become dependent on high value-added services, such as financial commerce, higher education, law, logistics and medicine.

name: illinois
sentence: In some cases, these services have been clustered around institutions that have listened to Illinois's past economies.

name: illinois
sentence: For example, the Chicago Mercantile Exchange, a trading stock for global derivatives, had begun its life as an agricultural futures market.

name: illinois
sentence: Other important non-manufacturing industries are publishing, tourism, and energy production and distribution.

sentence: Venture capital investors funded a total of approximately $62 billion in the U.S. economy in 2016.

name: illinois
sentence: Similarly, in fiscal year 2016, the federal government spent $461 billion on contracts in the U.S. Of this amount, Illinois-based companies received approximately $8.7 billion.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a net importer of energy fuels, despite high coal resources and minor oil production.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois exports electricity, ranked fifth in terms of electricity generation and seventh in terms of electricity consumption.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois coal industry originated in the mid-19th century, when entrepreneurs like Jacob Loose discovered coal in places like Sangamon County.

name: illinois
sentence: Jacob Bunn contributed to the development of Illinois's coal industry and was the founder and owner of the Illinois Western Coal & Mining Company.

name: illinois
sentence: Approximately 68% of Illinois has coal strata of the Pennsylvania geological period.

name: illinois
sentence: According to the State of Illinois Geological Survey, 211 billion tons of bituminous coal are under the surface, having a total heating value greater than the estimated oil deposits on the Arabian Peninsula.

name: illinois
sentence: However, this coal has a high sulphur content, which causes acid rain unless special equipment is used to reduce sulphur dioxide emissions.

name: illinois
sentence: Many Illinois power plants are not equipped to burn coal with high sulphur content.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1999, Illinois produced 40.4 million tonnes of coal, but only 17 million tonnes (42%) of coal were consumed in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: The majority of the coal produced in Illinois is exported to other states and countries.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2008, Illinois exported three million tons of coal and is expected to export nine million tons of coal in 2011, with increasing energy demand in countries such as China, India and other Asian and European countries.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2010, Illinois was ranked third in the coal reserves recoverable for mine production in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: Most of the coal produced in Illinois is exported to other states, while most of the coal burned for electricity in Illinois (21 million tonnes in 1998) is mined in Wyoming's Powder River Basin.

sentence: Mattoon has recently been selected as a site for the Department of Energy's FutureGen project, a 275-megawatt zero-emission experimental coal-burning power plant funded by the DOE.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is one of the major oil refineries in the U.S. Midwest, with a combined crude oil distillation capacity of nearly 900,000 barrels per day (140,000 m3/d).

name: illinois
sentence: However, Illinois has very limited crude oil reserves that account for less than 1% of the total U.S. reserves.

name: illinois
sentence: Residential heating is 81% natural gas, compared with less than 1% heating oil.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranks 14th in state oil production, with a daily production of about 28,000 barrels (4,500 m3) in 2005.

name: illinois
sentence: Nuclear energy probably started in Illinois with the Chicago Pile-1, the first self-sufficient artificial reaction of the nuclear chain in the world's first nuclear reactor, built on the University of Chicago campus.

name: illinois
sentence: There are six nuclear power plants in operation in Illinois: Braidwood, Byron, Clinton, Dresden, LaSalle and Quad Cities.

name: illinois
sentence: With the exception of the one-unit Clinton plant, each of these facilities has two reactors.

name: illinois
sentence: Three reactors have been permanently closed and are in various stages of decommissioning: Dresden-1 and Zion-1 and 2.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranked first in the country in 2010 in terms of nuclear capacity and nuclear production.

name: illinois
sentence: The production of its nuclear power plants accounted for 12 per cent of the country's total.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2007, 48% of Illinois's electricity was produced by nuclear power.

name: illinois
sentence: Operation Morris is the only highly radioactive waste storage facility in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is increasingly interested in the use of wind power for electricity generation.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2009, most of Illinois was considered "marginal or equitable" for wind power production by the U.S. Department of Energy, and some western sections were considered "good" and parts of the south were considered "poor".

name: illinois
sentence: These ratings apply to wind turbines at a hub height of 50 metres (160 feet); the more recent wind turbines are larger, allowing them to reach stronger winds farther from the ground.

name: illinois
sentence: As a result, other areas of Illinois have become potential wind farm sites.

name: illinois
sentence: In September 2009, Illinois had 1116.06 MW of installed wind power and an additional 741.9 MW were under construction.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois ranked ninth in the United States in installed wind capacity and sixteenth in potential capacity.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's large wind farms include Twin Groves, Rail Splitter, EcoGrove and Mendota Hills.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2007, wind energy accounted for only 1.7% of Illinois's energy production, and it was estimated that wind energy could provide between 5% and 10% of the government's energy needs.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition, the Illinois General Assembly mandated in 2007 that by 2025, 25% of the electricity generated in Illinois would come from renewable resources.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is the second largest producer of corn in the United States, and Illinois corn is used to produce 40% of ethanol consumed in the United States.

sentence: The tax is collected by the Illinois Ministry of Revenue.

sentence: State income tax is calculated by multiplying the net income by a flat rate.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1990, the rate was set at 3 per cent, but in 2010, the General Assembly voted for a temporary increase in the rate to 5 per cent; the new rate came into effect on 1 January 2011; the personal income rate partially collapsed on 1 January 2015 to 3.75%, while corporate income tax fell to 5.25 per cent.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois did not adopt a budget from 2015 to 2017, after the 736-day budget impasse, a budget was adopted in Illinois after legislators overturned Governor Bruce Rauner's veto, raising the personal income rate to 4.95% and the corporate rate to 7%.

sentence: There are two rates for the government's sales tax: 6.25% for general goods and 1% for eligible food, drugs and medical devices.

name: illinois
sentence: Property taxes in Illinois are only imposed on real property.

name: illinois
sentence: On May 1, 2019, the Illinois Senator voted in favour of a constitutional amendment that would have been struck by the wording of the Illinois Constitution requiring a fixed tax on state income, in a 73–44 vote.

sentence: Had it been approved, the amendment would have allowed the state legislator to impose a progressive income tax based on annual income.

name: illinois
sentence: The Governor, J.B. Pritzker, approved the bill on May 27, 2019.

sentence: It was planned for a general election in 2020 and required the approval of 60 per cent of voters to effectively amend the state constitution.

sentence: The amendment was not approved by Illinoisers, with 55.1% of electors voting "no" at the time of approval and 44.9% voting "yes".

sentence: Oval race tracks at Chicagoland Speedway in Joliet, Chicago Motor Speedway in Cicero and Gateway International Raceway in Madison, near St. Louis, hosted NASCAR, CART and IRL races, while the Sports Car Club of America, among other national and regional road racing clubs, visited the Autobahn Country Club in Joliet, the Blackhawk Farms Raceway in Beloit South and the former Meadowdale International Raceway in Carpentersville.

sentence: Illinois has several golf courses, such as Olympia Fields, Medinah, Midlothian, Cog Hill and Conway Farms, which often hosted the BMW, Western Open and Women's Western Open Championships.
