name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's system of state parks began in 1908 with what is now Fort Massac State Park, becoming the first park in a system comprising more than 60 parks and roughly the same number of recreational and wildlife areas.

name: illinois
sentence: Areas protected by the National Parks Service include the Illinois and Michigan Canal National Heritage Corridor near Lockport, the Lewis and Clark National Historic Trail, Lincoln Home National Historic Site in Springfield, the Mormon Pioneer National Historic Trail, the Tears National Historic Trail, the American Discovery Trail, and the Pullman National Monument.

name: illinois
sentence: The federal government also manages the Shawnee National Forest and the Midewin Tallgrass National Prairies.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois government, under the Illinois Constitution, has three branches of government: executive, legislative, and judicial.

name: illinois
sentence: The executive branch is divided into several state-wide elected offices, with the governor as head of the executive branch.

name: illinois
sentence: The legislative functions are assigned to the Illinois General Assembly.

name: illinois
sentence: The judiciary consists of the Supreme Court and the lower courts.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois General Assembly is the state's legislative assembly, consisting of 118 members of the Illinois House of Representatives and 59 members of the Illinois Senator.

name: illinois
sentence: The members of the General Assembly are elected at the beginning of each year equally.

name: illinois
sentence: The Compiled Statutes of Illinois (ILCS) are consolidated articles of a general and permanent nature.

name: illinois
sentence: The executive branch is composed of six elected members and their bureaux, as well as many other departments.

name: illinois
sentence: The six elected members are Governor, Lieutenant Governor, Attorney General, Secretary of State, Controller and Treasurer.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois government has many departments, agencies, boards and commissions, but the so-called code departments provide most government services.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's judiciary is Illinois's unified judicial system.

name: illinois
sentence: It is composed of the Supreme Court, the Court of Appeal and circuit courts.

name: illinois
sentence: The Supreme Court oversees the administration of the justice system.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's administrative divisions are counties, townships, police stations, cities, towns, villages and special purpose districts.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois base subdivision is the 102 counties.

name: illinois
sentence: Eighty-five of the 102 counties are in turn divided into cantons and precincts.

name: illinois
sentence: Municipal administrations are cities, villages and incorporated cities.

name: illinois
sentence: Some communities have a membership rule, which allows them to govern themselves to some extent.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois is a democratic stronghold.

name: illinois
sentence: Historically, Illinois was a political swing state whose quasi-parity existed between the Republican Party and the Democratic Party.

name: illinois
sentence: However, in recent elections, the Democratic Party gained ground, and Illinois became a strong "blue" state in presidential campaigns.

name: illinois
sentence: The vote in Chicago and most of Cook's counties has long been highly democratic.

name: illinois
sentence: However, "collar counties" (the suburbs surrounding Cook County, Illinois) of Chicago may be considered moderate electoral districts.

name: illinois
sentence: College cities such as Carbondale, Champaign, and Normal also meagre Democratic.

name: illinois
sentence: Republicans continue to rule in rural areas in northern and central Illinois, as well as in southern Illinois, outside eastern St. Louis.

name: illinois
sentence: From 1920 to 1972, Illinois was led by the winner of each of the 14 presidential elections.

name: illinois
sentence: In fact, the state has long been regarded as a national viewpoint, supporting the winner in every election of the 20th century, with the exception of 1916 and 1976.

name: illinois
sentence: On the other hand, Illinois moved more towards the Democratic Party and voted for its presidential candidates in the last six elections; in 2000, George W. Bush became the first Republican to win the presidency without wearing either Illinois or Vermont.

name: illinois
sentence: A local politician and a Chicago resident Barack Obama easily won the state's 21 electoral votes in 2008, with 61.9% of the votes.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2010, outgoing governor Pat Quinn was re-elected with 47% of the vote, while Republican Mark Kirk was elected to the Senate with 48% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2012, President Obama easily carried Illinois again, with 58% to the Republican candidate Mitt Romney 41%.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2014, Republican Bruce Rauner beat Governor Quinn from 50% to 46% to become Illinois's first Republican governor in 12 years after being sworn in on January 12, 2015, while Democratic Senator Dick Durbin was re-elected with 53% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2016, Hillary Clinton won Illinois with 55 per cent of the vote, and Tammy Duckworth beat incumbent Mark Kirk 54 per cent to 40 per cent.

name: illinois
sentence: George W. Bush and Donald Trump are the only Republican candidates to win without wearing Illinois or Vermont.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2018, Democratic JB Pritzker defeated incumbent Bruce Rauner for the post of Governor with 54% of the vote.

name: illinois
sentence: State politics has been infamous for cases of highly visible corruption, as well as for cross-formers, such as governors Adlai Stevenson and James R. Thompson.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2006, former Governor George Ryan was convicted of racketeering and corruption, resulting in a six-and-a-half-year prison sentence.

name: illinois
sentence: In 2008, Governor Rod Blagojevich received a criminal complaint of corruption, following allegations that he had conspired to sell the seat of Senator left by President Barack Obama to the highest bidder.

name: illinois
sentence: Subsequently, on 7 December 2011, Rod Blagojevich was sentenced to 14 years in prison on these counts, as well as to perjury while testifying during the case, i.e. 18 convictions.

name: illinois
sentence: Blagojevich was indicted and sentenced by the Legislative Assembly, which removed him from office.

name: illinois
sentence: At the end of the 20th century, MP Dan Rostenkowski was imprisoned for mail fraud; former governor and federal judge Otto Kerner, Jr. was imprisoned for corruption; Secretary of State Paul Powell was investigated and found to have gained great wealth through bribes; and the State Auditor of Public Accounts (Controller) Orville Hodge was imprisoned for embezzlement.

name: illinois
sentence: In 1912 William Lorimer, the boss of the Chicago GOP, was expelled from the US Senator for corruption and in 1921 Governor Len Small was found for swindling the state of a million dollars.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois showed a strong presence in the presidential elections.

name: illinois
sentence: Three presidents claimed Illinois as a political base when they introduced themselves to the presidency: Abraham Lincoln, Ulysses S. Grant and more recently Barack Obama.

name: illinois
sentence: Lincoln was born in Kentucky, but he moved to Illinois at the age of 21.

name: illinois
sentence: He was a member of the General Assembly and represented the 7th District of Congress in the United States House of Representatives before his election to the presidency in 1860.

name: illinois
sentence: Ulysse S. Grant was born in Ohio and had a military career that prevented him from settling, but on the eve of the civil war and as the Middle Ages approached, he moved to Illinois and thus used the state as his home and political base to run for office.

name: illinois
sentence: Barack Obama was born in Hawaii and made Illinois his home after graduating from law school and then represented Illinois in the U.S. Senate.

name: illinois
sentence: He then became President in 2008, as a candidate for his Illinois base.

name: illinois
sentence: Ronald Reagan was born in Illinois, in the city of Tampico, grew up in Dixon, Illinois, and studied at Eureka College outside Peoria.

name: illinois
sentence: Reagan later moved to California during his young adulthood.

name: illinois
sentence: He then became an actor, then governor of California before being elected president.

name: illinois
sentence: Hillary Clinton was born and raised in the suburbs of Chicago and became the first woman to represent a major political party in the general election of the U.S. presidency.

name: illinois
sentence: Clinton ran away from a platform based in New York State.

name: illinois
sentence: Nine African-Americans have been members of the United States Senate.

name: illinois
sentence: Three of them represented Illinois, more than one state: Carol Moseley-Braun, Barack Obama and Roland Burris, who was appointed to replace Obama after his election to the presidency.

name: illinois
sentence: Moseley-Braun was the first African American woman to become American.

name: illinois
sentence: I'm a senator.

name: illinois
sentence: Three Illinois families played a particularly important role in the Democratic Party, winning at both the state and national levels.

name: illinois
sentence: The Stevenson family, first rooted in central Illinois and later based in the Chicago metropolitan area, provided four generations of Illinois public servants.

name: illinois
sentence: The base of the Daley family was in Chicago.

name: illinois
sentence: The Pritzker family is based in Chicago and has played an important role in both the private and public sectors.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois State Education Council (ISBE) is autonomous from the Governor and the legislature of the state and administers public education in the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Local municipalities and their respective school districts run individual public schools, but the ISBE checks the performance of public schools with the Illinois School Report Card.

name: illinois
sentence: ISBE also makes recommendations to state leaders on education expenditure and policies.

name: illinois
sentence: Education is compulsory for 7-17-year-olds in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Schools are generally, but not exclusively, divided into three levels of primary and secondary education: primary, secondary or secondary school, and secondary school.

name: illinois
sentence: The structure of the district territories is often complex.

name: illinois
sentence: Many parts of the State are in fact located in two school districts, one for secondary schools and the other for primary and secondary schools.

name: illinois
sentence: And these districts don't necessarily share borders.

name: illinois
sentence: A given secondary school may have several elementary districts that feed on it, but some of these foster districts may themselves feed in several districts of secondary schools.

name: illinois
sentence: Using the criteria established by the Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Education, there are eleven "national universities" in the State.

name: illinois
sentence: The University of Chicago is consistently ranked as one of the top ten universities in the world on various independent academic rankings, and its Booth School of Business, as well as the Kellogg School of Management in Northwestern, are consistently ranked among the top five higher business schools in the country and top ten in the world.

name: illinois
sentence: The University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign is often ranked among the best engineering schools in the world and in the United States.

name: illinois
sentence: As of August 19, 2010, six of them were at the "first level" of the nation's top 500 national universities, according to the rankings of the US News & World Report: the University of Chicago, the University of Northwestern, the University of Illinois at Urbana–Champaign, the University of Loyola Chicago, the Illinois Institute of Technology, the University of DePaul, the University of Illinois at Chicago, the University of Illinois, the University of South Illinois Carbondale and the University of Northern Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also has over twenty other four-year accredited universities, both public and private, and dozens of small liberal arts colleges across the state.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition, Illinois supports 49 public community colleges in Illinois's community college system.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois schools are funded primarily by property tax, based on the assessment of land value by the state, rather than by direct contributions from the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Tracy Steffes described Illinois's public education as historically "inequitable", a system where one of the "richest states" is "the brightest in its support for education."There have been several attempts to reform school funding in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: The most notable attempt took place in 1973 with the adoption of the Illinois Resource Equalizer Formula, a measure by which it was hoped that funding could be collected and distributed more equitably to schools in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: However, opposition from the well-off Illinois communities who opposed the obligation to pay for the less well-off school districts (including many Black-majority communities, produced by redline, white flight and other "soft" segregation methods) led to the abolition of formulae in the late 1980s.

name: illinois
sentence: Due to its central location and proximity to the Rust Belt and Grain Belt, Illinois is a national hub for air, motor, rail and road traffic.

name: illinois
sentence: From 1962 to 1998, the O'Hare International Airport in Chicago (ORD) was the busiest airport in the world.

name: illinois
sentence: While it was surpassed by Hartsfield of Atlanta in 1998 (as Chicago divides its air traffic between O'Hare and Midway airports, while Atlanta uses only one airport), with 59.3 million national passengers per year, as well as 11.4 million international passengers in 2008, O'Hare remains one of the two or three most frequented airports in the world, and in a few years still ranks first in total flights.

name: illinois
sentence: This is a major hub for United Airlines and American Airlines, and a major airport expansion project is currently underway.

name: illinois
sentence: The Midway Airport (MDW), which had been the busiest airport in the world at some point until it was supplanted by O'Hare as the busiest airport in 1962, is now the secondary airport in the Chicago metropolitan area and still ranks as one of the busiest airports in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: Midway is an important centre for Southwest Airlines and serves many other carriers.

name: illinois
sentence: Midway served 17.3 million national and international passengers in 2008.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has an extensive rail passenger and freight transportation network.

name: illinois
sentence: Chicago is a national Amtrak centre and passengers in the state are served by Amtrak's Illinois Service, with Chicago at Carbondale Illini and Saluki, Chicago at Quincy Carl Sandburg and Illinois Zephyr, and Chicago at St. Louis Lincoln Service.

name: illinois
sentence: There is currently work on Chicago–St.

name: illinois
sentence: Louis Line to increase the maximum speed to 110 mph (180 km/h), which would reduce travel time by one and a half hours.

name: illinois
sentence: Nearly all North American railways meet in Chicago, making it the largest and most active railway centre in the country.

name: illinois
sentence: A large suburban train is supplied in the city itself and in some immediate suburbs by the "L" system of the Chicago Transit Authority.

name: illinois
sentence: One of the largest suburban rail networks in the United States, operated by Metra, uses existing rail lines to provide direct access for hundreds of suburbs to the city and beyond.

name: illinois
sentence: In addition to the state rail lines, Mississippi and Illinois provide important transportation routes for the state's agricultural interests.

name: illinois
sentence: Lake Michigan gives Illinois access to the Atlantic Ocean through the St. Lawrence Seaway.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois's interstate highways are all segments of the interstate highway network that are owned and maintained by the state.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois has the distinction of having the most primary (double-digit) interstates pass through it among the 50 states with 13.

name: illinois
sentence: Illinois also ranks third among the fifty states with the most interstate mileage coming after California and Texas, which are much larger states in the region.

name: illinois
sentence: The major interstate highways across the state include Interstate 24 (I-24), I-39, I-41, I-55, I-57, I-64, I-70, I-72, I-74, I-80, I-88, I-90 and I-94.

name: illinois
sentence: The Illinois Transportation Department (IDOT) is responsible for the maintenance of the USHighways in Illinois.

name: illinois
sentence: The system in Illinois consists of 21 primary highways.

name: illinois
sentence: Among the U.S. highways that cross the state are the United States 6, the United States 12, the United States 14, the United States 20, the United States 24, the United States 30, the United States 34, the United States 36, the United States 40, the United States 41, the United States 45, the United States 50, the United States 51, the United States 52, the United States 54, the United States 60, the United States 62 and the United States 67.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana () is an American state located in the Midwestern and Great Lakes regions of North America.

name: indiana
sentence: It is the 38th largest by region and the 17th most populated of the 50 United States.

name: indiana
sentence: Its capital and its largest city is Indianapolis.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana was admitted to the United States as the 19th state on December 11, 1816.

name: indiana
sentence: It borders Lake Michigan to the northwest, Michigan to the north, Ohio to the east, Ohio River and Kentucky to the south and southeast, and Wabash River and Illinois to the west.

name: indiana
sentence: Before becoming a territory, various Aboriginal peoples have lived in Indiana for thousands of years.

name: indiana
sentence: Since its creation as a territory, settlement models in Indiana have reflected regional cultural segmentation in the eastern United States; the northernmost level of the state has been established primarily by residents of New England and New York, Central Indiana by migrants from the states of Mid-Atlantic and adjacent Ohio, and Southern Indiana by settlers from southern states, particularly Kentucky and Tennessee.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has a diversified economy with gross revenue of $359.12 billion in 2017.

name: indiana
sentence: It has several metropolitan areas with more than 100,000 inhabitants and a number of small industrial cities.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is home to professional sports teams, including the NFL Indianapolis Colts and the NBA Indiana Pacers, and hosts several important competitions, including the Indianapolis 500.

name: indiana
sentence: The name Indiana means "Indian land," or simply "Indian land."

name: indiana
sentence: It also originates from Indiana's territorial history.

name: indiana
sentence: On May 7, 1800, the United States Congress passed a law to divide the Northwest Territory into two regions and named the western portion of the Indiana Territory.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1816, when Congress passed enabling legislation to begin the process of establishing the state for Indiana, part of that land became the geographic area for the new state.

name: indiana
sentence: An Indiana resident is officially known as a Hoosier.

name: indiana
sentence: The etymology of this word is contested, but the main theory, put forward by the Indiana Historical Bureau and the Indiana Historical Society, has its origin in Virginia, the Carolinas, and Tennessee (the South of Upland) as a term for a backwoodsman, a rough peasant, or a scapegoat of country.

name: indiana
sentence: The first inhabitants of what is now Indiana were the Paleo-Indians, who arrived about 8,000 B.C. after melting glaciers at the end of the ice age.

name: indiana
sentence: Divided into small groups, the Paleo-Indians are nomads who hunt large game like mastodons.

name: indiana
sentence: They have created stone tools made of chert in chips, chips and flakes.

name: indiana
sentence: The archaic period, which began between 5000 and 4000 B.C., covered the next phase of Aboriginal culture.

name: indiana
sentence: People have developed new tools and techniques to cook food, an important step in civilization.

name: indiana
sentence: These new tools included different types of spear tips and knives, with different types of notches.

name: indiana
sentence: They have made ground stone tools such as stone axes, woodworking tools and grinding stones.

name: indiana
sentence: During the latter part of the period, they built mounds of land and middens, indicating that settlements became more permanent.

name: indiana
sentence: The archaic period ended around 1500 BC, although some archaic people lived up to 700 BC.

name: indiana
sentence: The Woodland period began around 1500 B.C., when new cultural attributes appeared.

name: indiana
sentence: The people created ceramics and pottery, and spread their plant culture.

name: indiana
sentence: An early Woodland group named the Adena people had elegant burial rituals, with log tombs beneath the mounds of the earth.

name: indiana
sentence: In the middle of the Woodland period, the Hopewell people began to develop long-distance merchandise trade.

name: indiana
sentence: Towards the end of the stage, people developed a very productive crop and agricultural adaptation, cultivating crops such as corn and squash.

name: indiana
sentence: The wood period ended around 1000 after JC.

name: indiana
sentence: The Mississippi culture appeared from 1000 AD until the 15th century, shortly before the arrival of Europeans.

name: indiana
sentence: During this stage, people created large urban settlements designed according to their cosmology, with large mounds and places defining ceremonial and public spaces.

name: indiana
sentence: The concentrated colonies were dependent on agricultural surpluses.

name: indiana
sentence: One of those complexes was the Angel Mounds.

name: indiana
sentence: They had vast public spaces such as squares and platform mounds, where leaders lived or conducted rituals.

name: indiana
sentence: The Mississippi civilization collapsed in Indiana in the middle of the 15th century for reasons that remain uncertain.

name: indiana
sentence: The historical Amerindian tribes of the region at the time of the European meeting spoke different languages of the Algonquian family.

name: indiana
sentence: They included Shawnee, Miami and Illini.

name: indiana
sentence: The refugee tribes of the eastern regions, including the Delaware who settled in the White and Whitewater River valleys, joined them later.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1679, the French explorer René-Robert Cavelier, Sieur de La Salle, was the first European to cross Indiana after reaching the current Bend Sud at the Saint Joseph River.

name: indiana
sentence: He came back the following year to learn more about the region.

name: indiana
sentence: The French-Canadian fur traders arrived soon, bringing blankets, jewellery, tools, whisky and weapons to trade hides with the Amerindians.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1702, Sieur Juchereau established the first trading post near Vincennes.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1715, Sieur de Vincennes built Fort Miami at Kekionga, now Fort Wayne.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1717, another Canadian, Picote de Beletre, built Fort Ouiatinon on the Wabash River, attempting to control the Amerindian trade routes from Lake Erie to the Mississippi River.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1732 Sieur de Vincennes built a second fur trade post in Vincennes.

name: indiana
sentence: The French-Canadian settlers, who had left the previous post as a result of the hostilities, returned in more numbers.

name: indiana
sentence: In a few years, British settlers arrived from the east and fought against Canadians for control of the lucrative fur trade.

name: indiana
sentence: The fighting between French and British settlers took place throughout the 1750s.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's Amerindian tribes partnered with French Canadians during the French and Indian War (also known as the Seven Years' War).

name: indiana
sentence: With the British victory in 1763, the French were forced to yield to the British crown all their lands in North America east of the Mississippi River and north and west of the colonies.

name: indiana
sentence: The tribes of Indiana did not give up: they seized Fort Ouiatinon and Fort Miami during the Pontiac rebellion.

name: indiana
sentence: The British Royal Proclamation of 1763 designated the land west of the Appalachians for Amerindian purposes and excluded British settlers from the area known by the Crown as the "Indian Territory."

name: indiana
sentence: In 1775, the American Revolutionary War began as the settlers sought British autonomy and independence.

name: indiana
sentence: The majority of the fighting took place near the east coast, but Patriotic military officer George Rogers Clark called for an army to help fight the British in the west.

name: indiana
sentence: Clark's army won important battles and took over Vincennes and Fort Sackville on 25 Feb. 1779.

name: indiana
sentence: During the war Clark succeeded in cutting off British troops, who attacked the settlers in the east of the west.

name: indiana
sentence: His success is often credited for changing the course of the American revolutionary war.

name: indiana
sentence: At the end of the war, through the Treaty of Paris, the British Crown transferred its rights to land south of the Great Lakes to the new United States, including Native American lands.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1787, the United States defined the Northwest Territory, which included the present Indiana region.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1800 Congress separated Ohio from the Northwest Territory, designating the rest of the land as Indiana Territory.

name: indiana
sentence: President Thomas Jefferson chose William Henry Harrison as Governor of the Territory, and Vincennes became the capital.

name: indiana
sentence: After the separation of Michigan Territory and the formation of Illinois Territory, Indiana was reduced to its present size and geography.

name: indiana
sentence: Beginning with the battle of the woods fallen in 1794 and the Treaty of Greenville in 1795, Native American titles on Indiana lands were extinguished by usurpation, purchase or war and treated.

name: indiana
sentence: About half the state was acquired in the Treaty of St. Mary's of Miami in 1818.

name: indiana
sentence: Purchases were only completed when the Treaty of Mississinewas in 1826 acquired the last of the American Aboriginal lands reserved in the northeast.

name: indiana
sentence: Portrait of the Indiana Border Around 1810: The boundary was defined by the Treaty of Fort Wayne in 1809, adding much of the southwest lands around Vincennes and the southeast lands adjacent to Cincinnati, to areas along the Ohio River as part of American territory.

name: indiana
sentence: The colonies were military outposts such as Fort Ouiatinon in the northwest and Fort Miami (later Fort Wayne) in the northeast, Fort Knox, and the Vincennes settlement in the lower Wabash.

name: indiana
sentence: Other facilities include Clarksville (passing through Louisville), Vevay and Corydon along the Ohio River, Quaker Colony in Richmond on the east border, and Conner's Post (later Connersville) on the east central border.

name: indiana
sentence: Indianapolis would not be populated for another 15 years, and the territory of Central and Northern Indiana remained a wilderness inhabited mainly by Aboriginal communities.

name: indiana
sentence: Only two counties in the far southeast, Clark and Dearborn, had been organized by European settlers.

name: indiana
sentence: There were few titles issued by Cincinnati.

name: indiana
sentence: Settler migration takes place mainly by flat boat on the Ohio River to the west, and by wagon paths to the Wabash/White River valleys (west) and Whitewater River (east).

name: indiana
sentence: In 1810, tribal leader Shawnee Tecumseh and his brother Tenskwatawa encouraged other native tribes in the Territory to resist European colonization.

name: indiana
sentence: Tensions rose and the United States allowed Harrison to launch a preventive expedition against the Tecumseh Confederation; the United States won the Battle of Tippecanoe on November 7, 1811.

name: indiana
sentence: Tecumseh was killed in 1813 during the battle of Thames.

name: indiana
sentence: After his death, armed resistance to the control of the United States ended in the region.

name: indiana
sentence: Most of the Amerindian tribes of the state were then abducted west of Mississippi in the 1820s and 1830s after the American negotiations and the purchase of their land.

name: indiana
sentence: Corydon, a town in the extreme south of Indiana, was named the second capital of Indiana territory in May 1813 to reduce the threat of Indian raids following the Battle of Tippecanoe.

name: indiana
sentence: Two years later, a petition for state status was approved by the Territory's general assembly and sent to Congress.

name: indiana
sentence: Enabling legislation has been passed to allow delegates to draft a constitution for Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: On June 10, 1816, delegates met in Corydon to draft the constitution, which was completed in 19 days.

name: indiana
sentence: Jonathan Jennings was elected the first governor of the state in August 1816.

name: indiana
sentence: On December 11, 1816, President James Madison approved Indiana's admission to the union as the nineteenth state.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1825 the state capital was moved from Corydon to Indianapolis.

name: indiana
sentence: Many European immigrants went west to settle in Indiana at the beginning of the 19th century.

name: indiana
sentence: The largest group of immigrants to settle in Indiana were Germans, as well as many immigrants from Ireland and England.

name: indiana
sentence: Americans who were predominantly English-born migrated from northern New York and New England, as well as from the mid-Atlantic state of Pennsylvania.

name: indiana
sentence: The arrival of steamboats on the Ohio River in 1811 and the national highway at Richmond in 1829 greatly facilitated the colonization of northern and western Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: After statehood, the new government worked to transform Indiana from a border into a developed, well-populated and prosperous state, starting with significant demographic and economic changes.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1836, the founders of the state launched a program, the Indiana Mammouth Internal Improvement Act, which led to the construction of government-funded roads, canals, railways and public schools.

name: indiana
sentence: The plans have gone bankrupt in the state and have been a financial disaster, but have increased the land and produced more than four times the value.

name: indiana
sentence: In response to the crisis and to avoid another, a second constitution was adopted in 1851.

name: indiana
sentence: Its provisions included the prohibition of public debt, as well as the extension of the vote to Afro-Americans.

name: indiana
sentence: During the American civil war, Indiana had political influence and played an important role in the affairs of the nation.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana was the first Western state to mobilize for the United States in the war, and Indiana soldiers participated in all major war commitments.

name: indiana
sentence: The state provided 126 infantry regiments, 26 artillery batteries and 13 cavalry regiments to the Union.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1861, Indiana received a quota of 7,500 troops to join the Union Army.

name: indiana
sentence: So many volunteers in the first call that thousands had to be pushed back.

name: indiana
sentence: Before the war ended, Indiana had paid 208,367 men.

name: indiana
sentence: The victims were more than 35 per cent of those men: 24,416 lost their lives and more than 50,000 were injured.

name: indiana
sentence: The only civil war conflicts in Indiana were the Newburgh Raid, a bloodless capture of the city; and the Battle of Corydon, which took place during the Morgan Raid, leaving 15 dead, 40 wounded, and 355 captured.

name: indiana
sentence: After the war, Indiana remained a largely agricultural State.

name: indiana
sentence: Post-war industries included mining, including limestone mining, meat packaging, food processing, such as grain grinding, alcohol distillation, and the construction of cars, bugs, agricultural machinery and equipment.

name: indiana
sentence: However, the discovery of natural gas in the 1880s in northern Indiana led to an economic boom: the abundant and cheap fuel attracted heavy industry; the availability of jobs in turn attracted new settlers from other parts of the country as well as Europe.

name: indiana
sentence: This has led to the rapid expansion of cities such as South Bend, Gary, Indianapolis and Fort Wayne.

name: indiana
sentence: With the start of the industrial revolution, Indian industry began to grow at an accelerated pace in the northern part of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: With industrialization, workers have developed trade unions and suffrage movements in relation to women's advancement.

name: indiana
sentence: At the beginning of the 20th century, Indiana became a strong manufacturing state linked to the new automotive industry.

name: indiana
sentence: Haynes-Apperson, the country's first commercially successful automotive company, operates in Kokomo until 1925.

name: indiana
sentence: The construction of the Indianapolis highway and the start-up of auto-related industries were also linked to the automotive boom.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1930s Indiana, like the rest of the nation, was affected by the Great Depression.

name: indiana
sentence: The economic downturn has had a significant negative impact on Indiana, such as the decline in urbanization.

name: indiana
sentence: The Dust Bowl further west has led many migrants to flee to the more industrialized Midwest.

name: indiana
sentence: Governor Paul V. McNutt's administration has endeavoured to build a publicly funded social assistance system to help overcrowded private charities.

name: indiana
sentence: During its administration, spending and taxes were significantly reduced in response to the depression, and the state government was completely reorganized.

name: indiana
sentence: McNutt terminated the state ban and enacted the first state income tax.

name: indiana
sentence: On several occasions he declared martial law to put an end to labour strikes.

name: indiana
sentence: The Second World War helped revive the Indiana economy, as the war required steel, food and other goods that had been produced in the state.

name: indiana
sentence: About ten per cent of the population of Indiana joined the armed forces, while hundreds of industries won war production contracts and began to make war material.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana manufactured 4.5% of the total U.S. military weapons produced during the Second World War, ranking eighth among the 48 states.

name: indiana
sentence: The expansion of industry to meet the demands of war has helped to end the Great Depression.

name: indiana
sentence: With the end of World War II, Indiana rebounded to pre-depression production levels.

name: indiana
sentence: Industry became the main employer, a trend that continued in the 1960s.

name: indiana
sentence: Urbanization in the 1950s and 1960s led to strong growth in the cities of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: The automotive, steel and pharmaceutical industry dominated the major Indiana companies.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana population continued to grow after the war, exceeding five million at the 1970 census.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1960s, Matthew E. Welsh's administration passed its first two percent sales tax.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana schools were disintegrated in 1949.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1950, the Census Bureau reported that the Indian population was 95.5% white and 4.4% black.

name: indiana
sentence: The Welsh Governor also collaborated with the General Assembly on the adoption of the Indiana Civil Rights Bill, which provides equal protection to minorities seeking employment.

name: indiana
sentence: On December 8, 1964, a Convair B-58 carrying nuclear weapons slipped onto an ice track on the basis of the Bunker Hill Air Force in Bunker Hill, Indiana, and caught fire during a training exercise.

name: indiana
sentence: The five nuclear weapons on board were set on fire, including a thermonuclear weapon of 9 megatonnes, causing radioactive contamination of the crash area.

name: indiana
sentence: Beginning in 1970, a series of amendments to the constitution of the State were proposed.

name: indiana
sentence: With the adoption, the Indiana Court of Appeal was established and the procedure for appointing judges changed.

name: indiana
sentence: The 1973 oil crisis created a recession that hurt the automobile industry in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: Companies such as Delco Electronics and Delphi have started a long series of cuts that have contributed to high unemployment rates in manufacturing in Anderson, Muncie and Kokomo.

name: indiana
sentence: The trend towards restructuring and deindustrialisation continued until the 1980s, when the national and state economy began to diversify and recover.

name: indiana
sentence: With a total land and water area of 36,418 square miles (94,320 km2), Indiana ranks 38th among the largest states.

name: indiana
sentence: The State has a maximum north-south dimension of 400 km (400 km) and a maximum east-west dimension of 145 km (233 km).

name: indiana
sentence: The geographical centre of the state (39° 53.7'N, 86° 16.0W) is located in Marion County.

name: indiana
sentence: Located in the Midwest of the United States, Indiana is one of eight states that make up the Great Lakes region.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana is bordered to the north by Michigan, to the east by Ohio, and to the west by Illinois, partially separated by the Wabash River.

name: indiana
sentence: Lake Michigan borders Indiana in the northwest, and the Ohio River separates Indiana from Kentucky in the south.

name: indiana
sentence: The average altitude of Indiana is about 760 feet (230 m) above sea level.

name: indiana
sentence: The highest point in the state is Hoosier Hill in Wayne County, 1257 feet (383 m) above sea level.

name: indiana
sentence: The lowest point at 320 feet (98 m) above sea level is in Posey County where the Wabash River meets the Ohio River.

name: indiana
sentence: The resulting elevation range of 937 feet (286 m) is the narrowest of all non-coastal states in the United States.

name: indiana
sentence: Only 2,850 square miles (7,400 km2) are above 1000 feet (300 m) and this area is closed in 14 counties.

name: indiana
sentence: Approximately 4,700 square miles (12,000 km2) have an altitude of less than 500 feet (150 m), mainly concentrated along Ohio and the lower Wabash, Tell City and Terre Haute valleys at Evansville and Mount Vernon.

name: indiana
sentence: The state consists of two natural areas in the United States: the central lowlands and the inner lowlands.

name: indiana
sentence: The till plains are the northern and central areas of Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: A large part of its appearance is the result of elements left by glaciers.

name: indiana
sentence: The centre of Indiana is mostly flat with a few low hilly hills (except when rivers cut deep valleys across the plain, such as the Wabash River and Sugar Creek) and soil consisting of glacial sands, gravel and clay, giving rise to exceptional agricultural land.

name: indiana
sentence: Northern Indiana is similar, with the exception of higher and more rolling terminal moraines and hundreds of kettle lakes.

name: indiana
sentence: In northwestern Indiana, there are various ridges of sand and dunes, some reaching nearly 200 feet high.

name: indiana
sentence: It extends along the shore of Lake Michigan and from the interior to the Kankakee Outwash Plain.

name: indiana
sentence: Southern Indiana is characterized by valleys and rugged, hilly terrain, contrasting with much of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: Here, the substrate is exposed to the surface and is not buried in the glacier until further north.

name: indiana
sentence: Due to Indiana limestone, the area has numerous caves, caves and quarries.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's main water systems include the Whitewater, White, Blue, Wabash, St. Joseph and Maumee rivers.

name: indiana
sentence: According to the Indiana Department of Natural Resources, there were 65 rivers, streams and streams of environmental interest or picturesque beauty, which included only a portion of approximately 24,000 nautical miles in the state.

name: indiana
sentence: The Wabash River, which is the longest open river east of Mississippi, is the official Indiana River.

name: indiana
sentence: At 475 miles (764 km) in length, the river bisects the state from northeast to southwest, forming part of the state border with Illinois, before approaching the Ohio River.

name: indiana
sentence: The river was the subject of several songs, such as On the Banks of the Wabash, The Wabash Cannonball and Back Home Again, In Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: There are about 900 lakes listed by the Indiana Ministry of Natural Resources.

name: indiana
sentence: In the northwest, Indiana borders Lake Michigan, one of five lakes that includes the Great Lakes, the largest group of freshwater lakes in the world.

name: indiana
sentence: Tippecanoe Lake, the deepest lake in the state, reaches depths of nearly 37 metres, while Wawassee Lake is the largest natural lake in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: At 10 750 acres (summer pool level), Lake Monroe is the largest lake in Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: In the past, almost all of Indiana had a humid continental climate, with cold winters and warm and humid summers; only the extreme south of the state was in the humid subtropical climate, which receives more precipitation than other parts of Indiana.

name: indiana
sentence: But as of the 2016 update, about half of the state is now classified as subtropical wet.

name: indiana
sentence: Temperatures generally vary from the northern and southern sections of the state.

name: indiana
sentence: In mid-winter, average high/low temperatures vary from about 30°F/15°F (−1°C/−10°C) in the extreme north to 41°F/24°F (5°C/−4°C) in the extreme south.

name: indiana
sentence: In mid-summer, there is generally slightly less variation across the state, as average high/low temperatures vary from about 84°F/64°F (29°C/18°C) in the extreme north to 90°F/69°F (32°C/21°C) in the extreme south.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's record temperature was 116°F (47°C) on July 14, 1936, in Collegeville.

name: indiana
sentence: The record was −36°F (−38°C) on 19 January 1994 in New Whiteland.

name: indiana
sentence: The growing season generally ranges from 155 days in the north to 185 days in the south.

name: indiana

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has a constitutional form of democratic republican government with three branches: the executive, including an elected governor and lieutenant governor; the legislature, consisting of an elected bicameral General Assembly; and the judiciary, the Supreme Court of Indiana, the Indiana Court of Appeal and circuit courts.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor of Indiana is the chief executive officer of the state and has the authority to manage the government as set out in the Indiana Constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor and Lieutenant Governor are jointly elected for a four-year term, with government elections taking place at the same time as the United States presidential elections (1996, 2000, 2004, 2008, etc.).

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor may not serve more than two consecutive terms.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor works with the Indiana General Assembly and the Indiana Supreme Court to govern the state and has the power to adjust the other branches.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor may convene special sessions of the General Assembly and select and revoke the leaders of almost all departments, councils and commissions of the State.

name: indiana
sentence: Other notable powers include the appeal to the Indiana Guard Reserve or the Indiana National Guard in case of emergency or disaster, the granting of pardons or commutation of the sentence of any criminal offender, except in cases of treason or indictment, and the possession of abundant legal authority.

name: indiana
sentence: The Lieutenant Governor is the Speaker of the Senate and ensures that the rules of the Senate are respected by its constituents.

name: indiana
sentence: The Lieutenant Governor only votes when necessary to break ties.

name: indiana
sentence: If the Governor dies in office, becomes permanently unfit, resigns or is charged, the Lieutenant Governor becomes Governor.

name: indiana
sentence: If the positions of governor and lieutenant governor are not occupied, the pro tempore president becomes governor.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana General Assembly is composed of a 50-member Senator and a 100-member House of Representatives.

name: indiana
sentence: The Senate is the upper chamber of the General Assembly and the House of Representatives is the lower chamber.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly has exclusive legislative power within the government of the State.

name: indiana
sentence: Both the senator and the house can introduce a bill, except for the fact that the senator is not authorized to pass a bill that will have an impact on revenues.

name: indiana
sentence: Bills are debated and passed separately in each House, but both Houses must pass them before they can be presented to the Governor.

name: indiana
sentence: The legislator may cancel the Governor's veto by voting by a majority of full members in the Senate and in the House of Representatives.

name: indiana
sentence: Each law adopted by the General Assembly must be used without exception by the entire State.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly has no power to create legislation that targets a particular community.

name: indiana
sentence: The General Assembly can manage the State's judicial system by organizing the size of courts and the boundaries of their districts.

name: indiana
sentence: It can also oversee the activities of the executive branch of the state government, has limited the power to regulate county governments within the state, and has exclusive authority to initiate the method of amending the Indiana Constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: The Indiana Supreme Court is composed of five judges with a 15-judge Court of Appeal.

name: indiana
sentence: The Governor selects the judges of the Supreme Courts and Appeals Courts from a group of candidates selected by a special commission.

name: indiana
sentence: After two years, judges must obtain the support of the electorate to serve for a 10-year term.

name: indiana
sentence: In almost all cases, the Supreme Court does not have original jurisdiction and can only deal with cases that have been referred to it after having been heard by lower courts.

name: indiana
sentence: Local district courts are where most cases begin with a trial and the consequences are decided by the jury.

name: indiana
sentence: The Supreme Court has initial and exclusive jurisdiction in certain areas, including the practice of law, discipline or exclusion of judges appointed to the lower courts of the State, and the control of the exercise of jurisdiction by other lower courts of the State.
