sentence: Since 1954, 181 Wing of the Indian National Air Guard has been stationed there, but the 2005 Realignment and Closure Base (BRAC) proposal indicated that the 181st would lose its fighter mission and F-16 aircraft, leaving the Terre Haute facility with a combat aircraft facility.

name: indiana
sentence: Louisville International Airport, opposite the Ohio River in Louisville, Kentucky, serves southern Indiana, as does the Cincinnati/North Kentucky International Airport in Hebron, Kentucky.

name: indiana
sentence: Many residents of Northwest Indiana, primarily located in the Chicago metropolitan area, use Chicago airports, O'Hare International Airport and Chicago Midway International Airport.

name: indiana
sentence: The major American interstate highways in Indiana are I-64, I-65, I-265, I-465, I-865, I-69, I-469, I-70, I-74, I-80, I-90, I-94 and I-275.

name: indiana
sentence: The various roads that intersect in and around Indianapolis, as well as its historic status as a railway hub, and the canals that crossed Indiana, are the source of the state's motto, the Crossroads of America.

name: indiana
sentence: There are also many American roads and state highways maintained by Indiana's Department of Transportation.

name: indiana
sentence: They are numbered according to the same convention as the United States.

name: indiana
sentence: Highways.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana allows highways of various classifications to have the same number.

name: indiana
sentence: For example, I-64 and Indiana State Road 64 both exist (rather close to each other) in Indiana, but are separate roads with no relation to each other.

name: indiana
sentence: A $3 billion project covering period I-69 is under way.

name: indiana
sentence: The project has been divided into six sections, with the first five (relating Evansville to Martinsville) now completed.

name: indiana
sentence: The sixth and final phase for Indianapolis is under planning.

name: indiana
sentence: Once completed, the I-69 will cross an additional 142 miles (229 km) across the state.

name: indiana
sentence: Most Indiana counties use a network-based system to identify county roads; this system has replaced the old arbitrary system of road numbers and names, and (among other things) it is much easier to identify call sources placed in the 9-1-1 system.

name: indiana
sentence: These systems are easier to implement in the glacially flat northern and central parts of the State.

name: indiana
sentence: Rural counties in the southern third of the state are less likely to have grids and more likely to rely on non-systematic road names (e.g., Crawford, Harrison, Perry, Scott and Washington counties).

name: indiana
sentence: There are also counties in the northern parts of the State that have never set up a grid or implemented only part of it.

name: indiana
sentence: Some counties are also distributed in a network that is almost similar to that of diamonds (e.g. Clark, Floyd, Gibson and Knox counties).

name: indiana
sentence: Such a system is also almost useless in these situations as well.

name: indiana
sentence: One day, Knox County used two different network systems for county roads because the county was built using two different surveying systems, but it has since decided to use road names and to combine roads instead.

name: indiana
sentence: In particular, the road network of St. Joseph County, whose main city is South Bend, uses names of perennial trees (i.e., from the south to the west).

name: indiana
sentence: Ash, Hickory, Iron wood, etc.)

name: indiana
sentence: In alphabetical order for north-south roads and presidential names and other notable names (i.e. Adams, Edison, Lincoln Way, etc.)

name: indiana
sentence: Alphabetical order for east-west roads.

name: indiana
sentence: There are exceptions to this rule in the city centre of South Bend and Mishawaka.

name: indiana
sentence: The east-west roads of Hamilton County continue the numbered Indianapolis street network from 96th Street to Marion County Line to 296th Street at Tipton County Line.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana has over 4,255 miles of track, 91 percent of which are operated by Class I railways, primarily CSX Transportation and the Norfolk Southern Railway.

name: indiana
sentence: Other Class I railways in Indiana include the Canadian National Railway and the Soo Line, a subsidiary of the Canadian Pacific Railway, as well as Amtrak.

name: indiana
sentence: The remaining miles are operated by 37 regional, local, switch and terminal railways.

name: indiana
sentence: The South Shore Line is one of the country's largest suburban rail networks, extending from Chicago to South Bend.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana implements a comprehensive railway plan prepared in 2002 by Parsons Corporation.

name: indiana
sentence: Many recreational trails, such as the Monon Trail and Cardinal Greenway, were created from abandoned railways.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana ships more than 70 million tons of goods annually by water, which ranks 14th among all U.S. states.

name: indiana
sentence: More than half of the Indiana border is water, which consists of 400 miles (640 km) of direct access to two major freight arteries: the Great Lakes/St.

name: indiana
sentence: Lawrence Seaway (via Lake Michigan) and the inland waterway system (via Ohio River).

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana harbours manage three major ports, including Burns Harbor, Jeffersonville and Mount Vernon.

name: indiana
sentence: In Evansville, three public port facilities and several private port facilities are served throughout the year by five major barge lines operating on the Ohio River.

name: indiana
sentence: Evansville has been a U.S. Customs port of entry for more than 125 years.

name: indiana
sentence: For this reason, it is possible to have international goods shipped to Evansville for customs purposes.

name: indiana
sentence: International cargo can then clear customs in Evansville rather than a coastal port.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana's constitution of 1816 was the first in the country to establish a publicly funded public school system.

name: indiana
sentence: It also assigned a canton to a public university.

name: indiana
sentence: However, the plan proved far too idealistic for a pioneering society, as the tax money was not available to its organization.

name: indiana
sentence: In the 1840s Caleb Mills insisted on the need for tax-funded schools, and in 1851 his councils were included in the new state constitution.

name: indiana
sentence: In 1843, the Legislature decreed that African-Americans could not attend public schools, leading to the foundation of the Union Literary Institute and other schools for them, financed by donations or students themselves.

name: indiana
sentence: Although the growth of the public school system had been hampered by legal entanglements, many public elementary schools had been used in 1870.

name: indiana
sentence: Most Indiana children attend public schools, but almost ten per cent attend private and parish schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Approximately half of Indiana's students are enrolled in state-funded four-year schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana public schools have undergone several changes throughout Indiana's history.

name: indiana
sentence: The modern standards of public schools have been applied throughout the State.

name: indiana
sentence: The new standards were adopted in April 2014.

name: indiana
sentence: The overall objective of these new government standards is to ensure that Indiana students have the skills and requirements to enter the college or labour force upon graduation from high school.

name: indiana
sentence: State standards can be found for almost all major subjects taught in Indiana's public schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Among the priority standards are mathematics, the arts of English and language, science and social studies.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2017, the Indiana Ministry of Education indicated that the overall graduation rate was 87.19 per cent for exempt graduations and 80.10 per cent for non-graduations.

name: indiana
sentence: The largest educational institution is the University of Indiana, whose flagship campus was approved as the Indiana Seminary in 1820.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana State University was established as the State Normal School in 1865.

name: indiana
sentence: The other three independent state universities are the Vincennes University (Founded in 1801 by the Indiana Territory), Ball State University (1918) and the Southern Indiana University (1965 under the name of ISU – Evansville).

name: indiana
sentence: Many of Indiana's private colleges and universities are affiliated with religious groups.

name: indiana
sentence: Notre Dame University, Marian University and Saint-François University are popular Catholic schools.

name: indiana
sentence: Universities affiliated to Protestant denominations include Anderson University, Butler University, Huntington University, Manchester University, Indiana Wesleyan University, Taylor University, Franklin College, Hanover College, DePauw University, Earlham College, Valparaiso University, University of Indianapolis and University of Evansville.

name: indiana
sentence: The government's community college system, the Ivy Tech Community College of Indiana, serves nearly 200,000 students a year, making it the largest public post-secondary institution in the state and the largest state-accredited community college system.

name: indiana
sentence: In 2008, the University of Indiana system agreed to transfer most of its associated degrees (2 years) to the Ivy Tech Community College system.

name: indiana
sentence: The state has several universities ranked among the best in the 2013 US News & World Report rankings.

name: indiana
sentence: Notre Dame University is ranked among the top 20 with the University of Indiana Bloomington and Purdue being ranked among the top 100.

name: indiana
sentence: Indiana University – Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) has recently been one of the top 200 U.S. News & World Report rankings.

name: indiana
sentence: Butler, Valparaiso and the University of Evansville are ranked among the top ten in the regional rankings at Midwest University.

name: indiana
sentence: Purdue's engineering programs are ranked eighth in the country.

name: indiana
sentence: In addition, Taylor University is ranked first at Midwest Rankings Regional College and the Rose-Hulman Institute of Technology is considered the best undergraduate engineering school (where a doctorate is not offered) for 15 consecutive years.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is a state in the Midwest of the United States bordered by Mississippi to the east and Missouri and Big Sioux to the west.

name: iowa
sentence: It is bordered by six states: Wisconsin in the northeast, Illinois in the east and southeast, Missouri in the south, Nebraska in the west, South Dakota in the northwest and Minnesota in the north.

name: iowa
sentence: In the colonial era, Iowa was part of French Louisiana and Spanish Louisiana.

name: iowa
sentence: After purchasing in Louisiana, people laid the foundation for an agriculture-based economy at the heart of the Corn Belt.

name: iowa
sentence: In the second half of the twentieth century, the agricultural economy of Iowa made the transition to a diversified economy of manufacturing, processing, financial services, information technology, biotechnology and green energy production.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is the 26th largest of the total area and the 30th most populous of the 50 U.S. states.

name: iowa
sentence: The capital of the state, the most populated city, and the largest metropolitan area entirely within the state is Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: Part of the large metropolitan area of Omaha, Nebraska, covers three counties in southwestern Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has been identified as one of the safest American states to live in.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa derives its name from the Ioway people, one of the many Amerindian nations whose territory included the future state at the time of European colonization.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is bordered by Mississippi to the east, Missouri and Big Sioux to the west.

name: iowa
sentence: The northern boundary is a line along 43 degrees, 30 minutes north latitude.

name: iowa
sentence: The southern boundary is the Des Moines River and a line not quite straight along about 40 degrees 35 minutes north, as decided by the U.S. Supreme Court in Missouri v. Iowa (1849) after a confrontation between Missouri and Iowa known as the Honey War.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa is the only state whose eastern and western borders are formed almost entirely by rivers.

name: iowa
sentence: Carter Lake, Iowa, is the only town in the state west of the Missouri River.

name: iowa
sentence: There are 99 counties in Iowa, but 100 counties because there are two counties in Lee County.

name: iowa
sentence: The State capital, Des Moines, is located in Polk County.

name: iowa
sentence: Geology of Iowa bedrock generally increases from west to east.

name: iowa
sentence: In northwestern Iowa, cretaceous substrates can be 74 million years old; in eastern Iowa, Cambrian substrates are about 500 million years old.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa is generally not flat

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa can be divided into eight forms of land based on glaciation, soils, topography and drainage of rivers.

name: iowa
sentence: Loess Hills are located along the western border of the State, some of which are several hundred feet thick.

name: iowa
sentence: The northeast of Iowa along the upper Mississippi River is part of the Drift-free area, consisting of steep hills and valleys that appear almost mountainous.

name: iowa
sentence: Several natural lakes exist, including Spirit Lake, Okoboji Lake West and Okoboji Lake East in the northwest Iowa (see Great Lakes of Iowa).

name: iowa
sentence: East is Clear Lake.

name: iowa
sentence: Artificial lakes include Odessa Lake, Saylorville Lake, Red Rock Lake, Coralville Lake, MacBride Lake and Rathbun Lake.

name: iowa
sentence: Prior to European colonization, 4 to 6 million acres of the state were covered by wetlands, and about 95% of these wetlands were drained.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa's natural vegetation consists of high grass and savannah grasslands in the highlands, dense forests and wetlands in floodplains and protected river valleys, and hen nest wetlands in the northern prairies.

name: iowa
sentence: Most of Iowa is used for agriculture; crops cover 60 per cent of the state, grasslands (mainly pastures and hay with some grasslands and wetlands) cover 30 per cent, and forests 7 per cent, urban areas and water 1 per cent more each.

name: iowa
sentence: The southern part of Iowa is categorized as the ecoregion of transition between forests and central grasslands.

name: iowa
sentence: The northern, drier part of the Iowa River is part of the high prairies of the Centre.

name: iowa
sentence: There is a shortage of natural areas in Iowa; less than 1% of the high-grass prairies that once covered most of Iowa remain intact; only 5% of the wetlands in the state pothole remain, and most of the original forest has been lost.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2005, Iowa ranked 49th in the United States on public land.

name: iowa
sentence: Threatened or endangered animals in Iowa include the lower inner tern, the plover, the Indiana bat, the pallided sturgeon, the Iowa Pleistocene snail, the Higgins eye-brow mussel and the Topeka sturgeon.

name: iowa
sentence: Endangered or threatened plants include the western prairie fringe orchid, eastern prairie fringe orchid, Mead's milkweed, prairie clover and northern wild monks.

name: iowa
sentence: The explosion in the number of high-density breeding facilities in Iowa has led to an increase in water contamination in rural areas and a decrease in air quality.

name: iowa
sentence: Other factors that have a negative impact on the Iowa environment include the intensive use of old coal-fired power plants, the application of fertilizers and pesticides from agricultural production and the reduction of the Jordanian aquifer.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has a humid continental climate throughout the state (Köppen climate classification Dfa) with extremes of both heat and cold.

name: iowa
sentence: The average annual temperature at Des Moines is 50°F (10°C); for some locations in the north, such as Mason City, the figure is about 45°F (7°C), while Keokuk, on the Mississippi River, on average 52°F (11°C).

name: iowa
sentence: Snowfall is common, with Monks getting about 26 days of snowfall a year, and other places, such as Shenandoah getting about 11 days of snowfall in a year.

name: iowa
sentence: Spring marks the start of the violent weather season.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has an average of about 50 days of stormy activity per year.

name: iowa
sentence: The annual 30-year average of Tornado in Iowa is 47.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2008, 12 people were killed by tornadoes in Iowa, making it the most deadly year since 1968 and the second largest tornado in a year with 105, the total in 2001.

name: iowa
sentence: Summers of Iowa are known for heat and humidity, with diurnal temperatures sometimes close to 90°F (32°C) and sometimes above 100°F (38°C).

name: iowa
sentence: Middle winters in the state are known to fall well below freezing, even below -18°F (−28°C).

name: iowa
sentence: The warmest temperature of Iowa at 118 °F (48 °C) was recorded at Keokuk on 20 July 1934 during a nationwide heat wave; the lowest temperature of any time of -47 °F (−44 °C) was recorded at Washta on 12 January 1912.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has a relatively smooth gradient of variable precipitation throughout the state, with regions in the southeast receiving on average more than 38 inches (97 cm) of rain per year, and the northwest receiving less than 28 inches (71 cm).

name: iowa
sentence: The precipitation trend in Iowa is seasonal, with more rainfall in the summer months.

name: iowa
sentence: Almost at the state level, the driest month is January or February, and the wettest month is June, due to frequent showers and thunderstorms, some of which produce hail, harmful winds and/or tornadoes.

name: iowa
sentence: At Des Moines, about in the middle of the state, more than two-thirds of the 34.72-inch (88.2-cm) rain falls from April to September, and about half of the average annual rainfall falls from May to August, reaching a peak in June.

name: iowa
sentence: When the American Indians arrived in what is now the Iowa more than 13,000 years ago, they were hunters and gatherers living in a glacial landscape of the Pleistocene.

name: iowa
sentence: By the time European explorers and traders visited Iowa, American Indians were largely farmers with complex economic, social and political systems.

name: iowa
sentence: This transformation has gradually taken place.

name: iowa
sentence: During the archaic period (10,500-2,800 years ago), American Indians adapt to local environments and ecosystems, slowly becoming more sedentary as populations increase.

name: iowa
sentence: More than 3,000 years ago, at the end of the archaic period, American Iowa Indians began using domesticated plants.

name: iowa
sentence: In the ensuing period, Woodland experienced increased dependence on agriculture and social complexity, with increased use of mounds, ceramics and specialized livelihoods.

name: iowa
sentence: During the late prehistoric period (beginning around 900 A.D.), the increased use of maize and social changes led to flourishing and nucleous social institutions.

name: iowa
sentence: The arrival of European goods and diseases in the protohistoric period led to dramatic demographic changes and economic and social upheavals, with the arrival of new tribes and the first European explorers and traders.

name: iowa
sentence: There were many Indian tribes living in Iowa at the beginning of the European exploration.

name: iowa
sentence: The tribes that were probably descendants of prehistoric Oneota include Dakota, Ho-Chunk, Ioway and Otoe.

name: iowa
sentence: The tribes that arrived in Iowa at the end of prehistoric or protohistoric periods include the Illinihek, Meskwaki, Omaha and Sauk.

name: iowa
sentence: The first European explorers known to document Iowa were Jacques Marquette and Louis Jolliet who traveled the Mississippi in 1673 and documented several indigenous villages on the Iowa side.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa region was claimed for France and remained French territory until 1763.

name: iowa
sentence: The French, before their imminent defeat in the French and Indian wars, transferred the property to their ally, Spain.

name: iowa
sentence: Spain exercised a very loose control over the Iowa region, granting commercial licences to French and British traders, who established trading posts along the Mississippi and the Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa was part of a territory known as Louisiana or Louisiana, and European traders were interested in lead and fur obtained by Aboriginal people.

name: iowa
sentence: The Sauk and Meskwaki effectively controlled trade on Mississippi in the late 18th and early 19th centuries.

name: iowa
sentence: Among the first merchants in Mississippi were Julien Dubuque, Robert de la Salle and Paul Marin.

name: iowa
sentence: Along the Missouri River, at least five French and English trading houses were built prior to 1808.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1800, Napoleon Bonaparte took control of Louisiana in a treaty.

name: iowa
sentence: After the purchase of Louisiana in 1803, Congress divided the purchase of Louisiana into two parts: the Territory of Orleans and the District of Louisiana, the present Iowa falling into the latter.

name: iowa
sentence: Indiana was established in 1800 to exercise jurisdiction over that part of the district.

name: iowa
sentence: Much of Iowa was mapped by Zebulon Pike in 1805, but it was only when Fort Madison was built in 1808 that the United States established tenuous military control over the area.

name: iowa
sentence: Fort Madison was built to control the trade and establish American domination over the Upper Mississippi, but it was misconceived and hostile by the Sauk and Fox, many of whom were allies with the British, who had not abandoned the claims of the territory.

name: iowa
sentence: Fort Madison was defeated by the British-backed Aboriginal people in 1813 during the War of 1812, and Fort Shelby, on the Dog Prairie in Wisconsin, also fell into British hands.

name: iowa
sentence: Black Hawk took part in Fort Madison's siege.

name: iowa
sentence: Another small military outpost was established along the Mississippi River in the current Bellevue.

name: iowa
sentence: This poorly located stockade was also attacked by hundreds of Aboriginal people in 1813, but was successfully defended and abandoned until the settlers returned to the area in the mid-1830s.

name: iowa
sentence: After the war, the United States restored control of the area through the construction of Fort Armstrong, Fort Snelling, Minnesota, and Fort Atkinson, Nebraska.

name: iowa
sentence: The United States encouraged settlement on the eastern side of Mississippi and Indian abduction to the west.

name: iowa
sentence: A disputed 1804 treaty between Quashquame and William Henry Harrison, which delivered much of Illinois to the United States, enraged many Sauk and led to the Black Hawk War of 1832.

name: iowa
sentence: The Sauk and Meskwaki sold their land in the Mississippi Valley in 1832 in the purchase of Black Hawk and sold their remaining land in Iowa in 1842, most of which settled on a reserve in Kansas.

name: iowa
sentence: Many Meskwaki then returned to Iowa and settled near Tama, Iowa; the Meskwaki colony remains to date.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1856, the Iowa Legislature passed an unprecedented law allowing Meskawki to buy the land.

name: iowa
sentence: However, contrary to the unprecedented act of the Iowa Legislature, the U.S. federal government, through the use of treaties, forced the Ho-Chunk of Iowa in 1848, and the Iowa Dakota in 1858.

name: iowa
sentence: The Western Iowa around Bluffs of the Modern Council was used as an Indian reserve for the members of the Council of Three Fires.

name: iowa
sentence: The first American settlers formally moved to Iowa in June 1833.

name: iowa
sentence: Mainly, they were families from Ohio, Pennsylvania, New York, Indiana, Kentucky, and Virginia who settled along the western shores of Mississippi and founded the modern cities of Dubuque and Bellevue.

name: iowa
sentence: On July 4, 1838, the U.S. Congress created the territory of Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: President Martin Van Buren appointed Robert Lucas as Governor of the Territory, which at the time had 22 counties and a population of 23,242 inhabitants.

name: iowa
sentence: Almost immediately after obtaining territorial status, a clamour was expressed for the establishment of a State.

name: iowa
sentence: On December 28, 1846, Iowa became the 29th State of the Union when President James K. Polk signed the Iowa Admission Bill.

name: iowa
sentence: Once admitted to the Union, the State's border problems resolved, and most of its land purchased from Aboriginal people, Iowa gave its direction to development and organized campaigns for settlers and investors, boasting the rich agricultural lands of the young border state, good citizens, free and open society, and good government.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has a long tradition of state and county fairs.

name: iowa
sentence: The first and second Iowa State Fairs were held in the more developed eastern part of the state in Fairfield.

name: iowa
sentence: The first fair was held from October 25 to 27, 1854, at a cost of approximately $323.

name: iowa
sentence: Subsequently, the fair moved to places closer to the center of the state and in 1886 found a permanent house in Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: Since then, the State Fair has been held every year, with a few exceptions: 1898 due to the war between Spain and America and the World Fair in Omaha, Nebraska, nearby; 1942 to 1945 due to the Second World War, because the fairs were used as a supply depot for the army; and 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa supported the Union during the civil war, voting strongly for Abraham Lincoln, although there was an anti-war movement "Copperhead" in the state, caused in part by a fall in crop prices caused by the war.

name: iowa
sentence: There were no battles in the state, although the Battle of Athens, the Missouri, 1861, was fought just opposite the River Des Moines of Croton, the Iowa, and the shots of the battle landed in the Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa sent great food to the armies and eastern towns.

name: iowa
sentence: Much of Iowa's support for the Union can be attributed to Samuel J. Kirkwood, his first governor in wartime.

name: iowa
sentence: Out of a total population of 675,000, approximately 116,000 men have been subjected to military functions.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa contributed proportionally more men to the military service of the civil war than any other state, north or south, by sending more than 75,000 volunteers to the armed forces, more than a sixth of whom were killed before the Confederates went to Appomattox.

name: iowa
sentence: Most of them fought in the big countryside in the Mississippi Valley and in the South.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa troops fought at Wilson's Creek in Missouri, Pea Ridge in Arkansas, Forts Henry and Donelson, Shiloh, Chattanooga, Chickamauga, Missionary Ridge, and Rossville Gap as well as Vicksburg, Iuka and Corinth.

name: iowa
sentence: They served with the Potomac Army in Virginia and fought under General Union Philip Sheridan in the Shenandoah Valley.

name: iowa
sentence: Many of them died and were buried in Andersonville.

name: iowa
sentence: They walked on General Nathaniel Banks' reckless expedition to the Red River.

name: iowa
sentence: Twenty-seven Iowans received the Medal of Honour, the highest military decoration awarded by the U.S. government, which was first awarded during the civil war.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa has several Brigadier Generals and four main generals: Grenville Mellen Dodge, Samuel R. Curtis, Francis J. Herron and Frederick Steele.

name: iowa
sentence: After the civil war, the Iowa population continued to grow considerably, from 674,913 in 1860 to 1,624,615 in 1880.

name: iowa
sentence: The American Civil War briefly brought greater profits.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1917, the United States entered the First World War and farmers and all Iowans experienced an economy in times of war.

name: iowa
sentence: For farmers, the change has been important.

name: iowa
sentence: Since the beginning of the war in 1914, farmers in Iowa have enjoyed economic prosperity, which lasted until the end of the war.

name: iowa
sentence: In the economic sector, Iowa has also undergone significant changes.

name: iowa
sentence: Starting from the first industries developed in the 1830s, mainly for the processing of cultivated materials in the region, Iowa experienced a gradual increase in the number of enterprises and manufacturing operations.

name: iowa
sentence: The transition from an agricultural to a mixed economy has been slow.

name: iowa
sentence: The Great Depression and the Second World War accelerated the shift from small-scale agriculture to larger farms, and began a trend towards urbanization.

name: iowa
sentence: The post-World War II period was marked by a particular increase in manufacturing activities.

name: iowa
sentence: The agricultural crisis of the 1980s caused a major recession in Iowa, causing the poverty that has not been observed since the depression.

name: iowa
sentence: The crisis caused a major population decline, which lasted ten years.

name: iowa
sentence: After falling apart in the 1980s, the Iowa economy began to become less and less dependent on agriculture.

name: iowa
sentence: At the beginning of the 21st century, it was characterized by a combination of manufacturing services, biotechnology, finance and insurance, and government services.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa population has grown at a faster rate than the United States as a whole, and Iowa now has a predominantly urban population.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa Economic Development Authority, established in 2011, has replaced the Iowa Economic Development Department and its annual reports are a source of economic information.

name: iowa
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that the Iowa population was 3,155,070 on July 1, 2019, an increase of 3.57% since the 2010 census.

name: iowa
sentence: Of the Iowa residents, 70.8 per cent were born in Iowa, 23.6 per cent were born in another U.S. state, 0.6 per cent were born in Puerto Rico, the U.S. islands or abroad to U.S. parents, and 5 per cent were born abroad.

name: iowa
sentence: Immigration from outside the United States resulted in a net increase of 29,386 people, while internal migration resulted in a net loss of 41,140 people.

name: iowa
sentence: 6.5% of the Iowa population were under five years of age, 22.6% were under 18 years of age, and 14.7% were 65 years of age or older.

name: iowa
sentence: Men accounted for approximately 49.6 per cent of the population.

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa banned the holy towns.

name: iowa
sentence: The population density of the State is 52.7 people per square mile.

name: iowa
sentence: In the 2010 census, the Iowa population centre is located in Marshall County, near Melbourne.

name: iowa
sentence: At the 2010 census, the population of Iowa was 3,046,355.

name: iowa
sentence: The gender composition of the state was 49.5 per cent for men and 50.5 per cent for women.

name: iowa
sentence: 23.9% of the population were under the age of 18.

name: iowa
sentence: The following table shows the racial composition of the Iowa population in 2018.

name: iowa
sentence: According to the 2016 U.S. Community Survey, 5.6% of the Iowa population were of Hispanic or Latin origin (of any race): Mexican (4.3%), Puerto Rican (0.2%), Cuban (0.1%) and other Hispanic or Latin origin (1.0%).

name: iowa
sentence: The five largest groups of ancestry were German (35.1%), Irish (13.5%), English (8.2%), American (5.8%) and Norwegian (5.0%).

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa population is more urban than rural, with 61 per cent living in urban areas in 2000, a trend that began in the early twentieth century.

name: iowa
sentence: Urban counties in Iowa increased by 8.5 per cent between 2000 and 2008, while rural counties decreased by 4.2 per cent.

name: iowa
sentence: The shift from rural to urban has resulted in an increase in population in more urbanized counties such as Dallas, Johnson, Linn, Polk and Scott, to the detriment of more rural counties.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa, like other Midwest states (especially Kansas, Nebraska, North Dakota and South Dakota), feels the strongest of rural flights, although Iowa has been growing in population since about 1990.

name: iowa
sentence: Some smaller communities, such as Denison and Storm Lake, have mitigated this population loss through earnings for immigrant workers.

sentence: Although Iowa is often regarded as an agricultural state, agriculture is a relatively small part of the state's diversified economy, with manufacturing, biotechnology, financial and insurance services and government services contributing substantially to the Iowa economy.

sentence: In Iowa, the term "political party" refers to political organizations that obtained at least two per cent of the votes cast for the president or governor in the "last general election".

name: iowa
sentence: The Iowa recognizes three political parties, the Republican Party, the Democratic Party and the libertarian Party.

name: iowa
sentence: The Libertarian Party won official political party status in 2017 because presidential candidate Gary Johnson won 3.8% of Iowa's votes in the 2016 general election.

name: iowa
sentence: Third parties, officially referred to as "non-party political organizations", may also appear on the ballot paper.

name: iowa
sentence: Four of them have had candidates for the Iowa elections since 2004 for various positions: the Constitutional Party, the Green Party, the Pirate Party and the Socialist Workers Party.

name: iowa
sentence: Following the 2010 elections, each party controlled a chamber of the Iowa General Assembly: the House had a republican majority, while the Senator had a democratic majority.

sentence: Current Democratic Governor Chet Culver was defeated in 2010 by Republican Terry Branstad, who had served as governor from 1983 to 1999.

name: iowa
sentence: The state receives considerable attention every four years because the Iowa caucus, which brings together voters to select delegates to state conventions, is the country's first presidential caucus.

name: iowa
sentence: Caucuses, held in January or February of the election year, involve people who meet in public homes or places and choose their candidates, rather than voting by secret ballot as is the case in a primary presidential election.The following week, the Iowa caucuses became the starting point for choosing the two main presidential candidates.

name: iowa
sentence: In the nineteenth century, Iowa was one of the first States to enact prohibitions against racial discrimination, particularly in the field of education, but was slow to achieve full integration in the twentieth century.

name: iowa
sentence: In the first decision of the Iowa Supreme Court — in Re the Matter of Ralph, rendered in July 1839 — the Court rejected slavery in a decision that found a slave named free Ralph when he walked on the Iowa soil, 26 years before the end of the civil war.

name: iowa
sentence: The state removed racial barriers to marriage in 1851, more than 100 years before the U.S. Supreme Court banned deception laws throughout the country.

name: iowa
sentence: The Supreme Court of Iowa ruled on Clark v. The Board of Directors in 1868, ruling that "separate but equal" schools of a racial nature had no place in Iowa, 85 years before Brown v. Board of Education.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1875, a number of additional judicial decisions effectively ended segregation in Iowa schools.

name: iowa
sentence: Social and housing discrimination continued against blacks in state universities until the 1950s.

name: iowa
sentence: The Court heard Coger v. The North Western Union Packet Co. in 1873, ruling against racial discrimination in public institutions 91 years before the Supreme Court of the United States rendered the same decision.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1884, the Iowa Civil Rights Act apparently prohibited discrimination by businesses: "Everyone in that State has the right to the full and equal enjoyment of accommodation, benefits, facilities and privileges of inns, restaurants, cellars, dining houses, food counters and all other places where refreshments are served, public transportation, hairdressing salons, baths, theatres and all other places of fun".

name: iowa
sentence: However, the courts have chosen to strictly apply this law, allowing for the continuation of de facto discrimination.

name: iowa
sentence: Racial discrimination in public enterprises was found illegal only in 1949, when the court ruled in the State of Iowa v. Katz that companies should serve their clients regardless of their race; the case began when Edna Griffin was denied service in a pharmacy in Des Moines.

name: iowa
sentence: Full racial civil rights have been codified under the Iowa Civil Rights Act 1965.

name: iowa
sentence: As in the case of racial equality, Iowa was the vanguard of women's rights in the mid-19th century, but did not allow women to vote until the nineteenth amendment to the U.S. Constitution was ratified in 1920, with Iowa being one of the ratification votes.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1847, Iowa University became the first public university in the United States to admit men and women on an equal footing.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1869, Iowa became the first State of the Union to admit women to the practice of law, the Court ruling that women cannot be denied the right to practice law in Iowa and to admit Arabella A. Mansfield to the practice of law.

name: iowa
sentence: Several attempts to grant full voting rights to women in Iowa were defeated between 1870 and 1919.

name: iowa
sentence: In 1894, women were granted "partial suffrage", allowing them to vote on matters, but not for candidates.

name: iowa
sentence: It is only upon ratification of the nineteenth amendment that women have the right to vote in full in Iowa.

name: iowa
sentence: Although Iowa supported the federal amendment to equal rights, in 1980 and 1992, Iowa voters rejected an amendment to the State Constitution on equal rights.

name: iowa
sentence: Iowa added the word "women" to the Constitution of Iowa in 1998.

name: iowa
sentence: After the amendment, it reads as follows: "All men and women are, by nature, free and equal, and have certain inalienable rights, including those to enjoy and defend life and liberty, to acquire, possess and protect property, and to seek and obtain security and happiness."

name: iowa
sentence: In May 2018, Iowa signed one of the country's most restrictive abortion bans: the requirement that a doctor cannot perform an abortion if he detects a fetal heartbeat, which in many cases would limit pregnancies of less than six weeks.

name: iowa
sentence: It was annulled in January 2019, when a state judge in Iowa ruled that the law on "fetal heartbeat" was unconstitutional.

name: iowa
sentence: The state law criminalizing same-sex sexual activity was repealed in June 1976, 27 years before Lawrence v. Texas.

name: iowa
sentence: In 2007, the Iowa legislature added "sexual orientation" and "sexual identity" to the protected classes listed in the Iowa Civil Rights Act.

name: iowa
sentence: On 3 April 2009, the Iowa Supreme Court ruled that Varnum v. Brien, acting unanimously, the State law prohibiting homosexual marriage was unconstitutional.

name: iowa
sentence: This made Iowa the third state in the United States and the first in the Midwest to allow for same-sex marriage.

sentence: Iowa has been one of the main states of the high school movement, and continues to be among the most successful in education today.

sentence: In 2015, Kansas was one of the most productive agricultural states, producing high yields of wheat, maize, sorghum and soybeans.

name: kansas
sentence: The land rises gradually from east to west, with elevations ranging from 684 feet (208 m) along the Verdigris River at Coffeyville, Montgomery County, to 4,039 feet (1,231 m) at Sunflower Mountain, 0.5 miles (0.80 km) from the Colorado border in Wallace County.

name: kansas
sentence: It is a common misconception that Kansas is the flattest state in the nation – in 2003, a language study in Cheek famously declared the state "flatter than a pancake".

sentence: According to the climate classification of Köppen, the climate of Kansas can be characterized in three types: it has a wet, semi-arid and subtropical continental steppe.

name: kansas
sentence: Two-thirds of the state (especially the northeastern part) has a humid continental climate, with cold winters and warm, often humid summers.

name: kansas
sentence: Most precipitation falls in both summer and spring.

name: kansas
sentence: The western third of the state – roughly from the U.S. Highway 83 corridor westward – has a semi-arid steppe climate.

name: kansas
sentence: Summers are hot, often very hot and generally less humid.

name: kansas
sentence: Winters are very variable between hot and very cold.

name: kansas
sentence: The western region receives an average of approximately 16 inches (410 millimetres) of precipitation per year.

name: kansas
sentence: Winter chinook winds can heat western Kansas to 80 degrees Fahrenheit (27 degrees Celsius).

name: kansas
sentence: The south-central and southeastern parts of the state, including the Wichita region, have a humid subtropical climate with warm and humid summers, milder winters and more precipitation than elsewhere in Kansas.

name: kansas
sentence: Some of the characteristics of the three climates are found in most of the state, with droughts and a changing time between dry and wet not uncommon, and both warm and cold spells in winter.

sentence: A charter reconfirmed and strengthened on April 3, 1639, by the King of England Charles I, entrusted Sir Ferdinando Gorges with increased powers over his new province and declared that it "will be forever called and named the PROVINCE OR CUNTY OF MAINE, and not by any other name or name whatsoever..." Maine is the only American state whose name has only one syllable.

name: maine
sentence: The first inhabitants of the territory that is now Maine were the Algonquian Wabanaki peoples, including Passamaquoddy, Maliseet, Penobscot, Androscoggin and Kennebec.

name: maine
sentence: During the last War of King Philip, many of these peoples would merge in one form or another to become the Wabanaki Confederation, assisting the Wampanoag of Massachusetts and the Mahican of New York.

name: maine
sentence: Subsequently, many of these people were driven out of their natural territories, but most of the tribes of Maine continued, without change, until the American Revolution.

sentence: Before that, however, most of these people were considered to be separate nations.

sentence: Many had adapted to life in permanent Iroquois-inspired institutions, while those along the coast tended to be semi-nomadic, from establishment to establishment on an annual cycle.

sentence: European contact with what is now known as Maine may have started around 1200 CE when the Norwegians interacted with the native Penobscot in the present county of Hancock, probably through trade.

sentence: Maine has a humid continental climate (Köppen climate classification Dfb), with warm and sometimes humid summers, and long, cold and very snowy winters.

name: maine
sentence: Winters are particularly severe in the northern and western parts of Maine, while coastal areas are slightly moderated by the Atlantic Ocean, resulting in milder winters and cooler summers than inland areas.

name: maine
sentence: Daytime peaks are generally between 75 and 80°F (24 and 27°C) in the state as a whole in July, with nightfalls in the high 50°F (approximately 15°C).

name: maine
sentence: January temperatures range from 30°F (−1°C) on the south coast to 0°F (−18°C) on average for the night in the far north.

name: maine
sentence: The record state temperature is 105°F (41°C), set in July 1911, at North Bridgton.Precipitation in Maine is evenly distributed throughout the year, but with a slight summer maximum in north/northwest Maine and a slight end of fall or beginning of winter along the coast due to "no'esters" or intense cold-season rains and snow storms.

name: maine

name: maine
sentence: The Constitution of Maine structures the government of the State of Maine, composed of three co-equal branches: executive, legislative and judicial.

name: maine
sentence: The State of Maine also has three constitutional officials (the Secretary of State, the State Treasurer and the State Attorney General) and one statutory official (the State Auditor).

name: maine
sentence: The legislature is the Legislative Assembly of Maine, a bicameral body composed of the House of Representatives of Maine, with 151 members, and the Senate of Maine, with 35 members.

name: maine
sentence: The legislative branch is responsible for the enactment and adoption of laws.

name: maine
sentence: The Executive is responsible for the enforcement of laws created by the Legislature and is headed by the Governor of Maine (currently Janet Mills).

sentence: The current attorney general of Maine is Aaron Frey.

name: maine
sentence: As with other state legislatures, the Maine Legislative Assembly can, by a two-thirds majority vote of the House and Senators, cancel a governing veto.

sentence: Maine is one of the seven states that do not have a Lieutenant Governor.

sentence: The judicial branch is responsible for interpreting the laws of the State.

name: massachusetts

name: massachusetts
sentence: From 1786 to 1787 an armed uprising, known as the Rebellion de Shays, led by Daniel Shays, a veteran of the revolutionary war, wreaked havoc throughout Massachusetts and finally attempted to take over the federal armory.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The rebellion was one of the main factors in the decision to draft a stronger national constitution to replace the articles of Confederation.

name: massachusetts
sentence: On 6 February 1788, Massachusetts became the sixth state to ratify the United States Constitution.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 1820, Maine separated from Massachusetts and entered the Union as the 23rd State following the ratification of the Missouri compromise.

name: massachusetts
sentence: During the 19th century, Massachusetts became a national leader in the American industrial revolution, with factories around cities such as Lowell and Boston producing textiles and shoes, and factories around Springfield producing tools, paper and textiles.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The economy has moved from an economy based mainly on agriculture to an industrial economy, first using water and later the steam engine to power plants.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Channels and railways were used for the transport of raw materials and finished products.

name: massachusetts
sentence: At first, the new industries drew from the Yankees' work on nearby subsistence farms, and later relied on the work of immigrants from Europe and Canada.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Although Massachusetts was the first slave colony in the early 1600s, in the years leading up to the American Civil War, Massachusetts was a centre of progressive and abolitionist activity.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Horace Mann has made the State school system a national model.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Henry David Thoreau and Ralph Waldo Emerson have made a major contribution to American philosophy.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Members of the transcendentalist movement stressed the importance of the natural world and emotion for humanity.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Although opposition to abolitionism existed very early in Massachusetts, leading to anti-abolitionist riots between 1835 and 1837, opposition to slavery has gradually increased over the coming decades.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Abolitionists John Brown and Sojourner Truth lived in Springfield and Northampton respectively, while Frederick Douglass lived in Boston and Susan B. Anthony in Adams, Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is the first state to recruit, train and arm a black regiment with white officers, the 54th Infantry Regiment of Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 1852, Massachusetts became the first state to enact laws on compulsory education.

name: massachusetts
sentence: With the departure of several manufacturing companies, the region's industrial economy began to decline in the early twentieth century.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In the 1920s, competition from the South and Midwest, followed by the Great Depression, led to the collapse of the three major industries in Massachusetts: textiles, footwear manufacturing and precision mechanics.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This decline will continue in the second half of the century; between 1950 and 1979 the number of Massachusetts residents involved in textile manufacturing increased from 264,000 to 63,000.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The closure of the Springfield Armory in 1969, in particular, led to an exodus of highly paid jobs from western Massachusetts, which suffered greatly from its deindustrialization during the last 40 years of the 20th century.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts manufactured 3.4 per cent of the total U.S. military weapons produced during the Second World War, ranking tenth among the 48 states.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In eastern Massachusetts, after the Second World War, the economy shifted from an industry-based economy to a service-based economy.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Government contracts, private investment and research facilities have led to a new and improved industrial climate, with a reduction in unemployment and an increase in per capita income.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Suburbanisation flourished, and in the 1970s the Highway 128 corridor was dotted with high-tech companies that recruited graduates from the region's many elite higher education institutions.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 1987, the state received federal funding for the Central Artery/Tunnel project.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Known as "Big Dig," it was, at the time, the largest federal highway project ever approved.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The project included making the central artery a tunnel under downtown Boston, as well as rerouting several other major highways.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Often controversial, with many claims of graft and mismanagement, and with its initial price of $2.5 billion increasing to a final total of more than $15 billion, the Big Dig has nevertheless changed the face of Downtown Boston.

name: massachusetts
sentence: It connects areas once divided by an elevated highway (a good part of the old raised central artery has been replaced by the Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy Greenway), and improves traffic conditions as well as several itineraries.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Kennedy family played a prominent role in Massachusetts politics in the 20th century.

Kennedy, who was a senator, Attorney General of the United States and a presidential candidate prior to his assassination in 1968, Ted Kennedy, a senator from 1962 to his death in 2009, and Eunice Kennedy Shriver, co-founder of the Special Olympics.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 1966, Massachusetts became the first state to directly elect an African-American to the U.S. Senate with Edward Brooke.

name: massachusetts
sentence: George H W Bush, 41st president of the United States (1989-1993) was born in Milton in 1924.

name: massachusetts
sentence: John W. McCormack, Speaker of the House in the 1960s, and Tip O'Neill, whose position as Speaker of the House from 1977 to 1987 was the longest continuous term in the history of the United States, are other prominent Bay State politicians at the national level.

name: massachusetts
sentence: On 17 May 2004, Massachusetts became the first state in the United States to legalize same-sex marriage after the Supreme Court of Massachusetts ruled in November 2003 that the exclusion of same-sex couples from the right to civil marriage was unconstitutional.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This decision was eventually replaced by the U.S. Supreme Court's statement on same-sex marriage in the U.S. in 2015.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2004, Massachusetts Senator John Kerry, who won the democratic appointment as President of the United States, was slightly lost by George W. Bush.

sentence: Eight years later, the former Governor of Massachusetts Mitt Romney (designated by the Republic) lost to Barack Obama in 2012.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Eight years later, Massachusetts senator Elizabeth Warren played a leading role in the democratic primaries for the 2020 presidential election, but suspended her campaign and then approved the alleged candidate Joe Biden.

sentence: Two pressure cooker bombs exploded near the Boston Marathon finish line on April 15, 2013, at approximately 1449 EDT.

sentence: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) later identified the suspects as brothers Dzhokhar Tsarnaev and Tamerlan Tsarnaev.

sentence: Dzhokhar later declared that he was motivated by Islamic extremist beliefs and learned to build explosive devices from Inspire, Al-Qaeda's online magazine on the Arabian peninsula.
