sentence: It was included in the U.S. presidential election 2016 in Massachusetts as an indirectly initiated state law.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is the seventh smallest state in the United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: It is located in the New England region of the northeastern United States and has an area of 10,555 square miles (27,340 km2) of which 25.7% is water.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Several large bays distinctively shape its coast.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Boston is the largest city at the end of Massachusetts Bay, and the mouth of the Charles River.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Despite its small size, Massachusetts has many distinctive topographical areas.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The great coastal plain of the Atlantic Ocean in the eastern part of the state contains the Greater Boston, as well as most of the population of the state, as well as the distinctive Cape Cod Peninsula.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To the west is the hilly and rural area of central Massachusetts, and beyond, the Connecticut River Valley.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Along the western border of Western Massachusetts is the highest part of the state, the Berkshires.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The U.S. National Park Service administers a number of natural and historic sites in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition to twelve national historic sites, regions and corridors, the National Parks Service also manages the national marine coastline of Cape Cod and the Boston Harbor Islands National Recreation Area.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition, the Ministry of Conservation and Recreation maintains a number of parks, trails and beaches throughout Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Although much of Massachusetts has been cleared for agriculture, leaving only traces of old forest in isolated pockets, secondary growth has regenerating in many rural areas, with farms abandoned.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Currently, forests cover about 62 per cent of Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The areas most affected by human development include the Greater Boston area to the east and the Metropolitan Springfield area to the west, although the latter includes agricultural areas throughout the Connecticut River Valley.

name: massachusetts
sentence: There are currently 219 endangered species in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: A number of species are performing well in the increasingly urbanized Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Peregrine falcons use office towers in large cities as nesting areas, and the population of coyotes, whose diet can include garbage and road accidents, has increased in recent decades.

name: massachusetts
sentence: White-tailed deer, raccoons, wild turkeys, and eastern grey squirrels are also found throughout Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In the more rural areas of western Massachusetts, large mammals such as moose and black bears have returned, largely as a result of reforestation as a result of the regional decline in agriculture.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is located along the Atlantic Flyway, an important route for migratory waterfowl along the east coast.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The lakes in central Massachusetts provide habitat for many species of fish and waterfowl, but some species such as common loons become rare.

name: massachusetts
sentence: A large population of long-tailed ducks winter off Nantucket.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Small offshore islands and beaches are home to flourishing terns and are important breeding grounds for the locally threatened pipeline plover.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Protected areas such as the Monomoy National Wildlife Sanctuary provide critical breeding habitat for shorebirds and a variety of marine wildlife, including a large population of grey seals.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Since 2009, the number of Great White Sharks spotted and marked in coastal waters off Cape Cod has increased significantly.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Freshwater fish species in Massachusetts include bass, carp, catfish, and trout, while saltwater species such as Atlantic cod, haddock, and American lobster inhabit offshore waters.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other marine species include harbour seals, endangered North Atlantic right whales, humpback whales, fin whales, communal whales and white-sided Atlantic dolphins.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Corn borer, a major agricultural pest, was first found in North America near Boston, Massachusetts, in 1917.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Most Massachusetts has a damp continental climate, with cold winters and warm summers.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The coastal areas of the extreme southeast constitute the vast transition zone to wet subtropical climates.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Hot to hot summers make the ocean climate rare in this transition, applying only to exposed coastal areas such as Barnstable County Peninsula.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Boston climate is fairly representative for the commonwealth, characterized by summer peaks of about 81°F (27°C) and winter peaks of 35°F (2°C), and is fairly humid.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Frosts are common throughout the winter, even in coastal areas due to prevailing internal winds.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Because of its location near the Atlantic, Massachusetts is not vulnerable to eastern residents, hurricanes and tropical storms.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Climate change in Massachusetts will affect urban and rural environments, including forestry, fishing, agriculture and coastal development.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The northeast is expected to warm faster than the world average; by 2035, the northeast is expected to be warmer on average at more than 3.6°F (2°C) than in the pre-industrial era.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In August 2016, EPA reported that Massachusetts warmed up by more than two degrees Fahrenheit, or 1.1 degrees Celsius.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This is almost double the average of the United States contiguous.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The change in temperature also results in a change in precipitation patterns and an increase in precipitation.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To this end, average precipitation in the northeastern United States increased by 10 per cent between 1895 and 2011, and the number of high precipitation events increased by 70 per cent over this period.

name: massachusetts
sentence: These increased precipitation patterns are concentrated in winter and spring.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Increased temperatures and increased precipitation will result in earlier snowmelts and drier soils during the summer months.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Climate change in Massachusetts will bring about a significant change in the built environment and ecosystems.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In Boston alone, the costs of climate change storms will result in damage of $5-100 billion.

name: massachusetts
sentence: These costs are attributable to the anticipated damage to coastal housing, the destruction of roads, and the current exposure to utilities infrastructure.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Warmer temperatures will also disrupt the migration of birds and the flowering of flora.

name: massachusetts
sentence: With these changes, deer populations are expected to increase, resulting in a decrease in the underbrush that smaller wildlife use as camouflage.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition, rising temperatures will increase the number of reported Lyme disease cases in the state.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Ticks can transmit disease once temperatures reach 45 degrees, so shorter winters will increase the transmission window.

name: massachusetts
sentence: These warmer temperatures will also increase the prevalence of mosquitoes, carrying West Nile virus.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To combat this change, the state of Massachusetts Executive Office of Energy and Environmental Affairs has set a course towards decarbonizing the state economy.

name: massachusetts
sentence: On April 22, 2020, Massachusetts Secretary of Energy and Environmental Affairs, Kathleen A. Theoharides, released a state-wide emission limit determination for 2050.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In its letter, Theoharides points out that as of 2020, the Commonwealth has suffered material damage due to climate change of over $60 billion.

name: massachusetts
sentence: To ensure that the Commonwealth does not warm up more than 1.5°C of levels before industrialization, the State will strive to achieve zero net emissions and an overall reduction in greenhouse gas emissions by 85% by 2050.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The State of Massachusetts has developed a plethora of incentives to encourage the implementation of renewable energy, household appliances and efficient domestic facilities.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Mass Save was created in collaboration with the state by Berkshire Gas, Blackstone Gas Company, Cape Light Compact, Eversource, Liberty Utilities, National Grid and Unitil to provide homeowners and tenants with incentives to renovate their homes with efficient HVAC equipment and other household appliances.

name: massachusetts
sentence: For example, up to a $100 discount can be obtained for upgrading an ENERGY STAR-certified smart or programmable thermostat.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Other appliances, such as water heaters, air conditioners, washers and dryers, as well as heat pumps, are eligible for additional rebates.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The concept of Mass Save was created in 2008 by the adoption of the Green Communities Act 2008 during Deval Patrick's term of office.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The main objective of the Green Communities Act was to reduce fossil fuel consumption in the State and to encourage the adoption of new and more efficient technologies.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Among other things, one of the results of this law was the obligation for public service program administrators to invest in energy saving, as opposed to the purchase and production of additional energy where economically possible.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In Massachusetts, eleven program administrators, including NStar, National Grid, Western Massachusetts Electric, Cape Light Compact, Till and Berkshire Gas, jointly hold the program rights, in collaboration with the Ministry of Energy Resources (DOER) and the Advisory Council on Energy Efficiency (CAEE).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Mass Save also conducts home energy assessments free of charge so that homeowners, tenants and small business owners can learn about energy efficiency home improvements and find opportunities to save money and energy.

name: massachusetts
sentence: During the home evaluation, Mass Save provides ENERGY STAR certified LED bulbs, power bands, low-flow shower heads, faucet aerators and efficient thermostats for free.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition, air leaks will be detected in the house or building and corrected, and recommendations will be made to install additional insulation to reduce the loss of heated or cooled air.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Reductions of 75% or more are available on these insulation upgrades.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Thanks to COVID-19, Mass Save is currently conducting remote assessments.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Residents can plan a remote assessment using the program's website or telephone line.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The State Income Service offers incentives for the installation of solar panels.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In addition to the federal residential renewable energy credit, residents of Massachusetts may be eligible for a tax credit of up to 15% of the project.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Once installed, tables are eligible for net measurement.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Some municipalities will offer up to $1.20 per watt, up to 50% of the system cost on photovoltaic networks of 25 kW or less.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Massachusetts Department of Energy also offers low-interest fixed-rate financing and loans to low-income residents.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The programme is expected to end on 31 December 2020.

name: massachusetts
sentence: As part of efforts by the Massachusetts Department of Energy Resources (Massachusetts Department of Energy Resources) to encourage the use of renewable energy, the MOR-EV (Massachusetts Offers Rebates for Electric Vehicles) initiative was created.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Through this incentive measure, residents may be entitled to a government incentive of up to $2,500 for the purchase or lease of an electric vehicle, or $1,500 for the purchase or lease of a plug-in hybrid vehicle.

name: massachusetts
sentence: This rebate is in addition to the U.S. Department of Energy tax credits for the purchase of electric vehicles and plug-in hybrids.

name: massachusetts
sentence: For income-eligible residents, Mass Save has partnered with Massachusetts Community Action Program organizations and LEAN (Low-Income Energy Affordability Network) to provide housing improvement assistance to residents, which will enable more efficient use of energy.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Residents may be entitled to a replacement of their heating system, insulation system, appliances and thermostats if they meet the income conditions indicated on the Mass Save website.

name: massachusetts
sentence: For residents of more than 5 family residential buildings, there are additional benefits limited by the LEAN.

name: massachusetts
sentence: If at least 50% of building residents are eligible for low income, energy efficiency improvements such as those available through Mass Save are available.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Residential structures managed by non-profit organizations, for gainful activities or housing organizations may benefit from these programs.

name: massachusetts
sentence: By the end of 2020, the Baker Administration released a roadmap on decarbonization that targets net greenhouse gas emissions by zero by 2050.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The plan foresees significant investments in offshore wind and solar energy and would require all new cars sold to be zero-emission (electrical or hydrogen-fired) by 2035.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimated that the Massachusetts population was 6,892,503 as at 1 July 2019, an increase of 5.27 per cent over the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2015, it was estimated that Massachusetts was the third most populous U.S. state, with 871.0 people per square kilometre behind New Jersey and Rhode Island.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2014, there were 1,011,811 foreign-born residents in Massachusetts, representing 15% of the population.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Most residents of Bay State live in the Boston metropolitan area, also known as Grand Boston, which includes Boston and its surrounding environment, but also extends to Grand Lowell and Worcester.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Springfield metropolitan area, also known as Grand Springfield, is also an important population centre.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Demographically, the population centre of Massachusetts is located in the city of Natick.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Like the rest of the north-eastern United States, the population of Massachusetts continued to grow in the late 20th and early 21st centuries.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is the fastest growing state in New England, and the 25th fastest growing state in the United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Population growth is largely due to a relatively high quality of life and a large system of higher education in the State.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Foreign immigration is also a factor in the population growth of the state, which means that the population of the state continues to grow from the 2010 census (especially in cities in Massachusetts where the cost of living is lower).

name: massachusetts
sentence: According to a 2005 Census Bureau study, 40 per cent of foreign immigrants came from Central or South America, and many came from Asia.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Many residents who have settled in the Grand Springfield claim Puerto Rican origin.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Many parts of Massachusetts showed relatively stable population trends between 2000 and 2010.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Exurban Boston and coastal areas experienced the fastest growth, while Berkshire County in the far west of Massachusetts and Barnstable County on Cape Cod were the only counties to lose population at the 2010 census.

name: massachusetts
sentence: By sex, 44.4% were men and 51.6% were women in 2014.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In terms of age, 79.2% were over the age of 18 and 14.8% were over the age of 65.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2014, in terms of race and ethnicity, Massachusetts was 83.2% White (73.7% non-Hispanic whites), 8.8% Black or African Americans, 0.5% Alaska Native Americans, 6.3% American Asians, <0.1% Hawaiian and other Pacific Islanders, 2.1% other races and 3.1% two or more races.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Hispanics and Latinos of all races represented 11.2% of the population.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The most populous ethnic group in the state, non-Hispanic white, rose from 95.4% in 1970 to 73.7% in 2014.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2011, non-Hispanic whites were involved in 63.6% of all births, while 36.4% of the population of Massachusetts under the age of 1 was a minority (at least one parent who was not Hispanic white).

name: massachusetts
sentence: One of the main reasons for this is that non-Hispanic whites in Massachusetts had a total fertility rate of 1.36 in 2017, the second lowest in the country after neighbouring Rhode Island.

name: massachusetts
sentence: By 1795, the population of Massachusetts was nearly 95% of English ancestry.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In the early and mid-19th centuries, immigrant groups began to arrive in large numbers in Massachusetts; first in Ireland in the 1840s; now, Irish and Irish are the largest group of ancestry in the state, with nearly 25% of the total population.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Others later arrived from Quebec, as well as places in Europe such as Italy, Portugal and Poland.

name: massachusetts
sentence: At the beginning of the 20th century, a number of African-Americans emigrated to Massachusetts, although in a slightly smaller number than many other northern states.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Later in the 20th century, immigration from Latin America increased significantly.

name: massachusetts
sentence: More than 156,000 American Chinese made their residence in Massachusetts in 2014, and Boston is hosting an expanding Chinatown that hosts Chinese-owned bus lines to and from Chinatown, Manhattan, New York.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts also has large Dominican, Puerto Rican, Haitian, Cape Verdean and Brazilian populations.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Boston's South End and Jamaica Plain are two gay villages, just like is nearby Provincetown, Massachusetts on Cape Cod.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The largest ancestry group in Massachusetts is that of the Irish (22.5 per cent of the population), who live in large numbers throughout the state, but make up more than 40 per cent of the population along the South Shore in the counties of Norfolk and Plymouth (in both counties, Irish Americans account for more than 30 per cent of the population).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Italians form the second largest ethnic group in the state (13.5%), but form a plurality only in certain suburbs north of Boston and in some Berkshire cities.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The English-Americans, the third group (11.4%) lived there for the longest time, but only form a plurality in some western cities.

name: massachusetts
sentence: French and French Canadians also make up a significant share (10.7%), with large populations in the counties of Bristol, Hampden and Worcester.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Lowell is home to the nation's second largest Cambodian community.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Massachusetts is also home to a small community of Greek Americans, who, according to the American Community Survey, 83,701 of them are scattered along the state (1.2% of the total population of the state).

name: massachusetts
sentence: There are also several Amerindian populations in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Wampanoag tribe maintains reserves in Aquinnah on Martha's Vineyard and Mashpee on Cape Cod, with a project to revive the mother tongue in progress since 1993, while Nipmuc maintains two State-recognized reserves in the central part of the State, including one in Grafton.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts has avoided many forms of racial conflict seen elsewhere in the United States, but examples such as the successful election demonstrations of the nativist (mainly anti-Catholic) know nothing in the 1850s, the controversial executions of Sacco and Vanzetti in the 1920s, and Boston's opposition to desegregation in the 1970s show that the ethnic history of Massachusetts was not completely harmonious.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The most common varieties of American English spoken in Massachusetts, with the exception of General American, are the distinct, rhotic dialect of western Massachusetts and the merged, non-rhotic dialect of eastern Massachusetts (called the Boston accent).

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2010, 78.93% (4,823,127) of Massachusetts residents aged 5 and over spoke English at home as their mother tongue, while 7.50% (458,256) spoke Spanish, 2.97% (181,437) Portuguese, 1.59% (96,690) Chinese (which includes Cantonese and Mandarin), 1.11% (67,788) French, 0.89% (54,456) French Creole, 0.72% (43,798) Italian, 0.62% (37,865) Russian and Vietnamese were spoken as their primary language by 0.58% (35,283) of the population over 5.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In total, 21.07 per cent (1,287,419) of the population aged 5 and over in Massachusetts spoke a mother tongue other than English.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts was founded and established by the Crownist Puritans in 1620 and shortly thereafter by other groups of separatists/dissidents, non-conformists and independents of 17th century England.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Today, the majority of the people in Massachusetts remain Christians.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The descendants of the Puritans belong to many different churches; in the direct line of the inheritance are the various Congregational Churches, the United Church of Christ and the Congregations of the Universalist Unitarian Association.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The headquarters of the Unitarian Universalist Association, long located on Beacon Hill, is now located in the south of Boston.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Many Puritan descendants have also dispersed to other Protestant denominations.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Some are disaffiliated with Roman Catholics and other Christian groups following modern secularization.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Today, Christians make up 57 per cent of the population of the State, and Protestants 21 per cent of them.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Roman Catholics account for 34% and predominate today because of massive immigration mainly from Catholic countries and regions, mainly Ireland, Italy, Poland, Portugal, Quebec and Latin America.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Roman Protestant and Roman Catholic communities have been in decline since the end of the 20th century, due to the increase in unreligion in New England.

name: massachusetts
sentence: It is the most irreligious region in the country, with the Western United States.

name: massachusetts
sentence: A large Jewish population immigrated to the Boston and Springfield regions between 1880 and 1920.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Jews currently make up 3% of the population.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Mary Baker Eddy made the Boston Mother Church of Christian Science the world headquarters of this new religious movement.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Buddhists, pagans, Hindus, Seventh-day Adventists, Muslims and Mormons can also be found.

name: massachusetts
sentence: The Kripalu Centre in Stockbridge, the Shaolin Meditation Temple in Springfield and the Insight Meditation Centre in Barre are examples of non-abramic religious centers in Massachusetts.

name: massachusetts
sentence: According to 2010 data from the Association of Religion Data Archives (ARDA), the largest single denominations are the Catholic Church with 2,940,199 members, the United Church of Christ with 86,639 members and the Episcopal Church with 81,999 members.

name: massachusetts
sentence: 32% of the population identifies as having no religion.

name: massachusetts
sentence: In 2018, Massachusetts' general education system was ranked first among the 50 US states by US News & World Report.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts was the first state in North America to require municipalities to appoint a teacher or establish a secondary school with the passage of the Massachusetts Education Act of 1647, and the 19th-century reforms initiated by Horace Mann laid much of the foundation for contemporary universal public education, which was established in 1852.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts is home to the oldest permanent school in North America (the Roxbury Latin School, founded in 1645), as well as the oldest public primary school in the country (the Mather School, founded in 1639), its oldest secondary school (Boston Latin School, founded in 1635), its oldest continuing boarding school (the Governor's Academy, founded in 1763), its oldest college (Harvard University, founded in 1636), and its oldest women's college (Mont Holyoke College, founded in 1837).

name: massachusetts
sentence: Massachusetts also houses the highest private high school in the United States, Phillips Academy in Andover, Massachusetts, which was founded in 1778.

name: massachusetts
sentence: Public spending per student in Massachusetts for primary and secondary schools was eighth in the country in 2012, at $14,844.

name: massachusetts

sentence: Michigan has the second longest shore of any state – 3,288 miles (5,292 km), including 1,056 miles (1,699 km) of island shoreline.

name: michigan
sentence: The state has many large islands, the main of which are North Manitou and South Manitou, Beaver and Fox in Lake Michigan; Royal Island and Grande Isle in Lake Superior; Marquette, White Wood and Mackinac Islands in Lake Huron; and Neebish, Sugar and Drummond Islands in the St. Mary's River.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan has approximately 150 lighthouses, the largest number of U.S. states.

name: michigan
sentence: The first Michigan lighthouses were built between 1818 and 1822.

sentence: See lighthouses in the United States.

name: michigan
sentence: The state rivers are generally small, short and shallow and poorly navigable.

name: michigan
sentence: The main rivers are the Detroit River, the St. Marys River and the St. Clair River, which connect the Great Lakes; the Au Sable River, Cheboygan and Saginaw, which flow through Lake Huron; the Ontonagon and the Tahquamenon River, which flow through Lake Superior; and the St. Joseph, Kalamazoo, Grand, Muskegon, Manistee and Escanaba River, which flow through Lake Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: There are 11,037 inland lakes, representing a total of 1,305 square miles (3,380 km2) of inland waters, in addition to 38,575 square miles (99,910 km2) of Great Lakes waters.

name: michigan
sentence: In Michigan, no point is located more than six miles (9.7 km) from an indoor lake or more than 85 miles (137 km) from one of the Great Lakes.

name: michigan
sentence: The state is home to several areas maintained by the National Parks Service, including Île Royale National Park in Lake Superior, approximately 48 km southeast of Thunder Bay, Ontario.

name: michigan
sentence: Other national protected areas include Keweenaw National Historic Park, illustrated Rocks National Side Lake, Sleeping Dunes National Side Lake, Huron National Forest, Manist National Forest, Hiawatha National Forest, Ottawa National Forest, and Father Marquette National Memorial.

name: michigan
sentence: The largest stretch of the northern country's national scenography trail crosses Michigan.

name: michigan
sentence: With 78 state parks, 19 state recreation areas and six state forests, Michigan has the largest state park and state forestry system in any state.

name: michigan
sentence: These parks and forests include Holland State Park, Mackinac Island State Park, Sable State Forest and Mackinaw State Forest.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan has a continental climate, although there are two distinct areas.

name: michigan
sentence: The southern and central parts of the Lower Peninsula (south of Saginaw Bay and the Grand Rapids region to the south) have a warmer climate (Köppen Dfa climate classification) with warm summers and cold winters.

name: michigan
sentence: The northern part of the Lower Peninsula and the entire Upper Peninsula has a more severe climate (Köppen Dfb), with hot summers, but shorter and longer, cold to very cold winters.

name: michigan
sentence: Some of the average state temperatures are below freezing from December to February and until early March in the northern areas.

name: michigan
sentence: During winter until mid-February, the state is often subjected to heavy lake-effect snow.

name: michigan
sentence: The average condition ranges from 30 to 40 inches (76 to 102 cm) of precipitation per year; however, some areas of the lower north and upper peninsula have an average of almost 160 inches (4,100 mm) of snowfall per year.

name: michigan
sentence: The highest recorded temperature in Michigan was 112°F (44°C) at Mio on July 13, 1936, and the coldest recorded temperature was −51°F (−46°C) at Vanderbilt on February 9, 1934.

name: michigan
sentence: The state has an average of 30 days of stormy activity per year.

name: michigan
sentence: These may be severe, especially in the southern part of the State.

name: michigan
sentence: The State has an average of 17 tornadoes per year, which are more frequent in the extreme south of the state.

name: michigan
sentence: Portions of the southern border have been almost as vulnerable historically as states to the west and in the aisle of Tornado.

name: michigan
sentence: For this reason, many communities in the very southern regions of the State have tornado sirens to warn residents of the tornado approach.

name: michigan
sentence: Further north, in central Michigan, northern Michigan, and the upper peninsula, tornadoes are rare.

name: michigan
sentence: The state's geological formation is very varied, with the Michigan Basin being the most important formation.

name: michigan
sentence: Primary blocks are found throughout the upper peninsula (mainly of primitive origin), while secondary deposits cover the entire lower peninsula.

name: michigan
sentence: The upper peninsula has lower Silurian sandstones, limestone, copper, and iron-bearing rocks, corresponding to Canada's Huron system.

name: michigan
sentence: The central part of the Lower Peninsula contains coal and rock measurements from the Pennsylvanian period.

name: michigan
sentence: Devonian and sub-carboniferous deposits are dispersed throughout the state.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan rarely experiences earthquakes, so far mostly smaller earthquakes that do not cause significant damage.

sentence: An earthquake of 4.6 magnitude hit in August 1947.

name: michigan
sentence: According to Governor Rick Snyder's office, no major injuries or injuries have been reported.

sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that Michigan's population was 9,986,857 as at 1 July 2019, an increase of 1.04 per cent compared to 9,883,635 registered at the 2010 U.S. Census.

sentence: The Roman Catholic Church has six dioceses and one archdiocese in Michigan; Gaylord, Grand Rapids, Kalamazoo, Lansing, Marquette, Saginaw and Detroit.

sentence: Michigan's personal income tax is a flat rate of 4.25%.

name: michigan
sentence: Michigan's sales tax is 6%, although items such as food and medicines are exempt.

name: michigan
sentence: Property taxes are assessed at the local level, but the local assessment of each owner contributes to the state's education tax at six factories ($6 per $1,000).

name: michigan

name: michigan

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire is a state in the northeastern part of the United States, located in the New England area.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: It is bordered by Massachusetts in the south, Vermont in the west, Maine and the Atlantic Ocean in the east, and the Canadian province of Quebec in the north.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire is the 5th smallest by region and the 10th least populated state of the United States.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Concord is the capital of the State, while Manchester is the largest city.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire has no general sales tax, or income tax other than interest and dividends.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The New Hampshire primary is the first primary in the U.S. presidential election cycle.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Its license plates bear the motto of the state, "Live Free or Die".

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The state nickname "The Granite State" refers to its extensive granite formations and quarries.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In January 1776 it became the first colony in British North America to establish a government independent of the authority of the Kingdom of Great Britain; it was the first to establish its own state constitution.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Six months later, it became one of the first 13 colonies that signed the United States Declaration of Independence, and in June 1788 it was the ninth state to ratify the United States Constitution, bringing it into force.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Historically, New Hampshire was a major centre for textile, footwear and paper manufacturing, with Amoskeag Manufacturing Company in Manchester at one point being the largest textile cotton factory in the world.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Many mills were located along various rivers in the state, especially the Merrimack and Connecticut rivers.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Many French Canadians migrated to New Hampshire to work the mills in the late 19th and early 20th centuries; New Hampshire still ranks second among the states by the percentage of people claiming French American ancestry, with 24.5% of the state identifying itself as such.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Manufacturing centres such as Manchester, Nashua and Berlin were hit hard in the 1930s-1940s as large manufacturing industries left New England and settled in the southern United States or abroad, reflecting national trends.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In the 1950s and 1960s, defence contractors moved into many old mills, such as Sanders Associates in Nashua; the population of southern New Hampshire increased from the 1980s as major highways connecting the area to Greater Boston and established several sleeping communities in the state.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: With some of the highest ski mountains on the East Coast, New Hampshire's major recreational attractions include skiing, snowmobiles and other winter sports, hiking and mountaineering (Monadnock Mountain in the southwest corner of the state is one of the most climbing mountains in the United States), autumn foliage observation, summer cottages along many lakes and the sea coast, motorsports at the New Hampshire Motor Speedway, and Moto Week, a popular motorcycle rally that took place in Weirs Beach in June in Laconia.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The White Mountain National Forest connects the Vermont and Maine portions of the Appalachian Trail and has the automatic Mount Washington Road, where visitors can drive to the 1,917-metre peak of Mount Washington.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The State was named after the southern English county of Hampshire by Captain John Mason.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire is part of the New England area.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: It is bounded by Quebec, Canada, north and northwest, Maine and the Atlantic Ocean to the east, Massachusetts to the south, and Vermont to the west.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The main areas of New Hampshire are the Northern Great Woods, the White Mountains, the Lakes Region, the Seacoast, the Merrimack Valley, the Monadnock Region, and the Dartmouth-Lake Sunapee Region.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire has the shortest oceanic coastline of an American coastal state, 29 km long, sometimes only 33 km long.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The range of the White Mountains in New Hampshire extends across the north-central part of the state.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The range includes Mount Washington, the highest in the northeastern United States – the site of the highest second wind speed ever recorded – as well as Mount Adams and Mount Jefferson.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: With strong winds of hurricanes every three days on average, more than a hundred deaths recorded among visitors, and visible krumholtz (dwarfs, matt trees like a bonsai carpet), the climate on the upper sections of Mount Washington inspired the meteorological observatory on the summit to pretend that the area has the "World's Pire Weather".

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The White Mountains housed the rock formation known as the Old Man of the Mountain, a profile similar to Franconia Notch, until the disintegration of the formation in May 2003.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Even after its loss, the old man remains a lasting symbol for the state, seen on state highway signs, car registration plates, and many governmental and private entities around New Hampshire.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In the southwestern corner of New Hampshire, Mount Monadnock gave its name to a class of earth forms — a monadnock — indicating, in geomorphology, any isolated, resistant peak that rises from a less resilient eroded plain.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The major rivers include the Merrimack River (177 km), which crosses the lower half of the north-south state before passing through Massachusetts and reaching the sea at Newburyport.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Its tributaries include the Contoocook River, the Pemigewasset River, and the Winnipesaukee River.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The 660 km-long Connecticut River, which begins at Connecticut Lakes in New Hampshire and flows south to Connecticut, defines the western boundary with Vermont.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The state border is not at the centre of this river, as is usually the case, but at the low line on the Vermont side; that is, the entire river along the Vermont border (reserving areas where water levels have been raised by dams) is located in New Hampshire.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Only one city, Pittsburg, shares a land border with the state of Vermont.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Connecticut's "northwestmost sources" also define the portion of Canada-U.S.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: It's a border.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The Piscataqua River and its several tributaries form the only important ocean port in the state where they discharge into the Atlantic at Portsmouth.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The Salmon Falls River and Piscataqua define the southern portion of the border with Maine.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The border of the Piscataqua River was the subject of a border dispute between New Hampshire and Maine in 2001, with New Hampshire claiming domination over several islands (mainly Seavey Island) including the Portsmouth shipyard.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The United States Supreme Court rejected the case in 2002, leaving the island property in Maine.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: However, New Hampshire continues to claim the sovereignty of the base.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The largest lake in New Hampshire is Winnipesaukee Lake, which covers 71 square miles (184 km2) in the eastern central part of New Hampshire.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Umbagog Lake along the Maine border, approximately 12.3 square miles (31.9 km2) is a second remote lake.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Squam Lake is the second largest lake entirely situated in New Hampshire.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire has the shortest ocean coast of all states in the United States, about 29 km long.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Hampton Beach is a popular local summer resort.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: About 11 km offshore are the islands of Shoals, nine small islands (including four in New Hampshire) known as the site of a 19th-century art colony founded by poet Celia Thaxter, and the presumed location of one of the buried treasures of Black Barbe pirate.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: It is the state with the highest percentage of wooded land in the country.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire is found in the temperate biome of hardwoods and mixed forests.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Much of the state, especially the White Mountains, is covered by conifers and northern deciduous forests of New England and Acadia.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The southeast corner of the state and parts of the Connecticut River along the Vermont border are covered by mixed oaks from the northeast coastal forests.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The many forests of the state are popular among the pawns of autumn leaves in search of the bright foliage of the many deciduous trees.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The northern third of the state is locally referred to as the "northern country" or "northern notches", with reference to White Mountain Passes as canal traffic.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: It contains less than 5 per cent of the population of the State, suffers from relatively high poverty and is constantly losing its population as the logging and paper industries decline.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: However, the tourism industry, especially visitors to northern New Hampshire for skiing, snowboarding, hiking and mountain biking, has helped offset the economic losses caused by plant closures.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The duration of the winter season is expected to decrease in the New Hampshire ski resorts due to the effects of global warming, which is likely to continue the historical contraction and consolidation of the ski industry and threaten ski companies and communities dependent on ski tourism.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire has a humid continental climate (climate classification of Köppen Dfa in some areas of the south, Dfb in most states, and subarctic Dfc in some areas of the north of the highlands), with warm and humid summers and long, cold and snowy winters.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Precipitation is fairly evenly distributed all year round.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The climate in the southeast is moderated by the Atlantic Ocean and the winter average is relatively milder (for New Hampshire), while the northern and inner parts have colder temperatures and lower humidity.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Winters are cold and snowy throughout the state, and particularly severe in northern and mountainous areas.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Average annual snowfall varies from 60 inches (150 cm) to more than 100 inches (250 cm) across the state.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The average diurnal peaks were between the mid-1970s and the lower 1980s (24–28 °C) in the state as a whole in July, with nocturnal lows between the mid-50s and the lower 1960s (13–15 °C).

name: new_hampshire
sentence: January temperatures range from an average altitude of 34°F (1°C) on the coast to minimum night temperatures below 0°F (−18°C) in the extreme north and to high altitudes.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Average annual precipitation at the state level is approximately 40 inches (100 cm) and some variations occur in the white mountains due to differences in altitude and annual snowfall.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The highest recorded temperature in New Hampshire was 106°F (41°C) at Nashua on 4 July 1911, while the lowest recorded temperature was −47°F (−44°C) at the top of Mount Washington on 29 January 1934.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Mount Washington also saw an unofficial reading of -50°F (−46°C) on January 22, 1885, which, if made official, would bind the historic record of New England (also -50°F (−46°C) to Big Black River, Maine, on January 16, 2009, and Bloomfield, Vermont, on December 30, 1933).

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Extreme snow is often associated with a nor'easter, such as the 78's Blizzard and the 1993 Blizzard, when several feet accumulate on portions of the state for 24 to 48 hours.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Lighter snowfalls of several inches frequently occur throughout the winter, often associated with a brush from Alberta.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Occasionally, New Hampshire is affected by hurricanes and tropical storms, although when they reach the state, they are often extratropical, with most storms on the southern coast of New England moving inward or offshore in the Gulf of Maine.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire has an average of less than 20 storm days per year and two tornadoes occur every year throughout the state.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The map of the hardiness zones of the National Arbor Day Foundation illustrates areas 3, 4, 5 and 6 throughout the state and indicates the shift from a relatively cooler climate to a warmer climate when crossing New Hampshire southward.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The hardiness zones of USDA plants for New Hampshire in 1990 ranged from zone 3b to zone 5b to the south.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The metropolitan areas of the New England region are defined by the United States Census Bureau as New England City and Town Areas (NEECTAs).

sentence: Various Algonquian Abenaki tribes, largely divided between the Androscoggin and Pennacook nations, lived in the region before European colonization.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Despite the same language, they had a very different culture and religion from the other Algonquian peoples.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: English and French explorers visited New Hampshire from 1600 to 1605 and David Thompson settled at Odiorne's Point in 1623.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The first permanent establishment was in Hilton's Point (now Dover).

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In 1631, the High Plantation now included Dover, Durham and Stratham; in 1679, it became the "Royal Province".

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Father Rale's war was fought between the settlers and the Wabanaki Confederation throughout New Hampshire.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire was one of thirteen colonies that rebelled against British rule during the American Revolution.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: At the time of the American revolution, New Hampshire was a divided province.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The economic and social life of the Seacoast region is based on sawmills, shipyards, commercial warehouses and established urban centres.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Fortune merchants have built important houses, provided them with the best luxuries and invested their capital in trade and land speculation.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: At the other end of the social scale, there developed a permanent class of day labourers, sailors, contract servants and even slaves.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The only battle in New Hampshire was the raid on Fort William and Mary on 14 Dec. 1774 at Portsmouth Harbor, which defeated the rebellion in considerable quantities of powder, light weapons and cannons.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: (General Sullivan, head of the attack, described him as "remarking powder, small arms, bayonets and canisters, as well as cannons and ammunition" during two nights.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: This raid was preceded by a warning to the local patriots the day before, by Paul Revere on December 13, 1774, that the fort was to be reinforced by troops sailing from Boston.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: According to unverified accounts, gunpowder was then used at the Battle of Bunker Hill, which was carried there by Major Demerit, one of the many patriots in New Hampshire who stored the powder in their houses until it was transported elsewhere for use in revolutionary activities.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: During the raid, British soldiers fired at the rebels with cannons and muskets.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Although there were apparently no casualties, they were among the first shots in the period of the American Revolution, which took place about five months before the battles of Lexington and Concord.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The Constitution of the United States was ratified by New Hampshire on 21 June 1788, when New Hampshire became the ninth state to do so.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire was a Jacksonian bastion.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Industrialization takes the form of numerous textile factories that, in turn, attract large flows of immigrants from Quebec (the "French Canadians") and Ireland.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The northern parts of the State produced lumber, and the mountains provided tourist attractions.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: After 1960, the textile industry collapsed, but the economy recovered as a high-tech centre and service provider.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Starting in 1952, New Hampshire attracted national and international attention for its presidential primary at the beginning of each presidential election year.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: It immediately became the most important test ground for candidates for republican and democratic appointments.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The media gave New Hampshire and Iowa about half of the attention given to all states in the primary process, magnifying the decision-making powers of the state and encouraging repeated efforts by non-state politicians to change the rules.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that the population of New Hampshire was 1,359,711 on July 1, 2019, an increase of 3.28% from the 2010 U.S. Census.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The population centre of New Hampshire is in Merrimack County, Pembroke.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The centre of the population has moved south of 19 km since 1950, reflecting the fact that the fastest growth in the state has been along its southern border, which lies within the Boston and other cities of Massachusetts.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The most densely populated areas are generally less than 80 km from the Massachusetts border and are concentrated in two areas: along the Merrimack valley from Concord to Nashua, and in the sea area along an axis from Rochester to Portsmouth.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Outside these two regions, only one community, the town of Keene, has more than 20,000 inhabitants.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The four counties that cover these two regions represent 72 per cent of the population of the State, and one (Hillsborough) represents nearly 30 per cent of the population of the State, as well as the two most populated communities, Manchester and Nashua.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The northern part of the state is very sparsely populated: the largest county per region, Coos, covers the northern quarter of the state and has only about 31,000 inhabitants, about one third of whom live in a single community (Berlin).

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Trends over the past few decades have been for the population to move south, as many northern communities do not have the economic base to maintain their population, while southern communities have been absorbed by Greater Boston.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: As of the 2010 census, the population of New Hampshire was 1,316,470.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The gender composition of the Government was 49.3 per cent for men and 50.7 per cent for women.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: 21.8% of the population was under 18 years of age.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The racial composition of New Hampshire in the 2010 census was as follows:

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Hispanics or Latinos of all races accounted for 2.8 per cent of the population in 2010: 0.6 per cent were Mexican, 0.9 per cent Puerto Rican, 0.1 per cent Cuban and 1.2 per cent from other Hispanic and Latin backgrounds.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: According to the American Community Survey 2012–2017, the largest ancestry groups in the state were Irish (20.6%), English (16.5%), French (14.0%), Italian (10.4%), German (9.1%), Canadian French (8.9%) and American (4.8%).

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire has the highest percentage (22.9%) of French, French-Canadian and Acadian residents in any U.S. state.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: According to estimates from the American Community Survey of the Census Bureau from 2017, 2.1% of the population aged 5 years and older speak Spanish at home, while 1.8% speak French.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In Coos County, 9.6 per cent of the population speaks French at home, down from 16 per cent in 2000.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Note: The percentages in the table do not add up to 100, because Hispanics are counted both by ethnicity and race, resulting in a higher overall number.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: A Pew survey showed that the religious affiliations of New Hampshire residents were: Protestants 30%, Catholics 26%, LDS (Mormon) 1%, Jews 1%, Jehovah's Witnesses 2% and non-religious 36%.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: A survey suggests that people in New Hampshire and Vermont are less likely than other Americans to attend weekly services and only 54% say they are "absolutely certain that there is a God" versus 71% in the rest of the nation.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire and Vermont are also at the lowest levels among the states in religious engagement.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In 2012, 23% of New Hampshire residents in a Gallup poll considered themselves "very religious," while 52% considered themselves "non-religious".

name: new_hampshire
sentence: According to the Association of Religion Data Archives (ARDA), the largest denominations are the Catholic Church with 311,028 members; the United Church of Christ with 26,321 members; and the United Methodist Church with 18,029 members.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In 2016, a Gallup Poll found that New Hampshire was the least religious in the United States.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Only 20% of New Hampshire respondents rated themselves as "very religious", while the national average was 40%.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The Bureau of Economic Analysis estimates that New Hampshire's total revenue in 2018 was $86 billion, ranking 40th in the United States.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The median household income for 2017 was $74,801, the fourth highest in the country (including Washington, DC).

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Its agricultural production is dairy products, nurseries, cattle, apples and eggs.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Its industrial products are machines, electrical equipment, rubber and plastic products, and tourism is a major component of the economy.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire experienced a major change in its economic base during the 20th century.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Historically, the base was made up of New England's traditional textiles, footwear manufacturing and small machine shops, taking advantage of low-wage labour from nearby small farms and Quebec regions.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Today, of the total value of the state's manufacturing dollar, these sectors contribute only two per cent to textiles, two per cent to leather goods and nine per cent to machining.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: They have experienced a sharp decline due to obsolete plants and the attractiveness of cheaper wages in the southern United States.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire today has a broad and growing economy, with a state GDP growth rate of 2.2% in 2018.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The government's main economic sectors in 2018, based on its contribution to GDP, are: 15% of real estate and leasing; 13% of professional business services; 12% of manufacturing industry; 10% of government and government services; and 9% of health and social services.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The Government budget for 2018 was $5.97 billion, including $1.79 billion in federal funds.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The question of taxation is controversial in New Hampshire, which has a property tax (under municipal control) but no sales tax or income tax.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The State has tighter taxes on meals, accommodation, vehicles, business and investment income, and tolls on state roads.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: According to the Energy Information Administration, New Hampshire's energy use and per capita energy consumption are among the lowest in the country.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The Seabrook nuclear power plant near Portsmouth is the largest nuclear reactor in New England and supplied 57% of New Hampshire's electricity generation and 27% of its electricity consumption in 2017.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In 2016 and 2017, New Hampshire obtained more wind power generation than coal-fired power plants.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Approximately 32% of New Hampshire's electricity consumption comes from renewable resources (including nuclear, hydro, wind and other renewable resources).

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire was a net exporter of electricity, exporting 63 trillion UK thermal units (18 TWh).

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire's residential electricity consumption is low compared to the national average, partly because demand for air conditioning is low during the generally mild summer months and because few households use electricity as a primary energy source for domestic heating.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Nearly half of New Hampshire's households use fuel oil for winter heating, which is one of the largest shares in the United States.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire has potential for renewable energy such as wind, hydro and firewood.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The State does not have a general sales tax or personal income tax (the State tax, at a rate of 5%, income from dividends and interest), and the legislator has exercised tax restrictions.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Efforts are under way to diversify the general economy of the state.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The lack of a general tax system in New Hampshire has led local government authorities to have some of the country's highest property taxes.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: However, the overall tax burden of the State is relatively low; in 2010, New Hampshire ranked 44th among the states for the combined average tax burden of states and local authorities.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: As of February 2010, the state unemployment rate was 7.1 per cent.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In October 2010, the unemployment rate had fallen to 5.4 per cent.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The seasonal (preliminary) unemployment rate in April 2019 was 2.4% based on a civilian workforce of 767,500 people, with 749,000 employed.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire's workforce is 90 per cent in non-agricultural employment, 18 per cent in trade, transport and public services, 17 per cent in education and health care, 12 per cent in government, 11 per cent in professional and commercial services, and 10 per cent in leisure and hospitality.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: According to a 2013 study by Phoenix Marketing International, New Hampshire had the eighth highest percentage of millionaire households in the United States, accounting for 6.48% of all households.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In 2013, New Hampshire also had the lowest poverty rate in the country, at only 8.7% of all residents, according to the Census Bureau.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In March 2018, 86% of New Hampshire's workforce was employed by the private sector, with 53% employed by companies with less than 100 employees.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: About 14% of private sector employees are employed by companies with more than 1,000 employees.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: According to the Community Surveys of the NH Labour Market and Employment Security Information Bureau, the most important private employers in the State are:

sentence: The New Hampshire government employs about 6,100 people.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In addition, the United States Department of State employs approximately 1,600 people at the Portsmouth National Visa Centre, which processes immigration visa applications from the United States.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The Governor of New Hampshire, since 5 January 2017, is Chris Sununu (Republic).

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The two American senators from New Hampshire are Jeanne Shaheen and Maggie Hassan (the two Democrats), both former governors.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The two U.S. representatives of New Hampshire in January 2019 are Chris Pappas and Ann McLane Kuster (the two Democrats).

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire is a state that controls alcoholic beverages and, through the State Alcohol Board, takes $100 million from the sale and distribution of alcohol.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire is the only state in the United States that does not require adults to wear safety belts in their vehicles.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: It is one of the three States that do not have a mandatory helmet law.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The Constitution of the State of New Hampshire of 1783 is the supreme law of the State, followed by the revised Annotated New Hampshire Statutes and the New Hampshire Code of Administrative Rules.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: They are similar to the U.S. Federal Constitution, the U.S. Code and the Code of Federal Regulations, respectively.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire has a bifurcated executive power, composed of the governor and a five-member executive council that votes on government contracts worth more than $5,000 and "advises and consents" to the governor's appointments to important state positions such as department heads, all judicial functions and all requests for pardons.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire does not have a Lieutenant Governor; the Speaker acts as an "interim Governor" whenever the Governor is unable to perform his or her duties.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The legislator is referred to as the Tribunal.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: It is composed of the House of Representatives and the Senator.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: There are 400 representatives, making them one of the largest elected bodies in the English-speaking world, and 24 senators.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Legislators receive a nominal salary of $200 per year, the lowest salary in the United States by far, so that most are indeed volunteers, nearly half of whom are retirees.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: (For more details, see the article on the New Hampshire Government.)

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The only State Court of Appeal is the Supreme Court of New Hampshire.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The Superior Court is the court of general jurisdiction and the only court which provides for the trial of jurors in civil or criminal cases.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The other state courts are the Probation Court, the District Court and the Family Division.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: There are 10 counties and 234 cities in New Hampshire.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire is a "Dillon Rule" state, meaning that the state retains all powers that are not specifically granted to municipalities.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Despite this, the legislator is strongly in favour of local control, particularly with regard to land use regulations.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The municipalities of New Hampshire are classified as cities, which differ mainly in form of government.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Most cities usually operate according to the form of government of municipal assemblies, where registered voters in the city act as the city's legislative assembly, and a selection board acts as the city's executive.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The large cities and the thirteen cities of the state operate either in the form of a council (manager or council) or in the form of a mayor.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: There is no difference, from the point of view of state government, between cities and cities outside the form of government.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: All state laws treat all municipalities in the same manner.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire has a small number of unincorporated areas known as grants, locations, purchases or cantons.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: These sites are limited to the absence of self-government, and services are generally provided by neighbouring cities or by the county or state as required.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In the 2000 census, there were 25 persons left in New Hampshire, a total population of 173 (in 2000), many of whom were completely depopulated.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: All but two of these areas are in County Coos.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The Democratic Party and the Republican Party are the two largest parties in the State.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: A plurality of electors are registered as undeclared, and can choose one or the other vote in primary school, and then regain their undeclared status after the vote.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The libertarian party had the status of an official party from 1990 to 1996.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: There is also a program known as the Free State project to transform New Hampshire into a libertarian bastion by suggesting that libertarians move there to concentrate their power.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The Libertarian Party regained access to the ballot papers after the 2016 election because the candidate for the position of governor obtained more than four per cent of the votes.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: As of 5 February 2016, there were 882,959 registered voters, of whom 389,472 (44.1%) had not declared affiliation to a political party, 262,111 (29.7%) were Republicans and 231,376 (26.2%) were Democrats.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire is internationally recognized for the primary school of New Hampshire, the first primary of the quadrennial cycle of the US presidential elections.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: State legislation requires the Secretary of State to hold this election at least one week before any "similar event".

name: new_hampshire
sentence: However, the Iowa caucus preceded the New Hampshire primary.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: This first competition, which uses the same procedure as the general election, attracts more attention than in other states, and it has been decisive in shaping the national competition.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: State law allows a city with fewer than 100 inhabitants to open its polling stations at midnight and close its offices when all registered citizens have voted.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: For example, the communities of Dixville Notch in Coos County and Hart's in Carroll County, among others, chose to apply these provisions.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Dixville Notch and Hart's Location are traditionally the first places in New Hampshire and the United States to vote in presidential primarys and elections.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Appointments for all other partisan functions are decided in separate primary elections.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In the presidential electoral cycles, this is the second primary election held in New Hampshire.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Saint Anselm College in Goffstown has become a popular campaign place for politicians as well as several national presidential debates due to its proximity to Manchester-Boston Regional Airport.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In the past, New Hampshire often voted Republican.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Between 1856 and 1988, New Hampshire voted six times for the democratic presidential post: Woodrow Wilson (twice), Franklin D. Roosevelt (three times) and Lyndon B. Johnson (one time).

name: new_hampshire
sentence: From 1992 onwards, New Hampshire became a state rotating in national and local elections and, at that time, supported the Democrats in all presidential elections, with the exception of 2000.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: It was the only state in the country to move from the support of Republican George W. Bush in the 2000 election to that of his democratic opponent in the 2004 election, when John Kerry, a senator from neighbouring Massachusetts, won the state.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The Democrats dominated the New Hampshire elections in 2006 and 2008.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In 2006, the Democrats won both seats in the Congress (elected Carol Shea-Porter in the first district and Paul Hodes in the second), re-elected Governor John Lynch, and won a majority on the Executive Council and in both chambers for the first time since 1911.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The democrats had not held both parliament and governorship since 1874.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Neither senator in the United States voted in 2006.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In 2008, the Democrats retained their majorities, their government and their seats in Congress; and former Governor Jeanne Shaheen beat outgoing Republican John E. Sununu for the U.S. senator in a retake of the 2002 competition.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The 2008 elections allowed women to hold a majority, 13 of the 24 seats, in New Hampshire Senatte, a first for any legislative body in the United States.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In the mid-term elections of 2010, the Republicans made historic gains in New Hampshire, capturing veto-proof majorities in the state's legislature, taking the five seats on the Executive Council, electing a new American senator, Kelly Ayotte, winning the two seats in the US Chamber, and reducing the margin of victory of outgoing Governor John Lynch over his 2006 and 2008 victories.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In the 2012 parliamentary elections, the Democrats took over the House of Representatives of New Hampshire and reduced the Republican majority in the New Hampshire Senate to 13-11.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In 2012, New Hampshire became the first state in U.S. history to elect a federal women's delegation: Carol Shea-Porter, Democratic Member of Parliament for Congress District 1, and Ann McLane Kuster, Member of Parliament for U.S. District 2.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Senator Jeanne Shaheen and Senator Kelly Ayotte in 2013.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In addition, the State elected its second female governor: the Democrat Maggie Hassan.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In the 2014 election, the Republicans took over the House of Representatives of New Hampshire with a majority of 239–160 and increased their majority in the New Hampshire Senate to 14 of the 24 seats in the Senate.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: At the national level, the outgoing senator, Jeanne Shaheen, defeated her Republican opponent, former Senator Scott Brown of Massachusetts.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire also elected Frank Guinta (R) as its representative from the first district of Congress and Ann Kuster (D) as its representative from the second district of Congress.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In the 2016 election, the Republicans held the House of Representatives of New Hampshire with a majority of 220 to 175, and held their 14 seats in New Hampshire Senator.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In the gibernatory race, outgoing governor Maggie Hassan was replaced by Republican Chris Sununu, who defeated Democratic candidate Colin Van Ostern.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Sununu became the first Republican state governor since Craig Benson, who left office in 2005 after John Lynch's defeat.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The Republicans control the governor's office and the two chambers of the state legislature, a trifecta of government in which the Republicans have the full power of government.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In the presidential race, the state voted for the Democratic candidate, former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton on the Republican candidate, Donald Trump, by a margin of 2,736 votes, i.e. 0.3%, one of the closest results the state has ever seen in a presidential race, while libertarian candidate Gary Johnson obtained 4.12% of the votes.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The Democrats also won a competitive race in the second district of Congress, as well as a run in the Senate.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The New Hampshire Congress delegation currently consists exclusively of democrats.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: At the 116th Congress of the United States, it is one of the only eight states with a fully democratic delegation, five of which are in New England (the others are Delaware, Hawaii and New Mexico).

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire has a well-maintained and well-signed network of interstate highways, American highways and state highways.

sentence: New Hampshire has 25 public airports, three with regular commercial passenger service.

sentence: Toll rail passenger service is provided by the Vermonter and Downeaster lines of Amtrak.

sentence: The New Hampshire Rail Transit Authority is working to expand the "Corridor Capital" service from Lowell, Massachusetts to Nashua, Concord and Manchester, including Manchester-Boston Regional Airport; and the "Corridor Coastal" service from Haverhill, Massachusetts to Plaistow, New Hampshire.

sentence: The 2007 legislation created the New Hampshire Rail Transit Authority (NHRTA) to oversee the development of suburban trains in New Hampshire.

sentence: This rail corridor would also have access to Manchester-Boston Regional Airport.

sentence: Eleven public transit authorities operate local and regional bus services around the state, and eight private carriers operate express bus services that connect the national long distance bus network.

sentence: The New Hampshire Department of Transportation operates a state-wide match-sharing service in addition to an independent and guaranteed return pairing program.

sentence: Tourist railways include the Conway Scenic Railroad, Hobo-Winnipesaukee Railroad and Mount Washington Cog Railway.

sentence: New Hampshire's freight lines include Claremont & Concord Railroad (CCRR), Pan Am Railways via its subsidiary Springfield Terminal Railway (ST), New England Central Railroad (NHR, St. Lawrence and Atlantic Railroad (SLR) and New Hampshire Northcoast Corporation (NHN).

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The first public secondary schools in the State are the secondary school for boys and the secondary school for girls in Portsmouth, established in 1827 or 1830 according to the source.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire has more than 80 public secondary schools, many of which serve more than one city.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: The largest is Pinkerton Academy in Derry, which is owned by a private not-for-profit organization and serves as a public high school in a number of nearby cities.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: There are at least 30 private high schools in the State.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire also houses prestigious preparatory university schools, such as Phillips Exeter Academy, St. Paul's School, Proctor Academy, Brewster Academy and Kimball Union Academy.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: In 2008, the state was on a par with Massachusetts as having the highest scores on the SAT and ACT standardized tests given to high school students.

sentence: The following sport teams are based in New Hampshire:

sentence: Loudon's New Hampshire Motor Speedway is an oval circuit that has been visited by national series of motorsport championships such as NASCAR Cup Series, NASCAR Xfinity Series, NASCAR Camping World Truck Series, NASCAR Wholen Modified Tour, American Canadian Tour (ACT), Champ Car and IndyCar series.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: Other racing venues include Star Speedway and New England Dragway in Epping, Lee Speedway in Lee, Twin State Speedway in Claremont, Monadnock Speedway in Winchester, and Canaan Fair Speedway in Canaan.

name: new_hampshire
sentence: New Hampshire has two NCAA Division I participating universities in all college sports: Dartmouth Big Green (Ivy League) and New Hampshire Wildcats (America East Conference), as well as three NCAA Division II teams: Franklin Pierce Ravens, Saint Anselm Hawks and Southern New Hampshire Penmen (Northeast-10 Conference).
