name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is a state in the Midwest region of the United States of America.

name: south_dakota
sentence: It bears the names of the Amerindian tribes Lakota and Dakota Sioux, which constitute a large part of the population and historically dominate the territory.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is the seventeenth largest by region, but the fifth least populated, and the fifth least dense of the 50 United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: As a southern part of the former Dakota Territory, South Dakota became a state on November 2, 1889, along with North Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: This is the 39th or 40th State admitted to union.

name: south_dakota
sentence: President Benjamin Harrison changed the state documents before signing them so that no one would know who became a state first.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Pierre is the capital of the state and Sioux Falls, with a population of about 187,200 inhabitants, is the largest city in South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is bordered by the states of North Dakota (north), Minnesota (east), Iowa (southeast), Nebraska (south), Wyoming (west) and Montana (northwest).

name: south_dakota
sentence: The state is divided by the Missouri River, dividing South Dakota into two geographically and socially distinct halves known to residents as the "East River" and the "West River".

name: south_dakota
sentence: Eastern South Dakota is home to most of the state's population, and fertile soil in the area is used to cultivate a variety of crops.

name: south_dakota
sentence: To the west of Missouri, livestock is the predominant agricultural activity, and the economy is more dependent on tourism and defence spending.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Most of the Amerindian reserves are located in the West River.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Black Hills, a group of low-covered mountains of sacred pines in the Sioux, are located in the southwestern part of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Mount Rushmore, a major tourist destination, is here.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has a temperate continental climate with four distinct seasons and moderate precipitation in the east to semi-arids in the west.

name: south_dakota
sentence: State ecology presents species typical of a biome of the North American prairies.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Humans lived in the area for several millennia, with the Sioux becoming dominant in the early 19th century.

name: south_dakota
sentence: At the end of the 19th century, Euro-American colonization intensified after a gold rush in the Black Hills and the construction of eastern railways.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The enlisted miners and settlers triggered a number of Indian wars, ending in the wounding of the knee in 1890.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The major events of the 20th century were the Dust Bowl and the Great Depression, the increase in federal spending in the 1940s and 1950s for agriculture and defence, and an industrialization of agriculture that reduced family farming.

name: south_dakota
sentence: While several Democrats have represented South Dakota for multiple terms in both chambers of Congress, the state government is largely controlled by the Republican Party, whose candidates have carried South Dakota to each of the last 13 presidential elections.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Historically dominated by an agricultural economy and a rural way of life, South Dakota has recently sought to diversify its economy in the regions to attract and retain residents.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The history and rural character of South Dakota still strongly influences the culture of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is located in the north central United States and is considered to be part of the Midwest by the United States Census Bureau and is also part of the Great Plains region.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Western South Dakota's culture, economy and geography have more in common with the West than the Midwest.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has a total area of 77 116 square miles (199730 km2), making the state the 17th largest in the Union.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Black Elk Peak, formerly Harney Peak, with an altitude of 7,242 ft (2,207 m), is the highest point in the state, while the shore of Big Stone Lake is the lowest, with an altitude of 966 ft (294 m).

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is bordered north by North Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The geographic centre of the United States is 27 km west of Castle Rock in Butte County.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The North American continental pole of inaccessibility is located between Allen and Kyle, 1024 mi (1,648 km) from the nearest coastline.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Missouri River is the largest and longest river in the United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Cheyenne, James, Big Sioux, and White rivers are other important rivers in South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The eastern South Dakota has many natural lakes, mainly created by periods of glaciation.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In addition, the Missouri River dams create four large reservoirs: Oahe Lake, Sharpe Lake, Francis Case Lake, Lewis Lake, and Clark Lake.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is generally divided into three regions: Eastern South Dakota, Western South Dakota, and Black Hills.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Missouri River serves as a boundary in terms of geographic, social, and political differences between eastern and western South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The geography of the Black Hills, long considered sacred by the Amerindians, differs from its environment to the extent that it can be considered distinct from the rest of South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Sometimes the Black Hills are combined with the rest of western South Dakota, and people often refer to the two resulting areas, divided by the Missouri River, the West River and the East River.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Eastern South Dakota generally has higher precipitation and a lower topography than the western part of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The smaller geographic areas of this region include the Prairie Coteau, the Dissolved Till Plains and the James River Valley.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Prairie Coteau is a plateau bordered to the east by the Minnesota River valley and to the west by the James River basin.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Further to the west, the James River basin is primarily low, flat, and heavily eroded land, following the flow of the James River through South Dakota from north to south.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Till Plains Dissected, an area of hilly hills and fertile soil that covers much of Iowa and Nebraska, extends in the southeast corner of South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The layers deposited during the Pleistocene period, about two million years ago, cover most of eastern South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: These are the youngest rock and sedimentary layers of the state, the product of successive periods of glaciation that have deposited a large amount of rock and soil, known as till, on the area.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Great Plains cover most of the western two-thirds of South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: To the west of Missouri, the landscape becomes more arid and more rugged, consisting of hilly hills, plains, ravines and steep flat hills called buttes.

name: south_dakota
sentence: To the south, east of the Black Hills, lies the Badlands of South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The erosion of the Black Hills, marine skeletons fallen to the bottom of a large shallow sea that once covered the area, and volcanic material all contribute to the geology of this region.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Black Hills are located in the southwest part of South Dakota and extend to Wyoming.

name: south_dakota
sentence: This range of low mountains covers 6,000 km2 (16 000 km2), with peaks increasing from 2,000 to 4,000 feet (600 to 1,200 m) above their bases.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Black Hills are the location of Black Elk Peak (7,242 ft or 2,207 m above sea level), the highest point in South Dakota, and also the highest point in the United States east of the Rocky Mountains.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The two billion-year-old precambrian formations, the oldest rocks in the state, form the central nucleus of the Black Hills.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The formations of the Paleozoic era form the outer ring of the Black Hills.

name: south_dakota
sentence: This region presents rocks like limestone, which were deposited here when the area formed the shore of an ancient inland sea.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Much of South Dakota (with the exception of the Black Hills region) is dominated by a temperate prairie biome.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Although grasses and crops cover most of this area, deciduous trees such as cottonwood, elms and willows are common near rivers and in shelter belts.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The state bird, the necklace pheasant, adapted well to the region after being introduced from China.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Growing populations of bald eagles spread throughout the state, especially near the Missouri River.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Prairie rivers and lakes are home to populations of walleye, carp, pike, bass, and other species.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Missouri River also contains the prehistoric spatula.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Due to higher elevations and precipitation levels, the ecology of Black Hills differs considerably from that of the plains.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The mountains are covered with different types of pine, including ponderosa and lodgepole pines, as well as spruce.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Black Hills mammals include deer, elk, sheep, mountain goats, pine martens and mountain lions, while rivers and lakes contain several species of trout.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has a continental climate with four distinct seasons, from cold and dry winters to warm and semi-wet summers.

name: south_dakota
sentence: During summers, the average state temperature is often close to 90°F (32°C), although it cools to almost 60°F (16°C) at night.

name: south_dakota
sentence: It is not uncommon for South Dakota to have severe warm and dry periods in summer with temperatures above 100°F (38°C) several times a year.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Winters are cold, with high January temperatures on average below freezing, and low temperatures on average below 10°F (−12°C) in most of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The highest recorded temperature was 120°F (49°C) at Usta on 15 July 2006 and the lowest recorded temperature was −58°F (−50°C) at McIntosh on 17 February 1936.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Average annual precipitation in South Dakota ranges from semi-arid conditions in the northwestern part of the state (approximately 15 inches or 380 mm) to semi-humid conditions around the southeastern part of the state (approximately 25 inches or 640 mm), although a small lead-centered area in the black hills has the highest precipitation at almost 30 inches (760 mm) per year.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The summers of South Dakota lead to frequent, sometimes severe, thunderstorms with violent winds, thunders and hail.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The eastern part of the State is often considered part of the Tornado gangway, and South Dakota suffers an average of 30 tornadoes each year.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Severe blizzards and ice storms often occur in winter.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has several sites managed by the National Parks Service.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Two national parks have been established in the state, both in the southwest region.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Wind Cave National Park, founded in 1903 in the Black Hills, has a vast network of caves and is home to a large herd of bison.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Badlands National Park was established in 1978 and has an eroded landscape with bright colours surrounded by semi-arid meadows.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Rushmore Mountain National Memorial in the Black Hills was established in 1925.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The sculpture of four American presidents was carved on the mountainside by sculptor Gutzon Borglum.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Other areas managed by the National Parks Service include Jewel Cave National Monument near Custer, Lewis and Clark National Historic Trail, Minuteman Missile National Historic Site, which includes a decommissioned nuclear missile silo and a separate missile control area several miles away, and the Missouri National Recreational River.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Crazy Horse Memorial is a large mountainside sculpture near Mount Rushmore under construction using private funds.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Mammouth site near Hot Springs is another private attraction in Black Hills.

name: south_dakota
sentence: It is a paleontological excavation of work and has one of the largest concentrations of mammoth remains in the world.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Humans have been living in what is today South Dakota for thousands of years.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The first inhabitants were Paleoindian hunter-gatherers and disappeared from the area around 5000 BC.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Between 500 and 800 AD, a semi-nomadic people known as Mound Builders lived in the centre and east of South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In the 14th century, there was the Crow Creek massacre, in which hundreds of men, women and children were killed near the Missouri River.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1500, the Arikara (or Ree) had settled in much of the Missouri valley.

name: south_dakota
sentence: European contact with the region began in 1743 when the LaVérendrye brothers explored the region.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The LaVérendrye group buried a plaque near the site of modern Pierre, claiming the region for France as part of the Greater Louisiana.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1762, the entire region was part of the Spanish Louisiana until 1802.

name: south_dakota
sentence: By the early 19th century, the Sioux had largely replaced Arikara as a dominant group in the region.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1803 the United States purchased the territory of Louisiana, a region that included most of Napoleon Bonaparte's South Dakota, and President Thomas Jefferson organized a group commonly known as the "Lewis and Clark Expedition" to explore the region.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1817, an American fur trade post was established at the present Fort Pierre, which began the continued American colonization of the area.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1855, the American army purchased Fort Pierre, but abandoned it in 1857, in favour of Fort Randall in the south.

name: south_dakota
sentence: At that time, the establishment by the Americans and Europeans increased rapidly, and in 1858 the Yankton Sioux signed the Treaty of 1858, giving to the United States most of the present South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Speculators founded two of the largest cities today in South Dakota: Sioux Falls in 1856 and Yankton in 1859.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1861, the territory of Dakota was created by the United States government (it originally included North Dakota, South Dakota and parts of Montana and Wyoming).

name: south_dakota
sentence: Colonization of the region, mainly by residents of the eastern United States and western and northern Europe, increased rapidly, especially after the completion of an eastern railway link with Yankton in 1873.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1874 gold was discovered in the Black Hills during a military expedition led by George A. Custer and miners and explorers began illegally entering the land promised to the Lakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Custer expedition took place despite the fact that the Sioux had received the entire western half of the present South Dakota (West River) in 1868 by the treaty of Laramie under the Great Reserve of Sioux.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Sioux refused to grant mining rights or land in the Black Hills, and the war broke out after the United States did not stop white miners and settlers from entering the area.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Finally, the United States won and separated the Sioux Great Reserve into five reserves, settling Lakota there.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1980, the Supreme Court and Congress ordered compensation, but the Lakota still refused to accept it, insisting on the return of their lands.

name: south_dakota
sentence: An increasing population and political concerns (the accession of two states meant the arrival of four new senators for the Republican Party) led to the division of Dakota territory and President Benjamin Harrison signed proclamations that officially admitted South Dakota and North Dakota to union on November 2, 1889.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Harrison had the papers tight to obscure which was first signed and the order was not recorded.

name: south_dakota
sentence: On December 29, 1890, the massacre of the injured knee occurred on the Pine Ridge Indian Reserve.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Considered the last major armed conflict between the United States and the Lakota Sioux nation, the massacre resulted in the death of at least 146 Sioux, many of whom were women and children.

name: south_dakota
sentence: 31 U.S. soldiers were also killed in the conflict.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In the 1930s, several economic and climate conditions combined with disastrous results for South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Lack of precipitation, extremely high temperatures and inappropriate cultivation techniques produced what was known as the Dust Bowl in South Dakota and several other plains states.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The fertile soil was blown into massive dust storms, and several crops were completely destroyed.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The experiences of the Dust Bowl, coupled with the seizure of local banks and the general economic effects of the Great Depression, have led many South Dakota to leave the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The population of South Dakota declined by more than 7 per cent between 1930 and 1940.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Economic stability returned with the entry of the United States into the Second World War in 1941, when demand for state agricultural and industrial products increased as the nation mobilized for the war.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1944, the Pick–Sloan Plan was passed by the U.S. Congress as part of the 1944 Flood Control Act, resulting in the construction of six major dams on the Missouri River, four of which are at least partially in South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The control of floods, hydropower and recreational activities such as boating and fishing is carried out by dams and their reservoirs.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Over the past few decades, South Dakota has moved from an agricultural-dominated state to a more diversified state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The tourism industry has grown considerably since the completion of the interstate system in the 1960s, with the Black Hills becoming an increasingly important destination.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The financial services industry also began to grow in the state, with the transfer of Citibank's credit card transactions from New York to Sioux Falls in 1981, a movement that was followed by several other financial companies.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota was the first State to eliminate interest rate ceilings.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2007, the recently closed Homestake gold mine site near Lead was selected as a site for a new underground research facility, the Deep Underground Science and Engineering Laboratory.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Despite the growth of the state's population and recent economic development, many rural areas have struggled over the past 50 years with the decline of local populations and the emigration of educated young adults to major South Dakota cities, such as Rapid City or Sioux Falls, or to other states.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Mechanization and consolidation of agriculture have greatly contributed to the reduction in the number of small family farms and the resulting economic and demographic difficulties for rural cities.

name: south_dakota
sentence: However, the state often ranks first for its way of life, and Gallup's 2018 Well-Being Index named South Dakota the happiest and most healthy state in the United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The U.S. Census Bureau estimates that the population of South Dakota was 884,659 on July 1, 2019, an increase of 8.66 per cent since the 2010 U.S. census, while only North Dakota, Alaska, Vermont and Wyoming have fewer residents.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2019, the population of South Dakota was estimated at 884,659, an increase of 70,479 or 8.66% since 2010.

name: south_dakota
sentence: 7.3% of the South Dakota population was under 5 years of age, 24% under 18 years of age and 14.3% over 65 years of age.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Women make up about 50.2 per cent of the population.

name: south_dakota
sentence: At the 2000 census, South Dakota was the fifth lowest of the nation in terms of population and population density.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Of South Dakota's inhabitants, 65.7 per cent were born in South Dakota, 31.4 per cent were born in another U.S. state, 0.6 per cent were born in Puerto Rico, the U.S. islands or abroad to American parents, and 2.3 per cent were born in another country.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The South Dakota population centre is located in Buffalo County, in the unincorporated county seat of Gann Valley County.

name: south_dakota
sentence: According to the 2010 Census, the racial composition of the population was as follows:

name: south_dakota
sentence: Ethnically, 2.7% of the population of South Dakota was of Hispanic, Latin or Spanish origin (they may be of any race).

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2011, 25.4% of the population of South Dakota under 1 years of age were minorities, which means that they had at least one non-Hispanic white parent.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2000, the five largest ancestry groups in South Dakota were German (40.7%), Norwegian (15.3%), Irish (10.4%), Native American (8.3%) and English (7.1%).

name: south_dakota
sentence: American Germans are the largest ancestry group in most parts of the state, especially in the East River (east of Missouri), although there are also large Scandinavian populations in some counties.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has the largest population of Hutterites, a community group of Anabaptists who emigrated from Europe in 1874, mainly from German-speaking regions.

name: south_dakota
sentence: American Indians, largely Lakota, Dakota and Nakota (Sioux), are predominant in several counties and account for 20% of the West River population.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The seven major Indian reserves of the state occupy a very small area compared to the former Sioux Great Reserve of the West River, which the federal government had previously attributed to the Sioux tribes.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has the third highest proportion of Indians in any state, behind Alaska and New Mexico.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Five of the state's counties are entirely within the borders of sovereign Indian reserves.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Due to the limitations of climate and land and the isolation of urban areas with higher employment opportunities, the standard of living on many South Dakota reserves is often well below the national average; Ziebach County ranked as the poorest county in the nation in 2009.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The unemployment rate in Fort Thompson, Crow Creek Reserve, is 70% and 21% of households do not have plumbing or basic kitchen appliances.

name: south_dakota
sentence: A 1995 study by the U.S. Census Bureau found that 58% of households on the Pine Ridge Indian Reserve did not have telephones.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The isolation of reserves also hinders their ability to generate income from gaming casinos, an avenue that has proved profitable for many tribes closer to urban centres.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1995, the legislature passed a law to make English the "common language" of the State.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Since 2019, "the language of the Great Sioux Nation, composed of three dialects, Dakota, Lakota and Nakota" is an official language.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In the 2000 census, 1.90 per cent of the population aged 5 years or older speak German at home, 1.51 per cent speak Lakota or Dakota and 1.43 per cent speak Spanish.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2010, 93.46 per cent (692,504) of South Dakota residents aged 5 years and older spoke English as their main language.

name: south_dakota
sentence: 6.54% of the population spoke languages other than English.

name: south_dakota
sentence: 2.06 % (15,292) of the population spoke Spanish, 1.39 % (10,282) Dakota and 1.37% (10,140) German.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Other languages spoken were Vietnamese (0.16 per cent), Chinese (0.12 per cent) and Russian (0.10 per cent).

name: south_dakota
sentence: Over the past few decades, the population of many rural areas has declined in South Dakota, as in other states of the Great Plains.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The change was referred to as "rural flight" as family farming declined.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Young people settled in cities for other jobs.

name: south_dakota
sentence: This trend has continued in recent years, with 30 counties of South Dakota losing their population between 1990 and 2000.

name: south_dakota
sentence: During this period, nine counties suffered a population loss of more than 10 per cent, with Harding County in the northwest corner of the state losing nearly 19 per cent of its population.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Low birth rates and lack of young immigrants have led to an increase in the median age of many of these counties.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 24 counties, at least 20 per cent of the population is over the age of 65, compared with a national rate of 12.8 per cent.

name: south_dakota
sentence: However, the effect of rural leakage has not been uniformly spread in South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Although most rural counties and small towns have lost population, the Sioux Falls region, the largest counties along Interstate 29, the Black Hills and many Indian reserves have all gained population.

name: south_dakota
sentence: As the reservations exercised more sovereignty, some Sioux returned to them from urban areas.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Lincoln County, near Sioux Falls, recorded the seventh fastest growth (in percent) in the United States in 2010.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Growth in these regions has compensated for losses in the rest of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The total population of South Dakota continues to grow steadily, but at a slower rate than the national average.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The largest denominations by membership in 2010 were the Roman Catholic Church with 148,883 members; the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America (ELCA) with 112,649 members; and the United Methodist Church (UMC) with 36,020 members.

name: south_dakota
sentence: (ELCA and UMC are specific denominations in the broader terms "Lutheran" and "methodist", respectively.

name: south_dakota
sentence: )The results of a 2001 survey in which the South Dakotas were asked to identify their religion include:

name: south_dakota
sentence: Government revenue in current South Dakota dollars was $39.8 billion in 2010, the fifth lowest state output in the United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Personal per capita income was $38,865 in 2010, ranked 25th in the United States, and 12.5 per cent of the population was below the poverty line in 2008.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In July 2011, the state unemployment rate was 4.7 per cent.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The services industry is the largest economic contributor to South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: This sector includes the retail, financial and health care industries.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Citibank, which was the largest bank holding company in the United States at one time, established domestic banking operations in South Dakota in 1981 in order to take advantage of favourable banking regulation.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Public spending is another important segment of the government economy, accounting for more than ten per cent of gross national product.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Ellsworth Air Force Base near Rapid City is the second largest employer in the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Agriculture has always been a key element of the South Dakota economy.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Although other industries have expanded rapidly in recent decades, agricultural production remains very important to the state economy, particularly in rural areas.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The five most valuable agricultural products in South Dakota are cattle, corn, soybeans, wheat and pigs.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Agriculture-related industries such as meat packaging and ethanol production also have a considerable economic impact on the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is the sixth largest ethanol producer in the country.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Another important sector of South Dakota's economy is tourism.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Many travel to see the attractions of the state, particularly those of the Black Hills area, such as the historic Deadwood, Rushmore Mount and neighbouring national and state parks.

name: south_dakota
sentence: One of the largest tourist events in the state is the annual Sturgis Motorcycle Rally.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The five-day event attracted more than 739,000 participants in 2015; given the state has a total population of 850,000.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2006, tourism provided about 33,000 jobs in the state and contributed more than $2 billion to the South Dakota economy.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has 83,609 miles (134556 km) of highways, roads and streets, as well as 679 miles (1,093 km) of interstate highways.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Two major interstates cross South Dakota: Interstate 90, which crosses the southern half of the state to the east and west, and Interstate 29, which runs to the north and south in the eastern part of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Corridor I-29 generally has higher population and economic growth rates than eastern South Dakota regions more distant from the interstate.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Also in the state are the shorter Interstate 190, a spur in the centre of Rapid City, and 229, a loop around the south and east Sioux Falls.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Several major American highways cross the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: American roads 12, 14, 16, 18 and 212 go east and west, while American roads 81, 83, 85 and 281 go north and south.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota and Montana are the only states that share a land border that is not crossed by an asphalt road.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has two national access routes.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Peter Norbeck National Scenic Byway is located in the Black Hills, while the Native American Scenic Byway runs along the Missouri River in the north central part of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Other scenic passages include the Badlands Loop Scenic Byway, the Spearfish Canyon Scenic Byway and the Wildlife Loop Road Scenic Byway.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Railways have played an important role in transport in South Dakota since the mid-19th century.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Some 7,110 kilometres of railway were built in South Dakota in the late 19th century and early 20th century, but only 2,960 kilometres are active.

name: south_dakota
sentence: BNSF Railway is the largest railway in South Dakota; Rapid City, Pierre and Eastern Railroad (formerly Dakota, Minnesota and East) are the other major carriers of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Other state carriers include Dakota Southern Railway, Dakota and Iowa Railroad, Ellis and Eastern Railroad, Sunfloor Railroad, Canadian Pacific Railway and Sisseton Milbank Railroad.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Rail transportation in the state is primarily freight, but there are two historic passenger railways: Black Hills Central and Prairie Village, Herman and Milwaukee.

name: south_dakota
sentence: However, South Dakota is one of two contiguous states that have no Amtrak service.

name: south_dakota
sentence: (South Dakota is the only contiguous state that has never had Amtrak—Wyoming was served by San Francisco Zephyr and Pioneer.)

name: south_dakota
sentence: The largest commercial airports in South Dakota in terms of passenger traffic are the Sioux Falls Regional Airport and the Rapid City Regional Airport.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Delta Air Lines, Frontier Airlines and Allegiant Airlines, as well as the suburban airlines that use the affiliate brand with the major airlines, serve the two largest airports.

name: south_dakota
sentence: A number of other government cities also have commercial air services: Aberdeen Regional Airport, Pierre Regional Airport and Watertown Regional Airport, some of which are subsidized by the essential air services program.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Like other American states, the structure of the South Dakota government follows the same separation of powers as the federal government, with executive, legislative and judicial powers.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The structure of the Government of the State is set out in the Constitution of South Dakota, the highest law of the State.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Constitution may be amended by a majority vote of both Houses of Parliament or by election initiative.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Governor of South Dakota occupies the executive power of the Government of the State.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The present governor is Kristi Noem, a Republican.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Constitution of the State gives the Governor the power to sign laws or bills on the veto adopted by the legislature of the State, to exercise the functions of commander-in-chief of the National Guard of South Dakota, to appoint a cabinet, to commute criminal penalties or to pardon persons convicted of crimes.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Governor shall be appointed for a term of four years and shall not serve more than two consecutive terms.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Parliament is composed of two bodies, the 35-member Senate and the 70-member House of Representatives.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is divided into 35 legislative districts, with electors electing two representatives and one senator per district.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Parliament meets for an annual session which starts on the second Tuesday in January and lasts 30 days

name: south_dakota
sentence: The judiciary is made up of several levels.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Supreme Court of the State, with four judges and one chief justice, is the highest court in the State.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Below the Supreme Court are the circuit courts.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Below the district courts are the courts of first instance, which deal with less important criminal and civil cases.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2005, South Dakota had the lowest national tax rate in the United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Crown does not collect personal or corporate income taxes, estate taxes, or taxes on intangible personal property.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The state sales tax rate is 4.5%.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Various localities have local levies, so in some regions the rate is 6%.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The government's sales tax does not apply to Indian sales on Indian reserves, but many reserves have an agreement with the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: On-reserve businesses collect the tax and government refunds from Indian tribes the percentage of sales tax collected in relation to the ratio of the Indian population to the total population of the affected county or area.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Ad valorem property taxes are local taxes and are an important source of financing for school systems, counties, municipalities and other local governments.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The South Dakota Special Tax Division regulates certain taxes, such as cigarette and alcohol taxes.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is represented at the federal level by Senator John Thune, Senator Mike Rounds and Representative Dusty Johnson.

name: south_dakota
sentence: All three are Republicans.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota is one of the seven states with a single seat in the United States House of Representatives.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In the United States presidential election, South Dakota received three out of 538 votes in the Electoral College.

name: south_dakota
sentence: As in all other states with the exception of the neighbouring Maine and Nebraska, the electoral votes of South Dakota are granted in a system of capture of all the victors.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota policy is generally dominated by the Republican Party.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Since the establishment of the state, the Republicans have won state electoral votes in all but five presidential elections: 1896, 1912 (by the Progressive Party of Theodore Roosevelt), 1932, 1936 and 1964.

name: south_dakota
sentence: (Democratic George McGovern, from South Dakota, did not carry his country of origin in 1972.)

name: south_dakota
sentence: Only Alaska has been worn fewer times by a democrat.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In addition, a democrat has not won the post of governor since 1974.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2016, the Republicans had a 15% advantage over the Democrats and held large majorities in the Chamber of State and the Senator of State.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Despite the republican and conservative general tendencies of the state, Democrats have been successful in various state-wide elections, including those involving representatives of the South Dakota Congress in Washington.

name: south_dakota
sentence: American Indians have become more active in state and county electoral politics.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In the 2002 election, the American Indian vote carried Tim Johnson as a Democratic candidate with a margin of 532 votes.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Until his election defeat in 2004, Senator Tom Daschle was the Senators' minority leader (and briefly his majority leader during the democratic control of Senators in 2001-2002).

name: south_dakota
sentence: Other prominent Democrats in South Dakota include former presidential candidates George McGovern and Hubert Humphrey.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2016, South Dakota voted for Republican candidate Donald Trump against democratic candidate Hillary Clinton with a margin of 30%.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2018, Republican MP Kristi Noem defeated Democrat Billie Sutton in the Liberal election by a small margin, and Republican Dusty Johnson defeated Democrat Tim Bjorkman for the seat of state in the US House of Representatives.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Contemporary political issues in South Dakota include the costs and benefits of the state lottery, the relatively low ranking of South Dakota in education expenditures (especially teachers' salaries — recently, the state sales tax was increased from 4 per cent to 4.5 per cent to fund an increase in teachers' salaries), and recent legislative and electoral attempts to ban abortion in the State.

name: south_dakota
sentence: A bill supported by the Republicans passed in March 2019 requires that all public schools display "In God we have confidence" in a prominent place.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota culture reflects the Indian, rural, western and European roots of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: A number of annual events celebrating the state's ethnic and historical heritage are held around the state, such as Days of '76 in Deadwood, Czech Days in Tabor, and the annual festivities of St. Patrick and Cinco de Mayo in Sioux Falls.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The different tribes hold many annual pow wows on their reserves throughout the state, to which non-Aboriginal Americans are sometimes invited.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Custer State Park holds an annual Buffalo Roundup, in which horse volunteers gather the park's herd of approximately 1,500 bison.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Black Elk (Lakota) was a medical and heyokha man whose life extended to the transition to reserves.

name: south_dakota
sentence: His stories of the Indian War movement and 19th-century phantom dance, and his deep thoughts on personal visions and Amerindian religion, formed the basis of the book Black Elk Speaks, first published in 1932.

name: south_dakota
sentence: (Among several editions, an annotated first edition was published in 2008.)

name: south_dakota
sentence: Paul Goble, author and illustrator of award-winning children's books, has been based in Black Hills since 1977.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Laura Ingalls Wilder, whose semi-autobiographical books are based on her experiences as a child and young adult at the border, is one of the best known writers in South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: She derived her life from a house near De Smet as the basis for five of her novels: By the Shores of Silver Lake, The Long Winter, Little Town on the Prairie, This Happy Golden Years and The First Four Years.

name: south_dakota
sentence: They gained a renewed popularity in the United States when Little House on the Prairie was adapted and produced as a television series in 1974.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Wilder's daughter Rose Wilder Lane was born near De Smet in 1886.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota has also produced several outstanding artists.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Harvey Dunn grew up in a home near Manchester in the late 19th century.

name: south_dakota
sentence: While Dunn worked most of his career as a commercial illustrator, his most famous works showed various scenes of border life; he finished these near the end of his career.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Oscar Howe (Crow) was born on the Crow Creek Indian Reserve and won fame for his watercolour paintings.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Howe was one of the first Amerindian painters to adopt techniques and style strongly influenced by the mid-20th century abstraction movement, rather than relying on traditional Amerindian styles.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Terry Redlin, a native of Watertown, was an accomplished painter of rural scenes and wildlife.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Many of his works are on display at the Redlin Art Center in Watertown.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Sioux Falls is the largest city in South Dakota, with a population of 153,888 inhabitants in 2010 and a metropolitan area of 238,122 inhabitants.The city, founded in 1856, is located in the southeast corner of the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Retailing, finance and health care became more important in Sioux Falls, where the economy was originally focused on agro-industry and careers.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Rapid City, with a population of 67,956 in 2010 and a metropolitan area of 124,766, is the second largest city in the state.

name: south_dakota
sentence: It is located at the eastern end of the Black Hills and was founded in 1876.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Rapid City's economy is largely based on tourism and defence spending, due to the proximity to many tourist attractions in the Black Hills and Ellsworth Air Force Base.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Aberdeen (26,091), Brookings (22,056), Watertown (21,482), Mitchell (15,254), Yankton (14,454), Pierre (13,646), Huron (12,592), and Vermillion (10,571).

name: south_dakota
sentence: Pierre is the capital of the state, and Brookings and Vermillion are the sites of the two largest universities in the state (the State University of South Dakota and the University of South Dakota, respectively).

name: south_dakota
sentence: With a population of approximately 14,000, Pierre is the second smallest state capital in the United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Of the ten largest cities in the state, only Rapid City is west of Missouri.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The first South Dakota newspaper, the Democratic Dakota, started publishing in Yankton in 1858.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Today, the largest newspaper in the State is the Sioux Falls Argus Leader, with a Sunday draw of 63,701 and a weekday draw of 44,334 copies.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Rapid City Journal, with a Sunday draw of 32,638 and a Sunday draw of 27,827, is the second largest newspaper in South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The other four largest newspapers in the state are Aberdeen American News, Watertown Public Opinion, Huron Plainsman and Brookings Register.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 1981, Tim Giago founded the Lakota Times as a newspaper for the local American Indian community on the Pine Ridge Indian Reserve.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The newspaper, now published in New York and known as Indian Country Today, is available in all the states of the country.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Sioux City Journal also covers parts of South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Nine television stations broadcast programs in South Dakota; South Dakota public television broadcasts programs in a number of locations around the state, while the other stations broadcast programs in Sioux Falls or Rapid City.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The two largest television markets in South Dakota are Sioux Falls-Mitchell, with a hearing of 246,020 and Rapid City, with a hearing of 91,070.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The two markets rank respectively 114th and 177th largest in the United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The first state television station, KELO-TV, began broadcasting at Sioux Falls in 1953.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Among KELO's first programs was Captain 11, an afternoon children's program.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Captain 11 ran from 1955 to 1996, making him the longest children's television program in the country.

name: south_dakota
sentence: A number of South Dakotas are famous for their work in TV and publishing.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The former anchor and author of NBC Nightly News Tom Brokaw is from Webster and Yankton, USA Today the founder Al Neuharth was from Eureka and Alpena, the game host Bob Barker spent much of his childhood in Mission, and entertainment news animators Pat O'Brien and Mary Hart are from Sioux Falls.

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2006, there were 136,872 students enrolled in primary and secondary schools in South Dakota, 120,278 of whom were enrolled in the public school system.

name: south_dakota
sentence: There are 703 public schools in 168 school districts, giving South Dakota the highest number of schools per capita in the United States.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The current high school graduation rate is 89.9%, and the average TCA score is 21.8%, slightly higher than the national average of 21.1.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Of the adult population, 89.8% had at least one high school diploma and 25.8% had one or more bachelor's degrees.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The average salary of teachers in public schools in South Dakota of $36,674 in 2008 was the lowest in the nation (the national average was $52,308).

name: south_dakota
sentence: In 2007, South Dakota passed a law inspired by the Indian Education for All Act (1999) of Montana, which requires education on Amerindian tribal history, culture and heritage in all schools, from kindergarten to college, in order to increase the knowledge and appreciation of Indian culture among all residents of the state and to enhance understanding of Indian students' contributions to their own cultures.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Council of Regents of South Dakota, whose members are appointed by the Governor, oversees the six public universities of the State.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota State University (SDSU) in Brookings is the largest university in the state, with a registration of 12,831.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The University of South Dakota (USD), in Vermillion, is the oldest university in the state and has the only school of law and medicine in South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota also has a number of private universities, the largest of which is the Augustana University of Sioux Falls.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Due to its low population, South Dakota does not host large professional sports franchises.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The state has minor leagues and independent leagues, all of which play in Sioux Falls or Rapid City.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Sioux Falls has four teams: the Sioux Falls Canaris (baseball), the Sioux Falls Skyforce (basketball), the Sioux Falls Stampede (hockey) and the Sioux Falls Storm (inside American football).

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Canary Islands play in the American Association, and their home field is Sioux Falls Stadium.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Skyforces play in the NBA G League and are owned by Miami Heat from the NBA.

name: south_dakota
sentence: They play the Sanford Pentagon.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Stampede and Storm share the Denny Sanford Premier Center.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Stampede plays in the USHL, and Storm plays in the IFL.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Rapid City has a hockey team named Rapid City Rush that plays in the ECHL.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The Rush began its inaugural season in 2008 at Rushmore Plaza Civic Center.

name: south_dakota
sentence: South Dakota universities run various sports programmes.

name: south_dakota
sentence: For many years, South Dakota was one of the only states in the country without a NCAA Division I football or basketball team.

name: south_dakota
sentence: However, several years ago, SDSU decided to transfer its teams from Division II to Division I, a move followed by the University of South Dakota.

name: south_dakota
sentence: Other government universities compete at NCAA or NAIA Division II or III levels.

name: south_dakota
sentence: The famous South Dakota athletes include Billy Mills, Mike Miller, Mark Ellis, Becky Hammon, Brock Lesnar, Chad Greenway and Adam Vinatieri.

name: south_dakota
